In each canto he made an effort to fuse the styles and modes of narration of the three major chivalric poems--Pulci's Morgante , Bojardo's Orlando Inamorato , and Ariost's Furioso .
PROSE COMEDIES

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This volume contains 2 plays and a scenario for a commedia dell'arte . 96 numbered leaves, including 17 blanks. Ms. on paper. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. N.pl., n.d.

did.unittitle: Il Rodrigo, ovvero la Costanza in Amore. Play. Name of author not given. 38 leaves, numbered 1-38.
La Pellegrina. Play. No author's name. 36 leaves, numbered ff. 39-73.
A scenario for a commedia dell'arte . No author or title given. 6 leaves, numbered ff. 91-96.
LEGAL DICTIONARY
This volume contains a dictionary of Latin legal terms. Ms. on paper. 299 leaves. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. N.pl., n.d.
At the end, long lists of names, ranged according to dates. The dictionary is partly thumb-indexed.
PTOLEMAEUS, CLAUDIUS. GEOGRAPHIA.

Edited by Giuseppe Moleto. 4 leaves, 112, 186 pages, blank leaves, 32 leaves (some light damp marks). With 63 (of 64) engraved double page maps, text on the versos. 4to. Contemporary vellum. Venice, Vincentio Valgrisi, 1562.

Ptolemaeus, Claudius, Geographia. An important Ptolemy edition. Giuseppe Moleto from Messina (1531-1588), professor of mathematics in Padua, revised the Latin translation by Willibald Pirckheimer and supplied an extensive commentary to books 1 and 7. The very fine engraved maps had first appeared in Ruscelli's Italian Ptolemy edition. All except four are based upon Gastaldi's maps to the pocket edition of 1548. Ruscelli's maps are extremely well designed and became very influential in the development of cartography. His world map (no. 2) is the first engraved representation of the world divided into two spheres, the right half showing the old and the left half showing the new world. The following nine maps refer to America: Orbis descriptio; Tierra Nova; Brasil Nuova Tavola; Nueva Hispania; Tierra Nueva; Isola Spagnola Nova; Septentrionalium Partium Nova Tabula; Isola Cuva Nova; Schonlandia Nova. The second world map, "Carta Marina," (No. 3) is lacking in this copy.
Sabin 66489; Harrisse 239 (incomplete); J.C. Brown I (1), p. 217; Ricciardi II, 163 ("Bella e rara ediz."); Nordenskioeld, Faksimile-Atlas , p. 29.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: in manuscript, 18 in print. 860 pages and 4 pages index. In Italian and Latin. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, c. 1640-1736.

did.unittitle: Spolverino, Ottavanio. Disfeda alli Signori Giovanni Francesco Bevilaqua e Marchese Horazio Canossa. 44 printed folio pages, folded, numbered ff. 3-24. Printed documents in the legal suit of Spolverino against Bevilaqua and Canossa, dated from 1648 to 1657. The last 2 leaves slightly defective. N.p., n.d.

Fattione seguita in Roma fra il Marchese de Los Veles Amb. di Spagna et il Vescovo di Lamego, Amb. di Portogallo fatto li 20 Agosto 1640. Ms. document. 6 pages, numbered ff. 25-28. Small 4to. Ms. report on the controversy between the Spanish and Portuguese ambassadors in Rome, on Aug. 20, 1640. At the end, an epigram in Latin on the affair.

Ristretto del Processo e della Sentenza contra Michele Molinos...Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 29-32. Concerning the process by the Jesuits and the Inquisition against Michele Molinos, Spanish Quietist in Rome. He was arrested in Rome in 1685.
Errori principali intorno la nuova contemplatione overo Oratione di quieti. 1685. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 33-35. Contains 19 points concerning the dogma of Quietism.

Copia di fatto scritto ad un Cavaliere. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered 36-39. Concerns a controversy between a Marchese Fontana and a Count Aldrovani which occured on Feb. 26, 1686 on account of a horse.
Contrasto Curioso tra il Governatore d'una Citta ed il vescovo... Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 40-41. Concerns a controversy between the governor of a city and a bishop. Undated.

A Cavalieri. Printed letter, dated June 14, 1689, signed by Francesco Maria Vaini and Alesandro Mignanelli. 3 4to pages, with an insert of a 3 page printed letter in 8vo, signed by hand by Ottavio del Bufalo, dated May 6, 1689. Concerning a controversy between three gentlemen. Numbered ff. 42-45.

Acciaioli, Ruberto. Relazione del successo e delli Accidenti del Matrimonio del Cavaliere Ruberto Acciaioli con la Signora Lisabetta Mormorai... Printed document, 10 pages, numbered ff. 46-52. Various documents 1690-1691 concerning the marriage between R. Acciaioli and Lisabetta Mormorai.

Galanterie di due Fr. Minori non-Osservanti de S. Francisco. Ms. in Italian. 61 pages, numbered ff. 54-85. Concerning a French and an Italian member of the Order of the Minorites. Dates mentioned are August to October 1697.
Ristretto del processo e sentenza contra Simone Leoni...della Diocesi di Como. Ms. in Italian, 3 pages, numbered ff. 86-87. Undated.
Ristretto della Sentenza contro Antonio Maria Leoni da Scabiegla...della Diocese di Como. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 88-89. Legal sentences against Antonio Maria Leoni. Undated.
Baldeschi-Colonna, Cardinal Frederigo. Difesa. Ms. in Italian. 20 pages, numbered ff. 90-99. Defense of Cardinal Baldeschi, who was nuncio in Switzerland. No date (after 1657).
Crescenzi, Serlupi. Lettera scritta al Alessandro Capizucchi. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 100). Dated 25 Jan., 1598. A letter of resentment and reproaches.

Ristretto della sentenza di Fra Pietro Paolo di San Giovanni Evangelista Agostiniana Scalzo, abjurato di 26.novembre 1698. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 101-104. Small 4to. Judgement against an Augustinian painter.
Durante, Filippo Maria. Two letters to Cardinal Carpegna regarding the Abbot Carlo Spinola. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 105-110. Not dated.
Processo e fulminazione di condanna contro un omicidiario de Palombacci. Ms. in Italian. 22 pages, numbered ff. 111-121. Signed by Gio. Fred. Simone, Cardinale, dated 1710.
Abjura semipublica...l'anno 1703. Ms. in Italian. 20 pages, numbered ff. 123-132. Abjuration by a nun. 1703.
Romana Plurium. Sacra Consulta...contra D. Abbatem Ioannem Franciscum Conestabilem. Printed pamphlets. 177 pages, numbered ff. 133-210. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1703-1704. Official legal writs.

Vercellen. Plurim in Criminalibus. Sacra Congregatione Episcoporum & Regularium...pro Io. Andrea Ginnesio Sacerdote Professio Religionis Somaschae contra R. Promortem Fiscalem eiusdem Congregationis. Printed legal writs. 62 pages, numbered ff. 211-241. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1704.
Il sottocuocco de Cavalieri. Ms. in Italian. 4to. 2 pages, numbered f. 242. An accusation against an undercook. Undated.
Altezza Reale. Memoriale d'un Galantuomo Romano. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 244-245. Report of a crime committed on May 6, 1706.

Francesco Bernardino Marchese Pallavicini. Dichiarazione circa il fatto seguito nel Golfo di Santo Stefano nel mese di Novembre 1706. Printed statement. 4 pages, numbered ff. 248-249. Dated Feb. 1709. Rome, nella stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1709.
Consumati Li Soliti Ceremoniali à Corfu. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 250-251. Folio, folded. Report on an event in Corfu. Undated.
Si come e massima stabilita... Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 252). Statement concerning the Count Capozucchi. Undated.

Erizo, Niccolo, Venetian ambassador to Rome. A Cavalieri d'onore. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 253-254. Copy of a letter concerning an engagement between Erizzo and the Marchese Crescenzi. Dated Rome, Feb. 15, 1701.

Rimostranza delle Ragioni del Signor Prencipe di Messerano... Printed pamphlet in Italian. 23 pages, numbered ff. 255-266. N.p., n.d. Concerning a quarrel between the Court of Rome and the Prince of Messerano. (After 1688).
Scrittura per la Pace tra il Sig. Benedetto Baglioni et il Sig. Tiberio Baldeschi. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 267-268. Undated.
Relatione di due Battuti D. Frabritio Spinelli e D. Fabio... Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 269-272. Report on a duel. Undated.
Decreta Congregationi Criminali Militarium. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 273-274. Decree concerning a delinquent soldier, dated Nov. 29, 1708.

Malaspina, Fr. Ridolfo. Risposta dell'Assentista delle Galere Pontificie alle Scrittura date in Sagra Consulta. Printed legal document. 20 pages, numbered ff. 275-284. N.p., Typis de Comitibus, 1711. Concerning a boating accident.
Relazione di quello che e seguito della Terra dell' Ariccia... nel Octobre 1712. Ms. in Italian. 10 pages, numbered ff. 285-289. Report of an incident that took place in 1712.

Copia di Memoriale presentato alla Santita di Papa Innocent XIII... di Giovanni Antoni Marini Carcerato. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 290-291. Copy of a petition sent by a prisoner to Pope Innocent XIII (1721-1724).

Manifest del Marchese d'Oyra Imperiale che il fatto seguito li 19 Aprile 1723 con il Conte di Conversano nella Citta di Napoli. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 294-296. 2 leaves folio and 2 leaves 4to.
Enormita del P. Felice Cunerti Minor Conventuale, che fu abjurato scatolaro. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 294-296. 4to. 1725.
Nella Barigella 20.Majo 1728. Dispareri tra il Marchese Bavia et il Conte Ruffo Nipote del Cardinale Legato di Bologna. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 297-302.
Impegno tra l'Auditore della Camera et il Governore. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 305-307. Signed by Pope Clement XI, Rome, 29 July, 1718.

Alberoni, Cardinal Giulio. Lettera scritta all' eminentissimo Sig. Cardinale Paolucci. 3 printed letters in Italian. 47 pages, numbered ff. 308-331. The first letter is dated March 1, 1721. The correspondence concerns the tense relations between Alberoni and the other Cardinals.

Voto Dell'En...Signor Cardinale Fabroni in congiuntura della Promozione del Cardinal Coscia il di 11.Giugno 1725. And other documents concerning Cardinal Niccolo Coscia: consisting of 8 printed documents, including Pope Clement XII's sentence against Cardinal Coscia, and 5 ms. documents in Italian, including two in verse form. Altogether 72 pages, numbered ff. 332-372. Various sizes.
Prima minuta di Lettera di Mano di Monsignor Sardini trovata in sua casa. Three ms. documents concerning Giacomo Sardini. Altogether 36 pages, numbered ff. 373-393. Dated 1731.

In Dei Nomine Amen. Copia publica cuiusdam Sententiae deffinitive...in Tribunali Gubernii Urbis de Ordine Sacrae Consultae...pro Nobile D. Agnete Paci Aesina...contra Curiam & Fiscum. Printed document. 3 pages, numbered ff. 396-397. Rome, Typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1736. (In Latin).
Falsificazione di Cedole contratatte con certi Ebrei di Ancona. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 398-401. Concerning the Jews of Ancona. Dated 1727.
Condanna di galer a Cinque Anni in Persona di Pasquale Mirella e Nicola Porcari. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 402-403. Dated 1729.

Distinta Relazione della scelerata morte di Angiolo Sechiarolo... Condannato a morire...11 di Giugno 1729 nella Citta di Ancona. Printed leaflet. Ancona, stamperia Belelli, 1729. 8vo. 4 unnumbered pages.
Relazione delle Bestialita et Eresie de i Beccarelli di Brescia. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 404-405. Dated 1708.
Uccisione di Mons. Magalotti Governatore di Roma. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 406-411. Concerning the murder of Magalotti during the Papacy of Clement VII, in 1530.
Relazione della morte di Giogio Picknon, Hirlandese succeduta in Roma il 1595. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 412-415.
Morte di Due Scelerati Norcini seguita in Roma nel Pontificato d'Urbano VIII, a 3.Febrajo, 1638. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 416-419.
Omicidio del Conte Fiume maestro di Camera della Principessa Chigi Regnante. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 420-425. The murder occurred under the Papacy of Alexander VII in 1665.
Giustizia Seguita in Roma delle Donna dell'Acquetta sotto il Pontificato d'Alessandro VII anno 1668. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 426-430.
Morte del Abbate Rivarola nel Pontificato di Clemente XI, anno 1708. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 431-434.
Succinta Relazione della Vita e Morte di Gaetano Vulpini. Ms. in Italian. 14 pages, numbered ff. 435-441. Dated 1720.
Morte del Conte Trivelli. Ms. in Italian. 14 pages, numbered ff. 443-449. Dated 1734.
Morte d'Abramo et Angelo Ebrei. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 451-456. Dated 1736.
MISCELLANEOUS DOCUMENTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: comprising 474 pages, numbered ff. 1-265. 4to. 18th century vellum. Italy, 18th century.

did.unittitle: Il Parlamento Ottaviana. Printed propostion for the publication of the proceedings of a literary club that assembled in the house of Marchese Ottaviano. The plan is to publish the proceedings beginning with 1763. 4 pages. Small 8vo.

Prospetto di una Edizione Fiorentina dell' Enciclopedia. Printed pamhlet. 22 pages, numbered ff. 4-15. Small 8vo. (Florence), 1770. Pre- publication announcement of an Italian translation of Diderot-D'Alembert's Grande Encyclopedie .

Remerciment d'un particulier à Messieurs les Philosophes du Jour. Printed pamphlet in French. 8 pages. Small 8vo, uncut. Ridiculing the anti- religious ideas of the 18th century French philosophers, i.e. the rationalists. N.p., n.d.

Lettera d'un amico ad un suo concittadino... Printed pamphlet, 48 pages (not quite complete), numbered ff. 20-43. 8vo., uncut. Avignon, 1759. Translated from the French, this letter deals with the attempt to assassinate Louis XIV and proves that Robert François Damiens, the would-be assassin, had accomplices. It also describes the process against him.
Constantinopoli. News on events from Florence, Civitavecchia, Constantinople, Egypt, etc., possibly from a journey. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages. 8vo. No date.

Veridica e distinta relazione della funesta ruina della Terra di Montepiano nella Diocesi di Chieti, occorsa il di 24.Giugno, 1765. Printed report, 4 pages, on the storm and landslide that destroyed the town. Rome, Stamperia del Chracas, 1765.
Clement XIII, Pope. Nomina, Cognomina...Printed list of appointments to church offices made by the Pope. 3 pages, numbered ff. 52-53. 8vo. Sept. 1766.

Serra, Giannangelo. Lettera instruttiva...alli Signori Difensori del Pupillo Maldenti nella nota celebratissima Causa. Printed pamphlet. 19 pages. Ravenna, 1753. Letter by Serra, professor of eloquence, to the lawyers of Maldenti, a youth involved in a trial concerning a disputed inheritance.

Brevis oratio. Galba Paolo Emilio triumphum impedire nititur. A theoretical speech, probably held by a student of eloquence, in which Galba states his reasons for opposing the triumph of Paulus Emilius during the Third Macedonian War in the second century. Ms. in Latin. 10 pages. Undated.
Review of a theological treatise. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. Dated Vienna, June 6, 1770.

Relazione dell'enormi delitti commesse nella Citta di Modena... Printed pamphlet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 74-75. Modena and Rome, n.d. (c. 1768). Report on Puggioli, a shoemaker of Modena, who was executed on Dec. 22, 1768, for committing atrocious murders.
Relazione della segnalata vittoria... Account of Laudhon's victory at Landshut over the Prussian troops commanded by General Fouquet, on June 22 and 23, 1760. Printed pamphlet. 4 pages. Rome, 1760.
Regali che si sogliono ricevere... List of the presents received customarily on Ferragosto day by the superintendent of roads, water works, etc. Ms. 2 pages, numbered ff. 78-79. 1721 and 1722.

Ravizza, Francesco, of Oriveto. Biographical notes on his career and appointments: he was made Bishop by Pope Alexander VII and Papal Nuncio to Portugal by Pope Clement X in 1670. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 82).
Nota della provisione...del Bargello. Ms. in Italian, with accounts. 2 pages. Small 4to. Undated.
Progresso. Progress report on a new river canal. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Undated.

German Emperors. Three letters in Latin to Pope Benedict XIV, the last dated Aschaffenburg, 1745. Ms. 7 pages. 8vo. The letters are by Charles VI, dated 1711; by Charles VII, dated 1742; and by Franz I, dated 1745.
Historical notes on papal and worldly history. From the 16th to the 18th century. The last entry is dated 1763. Ms. in Italian. 13 pages, various sizes, numbered ff. 95-102.

Dominicus Archepiscopus Ephesinus. Printed letters, dated Altorf, August 15, 1727. 8 pages, numbered ff. 103-106. 8vo, uncut. The Archbishop of Ephesus reccommends to the Swiss Benedictines that the Psalter should be reprinted by them and at their expense.

Risposta dell'Academico Ardente al...Abate Ridolfini Venuti sopra la citta di Corito se sia Cortona. Printed pamphlet. 12 pages, numbered ff. 107-112. An answer to Abbot Venuti's theories on the origins of Cortona which he treated in vol. 4 of the Antichita Etrusche.
Sforza, Count Antonio. Various graduation certificates bestowed by Count Sforza, perpetual commendatarius of St. Vincent in Voltorno. Ms. in Latin. 14 pages, numbered ff. 112-119.

Leopardi, Leopardo. L'Antibacchinata. Printed booklet. 8 leaves, 63 pages, numbered ff. 120-159. Macerata, Ag. Grisei, n.d. A polemical tract defending Pope Urban VIII for sending troops against Parma, in answer to a satire against the Pope's action, "Baccinata."

Distinto Ragguaglio dell'Apostolica Legazione... Printed booklet. 46 pages, numbered ff. 160-181. Venice, G. Albrizzi, 1716. An account of Cardinal Gozzandini's legation, who was sent by Pope Clement XI on occasion of the marriage of Elizabeth of Farnese to Philip V of Spain in 1714.

Relazione della grandine caduta nella Citta di Monaco... Printed pamphlet, 4 pages with full-page woodcut, numbered ff. 184-185. Rome, 1761. An account of a hailstorm that struck Munich in Bavaria on June 15, 1761.
Relazione della Condanna e morte eseguita... Printed leaflet. 4 pages, numbered 186-187. Rome, 1766. Account of the execution in Turin of a criminal, Baudolino Testa, on Oct. 31, 1766.
Lettera Scritta da un particolare di Napoli ad un suo Amico in roma. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 188-189. Dated Naples, May 26, 1733. Against a slanderer.

Distinta Relazione dell'orribile terremoto... Printed leaflet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 190-191. Rome, 1741. An account of the earthquake which struck several cities of the March region during April 1741.

Solenne Ingresso del Cardinal Odescalchi, Archivesco in Milano. Ms. 10 pages, numbered ff. 193-197. Detailed account of the festivities on the occasion of the solemn entrance of Odescalchi into Milan. Undated.

Allegrinus, Pisonius, et Socii, Typographi... Printed leaflet. 2 pages, numbered ff 198-199. Dated January 1, 1770. Announcement of the Florentine printers of a legal series in the process of publication.

Du premier Septembre 1757. Printed leaflet in French. 4 pages, numbered ff. 200-201. Two announcements of arrests by the King of France relating to the jurisdictional dispute between royal and parliamentary powers.

Vir Desideriorum. Printed pamphlet. 16 pages, numbered ff. 202-209. A set of grievances regarding misrule and abuses in the Church States, rendered in the Conclave after the death of Pope Benedict XIV (1758). In Italian.
Various notes on administrative, legal, and political matters, dated 1763. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 210).

Progetto di risposta da darsi al Cantoni di Lucerne. Ms. 3 pages, numbered ff. 211-212. Project of an answer by the Secretary of State to the authorities of the Swiss Canton Lucerne involving matters of protocol. At the end a sonnet.
Notes on diplomatic matters, dated 1760. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 213).
Conclave, June 24, 1758. Notes regarding the proceedings at conclave after the death of Pope Benedict XIV, and on other conclaves. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 214-216.
Probati Michaelis Paleoli... Enchiridion de Ratione Docendi. Printed. 4 preliminiary pages, numbered ff. 217-218. Rome, 1767.

Sommario de'Documenti citati nella Risposta al Manifesto della Spagna. Printed booklet. 86 pages, numbered ff. 219-261. Important set of diplomatic and political documents concerning relations between the Tuscan States and Spain and to the question of dynastic succession in Central Italy. Vienna, nella stamperia Imperiale, 1734.
Index. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 263-265.
MISCELLANEOUS DOCUMENTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: of 67 manuscripts and 32 printed documents. In Italian and Latin. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 1714-1740.

did.unittitle: Sacrati, Francesco, Amadeo, Ottaviano. Printed letter in Italian. 1 page. Dated Ferrara, July 20, 1714. Concerns a calumny against the Sacrati family in Rome.

Cloche, Antonin, General of the Dominicans. In Dei Filio sibi dilectis RR. admodum PP. Provincialibus. Printed document in Latin. 2 pages. Dated Rome, July 28, 1714. Concerns the funeral of Hieronymus Berti, canon of S. Johannes Lateranensis.
Beneficiala. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. 8vo. Concerning bishoprics in Savoy. Not dated. (after 1653).
Adesto io infratto... Two ms. statements in Italian. 4 pages. Concerning one Signor Galeotto Uffreducci. Dated 1714.
Beatissimo Padre. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Concerning decrees of the Basilica Lateranense after the visit of Pope Alexander VII in 1656.
De Prié, Marchese, Imperial Ambassador in Rome. Discursus habitus...16 Februarii 1714...super obedienta prescrita... Ms. in Latin. 3 pages. Speech held by De Prié in the name of Emperor Charles V.

Lettera di disinganno per Gli Ecclesiastici delle Diocesi Interdette di Catania, e de Girgento. Printed pamphlet. 34 pages. Frankfurt on the Main, 1714. A document concerning the jurisdictional disputes between the papacy (Clement XI) and the monarchic power in southern Italy (Vittorio Amadeo di Savoia).

Ottavario che si solennizara nella Chiesa dell' Archiconfraternita della Santissima Nativita... Printed broadside. 1 page folio, folded, with a woodcut of the Nativity. Concerning the centenary of the erection of the church. Printed in Rome, nella stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1715.

Pope Clement XI. Insignia, Nomina, Cognomina... Printed broadside. 1 page, folio, folded, printed in black and red, with the names and arms of two Cardinals named by Clement XI on Jan. 30, 1713. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1715.

Santissima Padre. Scrittura da Monsig. Molines al Sig. Card. Paoluzzi li 11 Mag. 1715. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages. Concerning the abolition of the monarchy of Sicily, decreed by a bull of Pope Clement XI on Feb. 24, 1714.

Philip V, King of Spain. Ms. copies of three decrees: the first, issued to the Inquisition Council, dated March 28, 1715; the second, issued to the Royal Councils, dated February, 1715; the third, relating to prebendary bulls and benefices, dated July 6, 1715. In Italian. Together 6 pages.
Marchese del Borgo. Foglio presentate al Cardinal Paoluzzi...sopra gl'affari di Sicilia. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Concerning the affairs of Sicily. Dated July 1715.
Discorso...sopra l'Urgenza del rimedio all' Inundazioni del Reno. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. This discourse was held in Bologna, on Jan. 18, 1716.
Pope Clement XI. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages. List of persons appointed to high Church offices by Clement XI in the period from July to December 1716, in May 1715, and from October 1715 to July 1716.
Requista Abbatis Stephani Cristiani. Printed document in Latin. 2 pages. Maceratae, typis Mich. Archangeli Silvestri, 1717. Papal decree of Feb. 11, 1716.
Cloche, Fr. Antonin. Printed eulogy in Latin of Cardinal Tommaso Maria Ferrari who died in 1716. n.p., n.d. 4 pages.

Clement XI, Pope. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated Jan. 19, 1715. Copy of a letter written to Cardinal Orsini, encouraging him to accept the assignment of going to Vienna in order to persuade Emperor Charles VI to wage war against the Turks.

Clement XI, Pope. Allocutio ad...Cardinales habita in Consitorio, die 2.Septembris 1716. Printed document. 4 pages. 4to, with 2 engraved vignettes and 1 engraved initial. A formal speech in celebration of the victory by the Imperial troops in Hungary over the Turks. Romae, typis Joannis Mariae Salvioni, 1716.

Clement XI, Pope. Brevis ad Eugenium Sabaudia. -Eugenii a Sabaudia Responsum. Two printed documents. 4 pages, with 4 engraved vignettes and 2 engraved initials. Rome, typis Joannis Mariae Salvioni, 1717. Correspondence between Clement XI and Eugene of Savoy.
Copia di lettera d'amico confidente di Roma. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Dated June 10, 1716.
Al Governatore di Mantua sopra l'affare del acque nel 1716. Copy of a letter referring to the innundation. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, 8vo.

Acquaviva, Cardinal Francesco. Viglietto scritto alla Santita di Nosto Signore. Printed letters by Acquaviva, Marchese Grimaldi, Count Alberoni, the Duke of Popoli, etc., concerning the dangerous situation created by the landing of Spanish troops in Italy. Printed. 8 pages (missing first leaf, title?). The letters are dated June and August 1717. n.p., n.d.
An account of goods (salami, cheese, soap, etc.), ending with "two big cartons of assorted sweets." Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated 1717.
Clement XI, Pope. List of persons appointed to high Church offices in the period between January and July 1717. Ms. 3 pages.
Gallas, Count of. List of persons who attended a party in the house of the Count of Gallas, Imperial Ambassador in Rome, in 1715. Ms. 2 pages.
List of ladies who attended a levee on August 13, 1716 in the house of Baronessa Scarlatti. Ms. 4 pages.

Acquaviva, Cardinal Francesco. A list of persons attending a banquet in the house of Acquaviva, the Spanish ambassador in Rome, on the occasion of the birth of the Infanta, on August 29, 1717. Ms. 2 pages.
Printed list of names. 1 page. With some handwritten notes and the date Genua, April 18, 1717.

(Alexander VIII, Pope). Panegyric on the Pope, who lived from 1610-1691, fought against the last remnants of the sect of Molinos and against the Jansenists, was a member of the cenacle of Christine of Sweeden, and enriched the Vatican Library with precious manuscripts. Calligraphic ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Undated.
Li conti di Monte Vecchio... Historical account. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Dated 1718.

Gigli, Girolamo. Ritrattazione. Printed broadside. Folio, folded. Dated Viterbo, Jan. 20, 1718. Girolamo, professor of Literature at the University of Siena apologizes in this broadside for the sarcastic remarks he had previously addressed to the Grand Duke of Tuscany, the Florentines, the Crusca Academy, etc.
Praeclare tecum agitur ornatissime iuvenis. Ms. of a congratulatory letter in Latin. 4 pages. Undated.

Estratto di l'Ambassiatore...nella sua audienza... 1718. Excerpts of the statements made by the Count of Gallas, Imperial Ambassador in Rome, during the extraordinary audience granted him by Pope Clement XI in 1718. Relating to the landing of Spanish troops in Italy, etc. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages.
Clement XI, Pope. Ms. copy of a letter in Italian, written by the Pope in July 1718 to Sig. Prospero Marefoschi. 2 pages.

Cellamare. Lettere scritte al Sig. Card. Alberoni. Ms. copies of 3 letters, written from Paris, Dec. 1718, to Alberoni. Cellamare, Spanish Ambassador to the court of France, was the principal tool of Alberoni and plotted the famous "Cellamare Conspiracy." With the plot discovered, Cellamare was dispelled from France and Spain declared war against France (1719). This was the cause of Alberoni's fall. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages.

Manifeste sur les sujets de rupture entre la France et l'Espagne. Printed pamphlet in French, with Italian translation in facing column. 42 pages, last leaf blank. n.p., 1719. 4to. The French side of the Cellamare Conspiracy (see no. 33).
Marcy, Count. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Guidice, written from Palermo, June 8, 1720. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.
Instruttione. Printed pamphlets in Italian. 11 pages. n.p., n.d. (dated in ink 1720). Suggestions for water works in Civita Vecchia.
Notificazione. Concerning the cost of a pageant in Ancona. Printed broadside, folio, folded. Ancona, Nicola Belelli Stamp. Camerale, 1720.
Maggio 1621. Description in Italian of a pageant in Rome in May 1621. With the names of 40 attending youths. Ms. 4 pages, 4to.
Nomina, Cognomina... List of 140 Cardinals, appointed from 1682 to 1721. Printed broadside, folio, folded. With allegorical engraving of St. Peter at top. Rome, ex typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1721.
Chigi, Mario. Copy of a letter written by Chigi to Cardinal Piazza. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated June 3, 1721.
Ursini, Guiseppe Mattei. Copy of a letter written to Cardinal Piazza. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated June 4, 1721.

Acquiviva, Cardinal Francesco. Verba...and Clementis XI Responsum. Printed pamphlet in Latin, with 3 engraved vignettes and 2 ingraved initials. 4 pages, 4to. Rome, typis J.M. Salvoni, 1721. Speech of Cardinal Acquiviva, Philip V's ambassador, which he gave during the presentation of the flags captured by the Spaniards in battle with the Turks. The flags were presented to the pontifical altar. With Clement XI's response.

Philippe de Genlis, Marquis de Langallerie. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Interesting letter concerning the Marquis de Langallerie (1656-1717), a 17th century soldier of fortune, impostor, and adventurer. The letter states that the Marquis had proposed to the Aga of Turkey the settlement of a colony of Huguenots in Morea, that in the Hague he had proclaimed himself God's prophet, etc.
Orsini, Cardinal da Benevento. Copy of a letter written to the Duchess of Gravina, on March 25, 1722. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.
Spinola, Agostino. Memoriale alla Sagra Congregazione de'Vescovi e Regolari. Printed statement. 4 pages. Typis de Comitibus, 1713. Concerns the Order of the Somaschi.
Innocent XIII, Pope. List of persons appointed to Church posts in the period between January and March, 1724. Ms. 1 page.

Abdication of Philip V, King of Spain. 2 manuscript and 1 printed document, together 6 pages. Concerning Philip V's abdication in favor of his son Luis I, Prince of Asturias. The printed document is a letter from Philip to his son in Spanish (with Italian on facing columns), giving him advice. Dated January 4, 1724.

Porta, Antonio Maria. Letter in Italian concerning architectural plans for the Basilica di S. Paolo. Porta, an Italian architect, had worked in Bohemia and built the castle Raudnitz for the Prince of Lobkowitz. Ms. 6 pages. Dated May 8, 1725.
Risposta ad un amico. Ms. letter in Italian. 11 pages. Referring to a letter sent to the Cardinals dealing with their obligation to give advice to the Pope. Dated 1726.
Parole datte dal Canonico Bonarelli... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated Ancona, Oct. 24, 1726.
Rondonius, Joannes Baptista. Cornelio Bentivolio de Aragonia S.R.E. Cardilai Amplissimo, Aemilaeque de Latere Legato. Speech in Latin. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, 4to. (Venice?), 1726.
Genealogical table of electors of Brunswick and their relations with England. Ms. 1 page. Undated.
Giovanni V, King of Portugal. Copy of a letter in Italian to Count Francesco Piazza, dated May, 1726. Ms., 1 page.
Barberini. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Lecari, Secretary of State, concerning the Duke of Savoy and Sicily and Sardinia. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Dated Nov., 1727.
Barberini, Cardinal Francesco. Letter to the King of Sardinia, i.e. Duke Vittorio Amadeo, Duke of Savoy. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated Rome, August 1727.
Viterbo. Report of a visit by Pope Benedict XIII. Ms. in Italian, 7 pages. Dated Nov. 9, 1727.
Dominican Order. Concerning instructions by Pope Benedict XIII regarding the Dominicans. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated Aug. 29, 1727.
Girolamo, Archbishop Crispi. Letter to Pope Benedict XIII. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages. Dated March 12, 1727.
Girolamo, Archivesco Crispi. Another letter to Pope Benedict XIII. Printed leaflet. 4 pages. Ravenna, ex typog. Caporali, 1728. Dated March 9, 1727.
Report to Rome on some commercial commission. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. 1727.

Lambertini, Prospero, Archbishop of Ancona. Announcement in the name of the Pope. Printed broadside in Latin. Folio, folded. With engraved coat of arms and engraved initial, printed in black and red. Rome, typogr. Vaticana, 1727.
Barberini, Cardinal Francesco. Letter to the Congregation of Cardinals, by Barberini and other cardinals. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. 1727.

Benedict XIII, Pope. Lettera. Louis Antoine de Noailles. Nuova Lettera. Printed correspondence between Pope Benedict XIII and Cardinal de Noailles, Archbishop of Paris, both in Italian. Printed pamphlet, 6 pages. Rome, stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1728. Concerning the acceptance of the Bull Unigenitus , issued by Clement XI. The Pope's letter is dated Nov. 8, 1728; Noailles' answer: Dec. 6, 1728.
Letter from Ancona , dated Oct. 7, 1728. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.
Letter from Albano , dated June 5, 1729. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages.
Ignazia di Marto. Letter from Viterbo, dated May 22, 1729. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.
Report from the Quirinal. Concerning the reception of Monsignor Crispi by Monsignor Corsini on August 28, 1730. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. 4to.
Report to the Cardinals. Concerning Cardinal Bancieri, etc. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. 1730.
Monteleone, Marchese de. Letter, dated Aug. 21, 1731. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.
Tax reform. Report with accounts of a reform on taxation. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages. 1730.
A. de B. Letter to Venice, concerning the process against Cardinal Coscia, etc. Printed leaflet. 1 blank leaf and 5 pages, 4to. Dated Naples, 1731.
Muscettola, Vincentio Maria, Bishop of Recananti and Loreto. Letter, dated April 22, 1731. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages.
"Come Fratello." Letter concerning heretics. Together with one page of satirical (?) armorial designs for Calvinists. Printed pamphlet. 3 pages. Dated Rome, March 1732.
Clement XII, Pope. Speech concerning the promotion of Acquiviva and Mosca. Ms. in Latin. 2 pages. Oct. 1, 1732.
Genealogical Table--Piero Zorzi. Printed broadside. Oblong folio, folded.
Lucchese, Count. Copy of a letter to Count Rocca, challenging him to a duel. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Dated Sept. 13, 1733.

Louis of Harrach, Count, Viceroy of Naples. Proclamation prohibiting the distribution within the Neapolitan state, then under Austrian rule, a pamphlet "Lettera di risposta d'un particolare di Roma...sopra le pendenze di Gravina" as it would sow discord between the ecclesiatical and the secular power. Printed pamphlet. 3 pages, 4to. Naples, 1733.

Replique a la Response au Parallele des deux Elections de Pologne. Printed document in French and Italian on facing columns. 46 pages. Important political document on the election of Stanislav Leszcinski, King of Poland in 1733. A resonse to a political pamphlet printed and circulated in Rome.

Parere disappassionato sopra gli ultimi Scritti per parte delle corti di Vienna e di Madrid intorno alla presente Guerra e Osservazione legali sopra l'articolo Quinto della Quadruplice Alleanza. Printed document, title. 24 pages, blank leaf. 1734. Concerning the war between Spain and Austria over the succession of Poland, and the Quadruple Alliance.
Montemar, Duke of. Copy of a letter sent to the Duke by Lambertini, asking him for pardon and to refrain from burning the land of Pianoro. With Montemar's answer. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. 1734.
Lettera d'un Mercante as un suo Correspondente. Sopra i vantaggi del Commercio, che ha ritrovati nel porto Franco d'Ancona. Printed pamphlet. 3 pages. Ancona, Stamp. Bellelli, 1734.
Facta Occasione Ingressus R.P.D. Saminiati Florentini, eique os Claudendi. Ms. in Latin. 4 pages, 1734.

Facienda occasione claudendi Os R.P.D. meo Joi Ernesto de Arach (Count Harrach, Bishop of Neutra, ambassador in Rome) pro natione Germanica Sac. Rotae Romae Auditori. Ms. in Latin. 4 pages. Undated (1734).
Facta occasione aperiendi os R.P.D. Saminiato Florentina. Ms. in Latin. 3 pages. Undated (1734).
Acquiviva, Cardinal. Ms. in Italian concerning the Cardinal Acquiviva and Cardinal Porzia. 4 pages. 1735.

Romagna. A detailed report concerning the geographic, economic, financial, commercial, and demographic conditions of that province, containing data not to be found in other sources. Ms. in Italian. 23 pages. 1735.
Baron Pietro Pavolo Mantica. Informazione. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, folio, folded. Undated (1736).
Boni, Jo. Giacome. Statement on an incident with soldiers in Ancona. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Oct. 4, 1736.

La Capella de Musici di Loreto. Report on the deplorable state of the choir. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Undated (1736). Suggesting that the musicians be allowed to work in opera to supplement their income.
Brilla, Giovanni. Report and accounts concerning the dancer Giovanni Brilla from the Teatro d'Argentina. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Dated Feb. 18, 1736.
Propositio Ecclesiae Metropolitana Trajanopolitana. Ms. in Latin. 2 pages. 1738.
Spoleto. Spese fatte...nel passaggio delle Truppe Alemanne. List of expenses occurred by German troops as they passed through Spoleto. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Undated.
Foligno. Spese fatte..nel passaggio delle Truppe Alemanne. List of expenses occurred by the passing of German troops through Foligno. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Undated.

Philip V, King of Spain, and George II, King of England. Confronto della Condotta del Re Cattolico con quella dei Re Britannico negl'incidenti occorsi avanti e dopo la Convenzione de 14 Gennaro 1739 fino alla publicazione delle Rappresaglie e dichiaraoone di Guerra. Printed pamphlet in Italian, translated from Spanish. 16 pages. N.p., n.d. Includes a memorandum delivered by the English plenipotentiaries to the Spaniards on June 25, 1739 and a statement made by the Spaniards to the British on May 15, 1739.
Benedict XIV, Pope. (1740-1758). Intimatio facienda per cursores etiam domi dimissa copia. Printed text. 1 page. Undated. Description in Latin of the coronation ceremonies for Benedict XIV in 1740.
REPORTS ON CONCLAVES
did.physdesc: 33 manuscript documents in Italian plus three page

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: index. 794 pages, large 4to. Contemporary vellum. (Rome?, 17th century).

did.unittitle: Conclave di Clemente Quinto. Ms. on paper. 22 pages, numbered ff. 1-11. In a calligraphic script with an ornate initial.
Doppo La Morte di Clemente V...ai 20. d'Aprile 1314 La S. Sede vacò due anni tre mesi & 12 giorni. Ms. on paper. 6 pages, numbered ff. 12-14.
Conclave nel quale fù creato Urbano VI. L'Anno 1378. Ms. on paper. 28 pages, numbered ff. 15-28.
Supplement to the above. Ms. on paper. 6 pages, numbered ff. 29-31.
Obitus Eugenii Papae IV et Conclave Nicolai Papae V. Ms. on paper. 22 pages, numbered ff. 34-44.
Conclave nel quale fù creato Papa Calisto III. 1455. Ms. on paper. 5 pages, numbered ff. 45-47.
Conclave nel quale fù creato Papa Pio II. 1458. Ms. on paper. 40 pages, numbered ff. 48-57.
Conclave nel quale fù eletto Papa Paolo II. 1464. Ms. on paper. 6 pages, numbered ff. 58-60.
Conclave nel quale fù creato Papa Sisto IV. 1471. Ms. on paper. 5 pages, numbered ff. 61-63.
Conclave in cui fù eletto Papa Innocenzo VIII. 1484. Ms. on paper. 13 pages, numbered ff. 64-70.
Conclave in cui fu eletto Alessandro VI. Ms. on paper. 6 pages, numbered ff. 71-73.
Conclave nel quale fu creato Papa Pio III. Ms. on paper. 11 pages, numbered ff. 74-79.
Conclave nel quale fù eletto Papa Giulio II. Ms. on paper. 9 pages, numbered ff. 80-84.
Conclave Leonis Papae X. Ms. on paper. 24 pages, numbered ff. 86-97.
Conclave nel qual fù creato Papa Adriano VI per la morte di Leone. Ms. on paper. 15 pages, numbered ff. 98-105.
Conclave della creatione di Clemente VII per la morte di Adriano VI. Ms. on paper. 50 pages, numbered ff. 106-131.
Capitulationi di...Papa Clemente sessimo...1527. Ms. on paper. 14 pages, numbered ff. 132-138.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Paolo III per la morte di Clemente VII. Ms. on paper. 19 pages, numbered ff. 139-148.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Giulio II per la morte di Paolo III. Ms. on paper. 46 pages, numbered ff. 149-171.
Conclave della Creatione di Papa Marcello II per la morte di Guilio III. Ms. on paper. 19 pages, numbered ff. 172-181.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Paolo IIII per la morte di Marcello II. Ms. on paper. 27 pages, numbered ff. 182-196.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Pio IV per la morte di Paolo IV. Ms. on paper. 26 pages, numbered ff. 197-209.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Pio V per le morte di Pio IV. Ms. on paper. 45 pages, numbered ff. 210-232.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Greg. XIII per la morte di Pio V. Ms. on paper. 17 pages, numbered ff. 233-241.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Sisto V per la morte di Gregorio XIII. Ms. on paper. 22 pages, numbered ff. 242-252.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Vrbane VII per la morte di Sisto V. Ms. on paper. 32 pages, numbered ff. 253-268.
Conclave nel quale fu creato Papa Gregorio XIIII... Ms. on paper. 162 pages, numbered ff. 269-349.
Conclave della creatione di Papa Innocento VIIII per la morte di Gregorio XIIII. Ms. on paper. 10 pages, numbered ff. 350-359.
Conclave della Creatio di Clemente VIII per la morte d'Innocentio VIIII. Ms. on paper. 78 pages, numbered ff. 360-398.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In Italian and Latin. Different sizes, from 12mo to folded folio. Contempoary vellum. Italy, 1749-1790.

did.unittitle: Confalone, Compagnia del. List of personnel of this ecclesiatical company. Ms. 4 pages, 8vo and folded folio.
Report about different dioceses from January 1760 to July 1790. Ms. 4 pages, folded folio.
Santissima Trinita. Lista degli Offiziali per l'anno Santo 1750. Printed. 10 pages, sm. folio.
SSmo. Confalone...Deputati Offiziali...per l'Anno 1749. Printed. 1 page. Folded folio broadside.
Santissima Trinita de Pellegrini e...di Roma. Printed. List of time schedule of duties from Dec. 24, 1749 to Dec. 13, 1750. 1 page, folded folio broadside.
SSma. Trinita Capiprocessione per l'Anno Santo 1750. Printed lists of the heads of the procession. 1 page. Folded folio broadside.
Indice de'Casali. List of rural townships. Ms. 64 pages, 8vo.

S. Fermina. Componimento per musica da Cantarsi... di Civita Vecchia. Printed pamphlet. 16 pages, 8vo. Rome, Pagliarini, 1753. The poetry libretto for a sacred play to be sung in the Church of Santa Fermina in Ancona; the composer of the music was Francesco Ciampi.

"Arcadia." Adunanza tenuta dagli Arcadi per la nascita del...Principe di Piemonte. Printed. 4 leaves, 68 pages, 4to. Rome, 1752. On the title page an engraved vignette with the emblem of the Academy of Arcadia, representing a satyr holding a medallion, in the center of which the Arcadian music pipes are shown. Various poems in Italian and Latin, in honor of Vittorio Amadeo III Duke of Savoy, with the poems composed by members of the famous Arcadia Academy in Rome. The Arcadia was founded in 1690; it still exists today under a different name.

In Convitato di Pietra. A comedy play. Ms. 91 pages. An Italian version of the Don Juan legend, undated. Imitation of Tirso de Molina's famous Burlador de Sevilla , but with the insertion of comic scenes acted by characters from the commedia dell'arte like Pulcinella (speaking in Neapolitan dialect), Mezzettino (speaking in Venetian), Rosetta, Pimpinella; these scenes differentiate this play from the Spanish original.

Since no author's name is given in this ms., it is difficult to establish whether this play is by Onofrio Gilberto di Solofra (printed in Naples, 1653) which as Belloni states in his Il Seicento (p. 290) has thus far been unprocurable; or whether it is by Andrea Perrucci, a poet from Palermo, and a translator of Spanish comedies, who published a Convitato di Pietra in 1678, reprinted 1684, and perhaps later. The first Italian imitator of Tirso's Burlador is supposed to be Giacinto Andrea Cicognini (1606-1660); his Convitato di Pietra like our ms. also contains some Uscene buffonesche , but the comic characters have different names. At any rate, this ms. is important in regard to the literary vicissitudes of the Don Juan legend in Italy.

Delle Lodi delle Belle Arti. Orazione, e componimenti poetici detti in Campidoglio... l'anno del Giubileo 1750. Printed. 80 pages. With engraved initials, headpieces, endpieces, and vignettes, and woodcut initials. 4to. Rome, Giov. Maria Salvioni (printers to the Vatican), 1750?

Resolutiones Congregationis Particularis a S. mo. Benedetto XIV. 15 Nov., 1741. Printed. 12 pages, small folio. Rome, ex typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1743. A fine item of printing, dedicated to Pope Benedict XIV (1675-1758), commemorating a copmpetition for fine arts orizes held at the Roman Accademia del Disegno. The poems are almost all in praise of the belle arti : notable is the visione in tercets, by Gioacchino Pizzi, which is an evocation of Michelangelo (pp. 52-59). The prose Orazione in lode delle belle arti is by Francesco Maria Zanotti of Bologna (1692-1777), known as a moralist and a theorist of poetry (Arte Poetica, 1768); but above all, for his attempt to apply Newton's theory of Attraction to psychology ( On the attractive force of ideas , 1747).
Dell'Errario. A brief history of the Roman Treasury from the earliest to Imperial times, interesting for the history of economics. No author mentioned. Ms. 32 pages, small folio.

Relazione...spettante ad alcune penitenze. An account by an unnamed ecclesiastic, a member of the Congregazione della Scaletta of the Collegio Romano, describing the penitential perversities of a religious self-tormenting mystic, Domenico Cinti, of Pistoia, professor of moral theology and a director of the Congregation of the Holy Virgin, Rome. An evocative study of mysticism and self- mortification. Ms. 20 pages, small folio.
Al...Padre Segneri al Ragionamento Trigesima Seconda della Parte Terza. Printed. 6 pages. Rome, n.d., probably privately printed, 4to.

Pasquino a Marforia. Ms. 13 pages, large 4to. A poem in quatrains, of satirical, topical nature. The allusions of contemporary persons and events are explained by names set down to the left of the stanzas. Pasquino and Marforio are the symbol of popular satire against the well-known "big-shots" in the political and social sphere of Rome.
Trattato fra la Santa Sede e il Re di Spagna. Ms. 3 pages, 4to. Mostly financial matters, no date.
La città di Velletri and other sonnets and Canzone. 25 pages, Ms. in Italian. Different sizes.
Metastasio, Abaco. Canzona and other poems. Also poems by Carasio Nonocride (an "arcadian?") and other authors. Ms. 40 pages.
Accounting sheets for the year 1744. Ms. 157 pages in different sizes, small 8vo. and 4to.

Aberilmo Eginense. La Susanna, componimento sacro. Printed. 8vo. 20 pages. Rome, 1754. Aberilmo Eginense is a pseudonym, possibly a member of the Arcadian Academy of Rome. This is the poetic text of an oratorio, set to music by Francisco Garcia and performed at the Congregatione dell' Oratorio, Rome, on the evening of the first Sunday in Lent (1754).

Diario della Legazione...da Papa Clemente XI al Card. Gozzadini alla Prinipessa Elisabetta Farnesi... Ms. 101 pages. An important historical document. Pope Clement XI was elected to the papacy on Nov. 23, 1700. His pontificate was quite restless: after the outburst of the War of Spanish Succession, each of the belligerent powers (France and the Empire) tried to get the papacy on its side. Emperor Joseph and Philip V both recalled their ambassador to Rome, and the Emperor had his troops raid the Papal States. (Encicl. Cottol., vol. II, col. 1832). This journal of Gozzdini's legation to Elisabeth Farnese obviously precedes the events just recited. Our ms. lists the complete personnel of the Gozzadini Legation. (See Vol. 60, #42).
Metastasio, Pietro. Fileno a Nice, and Nice in risposta...2 poems. Printed. 1 double page. Double folio broadside.
DIPLOMATIC REPORTS AND INSTRUCTIONS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 2 page ms. index, numbered ff. 1-280. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Rome, 1607- post 1663.

did.unittitle: Sagredo, Nicolo. Relatione Della Corte di Francia Del Caualier Nicolo Sagredo Della Repub. Veneta. Ms. 135 pages. (Rome, n.d.).
Minutoli, Antonio. Relatione della Corte di Spagna di Antonio M. Ambassador al Rè Filippo Quarto Per la Republ. di Lucca l'anno 1662. Ms. 222 pages. (Rome), 1662.
Altouiti, Giacomo. Instruttione Lasciata Da Monsig. Giacomo Altouiti Arciuescovo D'Atene... Ms. 156 pages. (Rome, after 1663).
Verospi, Monsignor. Instruttione a Monsig. Verospi Auditore di Rota... Ms. 28 pages. Rome, January 13, 1622.
Lancellotti, Monsig. Instruttione a...Monsig. Lancellotti Vesc. di... Ms. 39 pages. Rome, Dec. 10, 1622.

Verospi, Monsig.
Ordine à...Monsignor Verospi... Ms. 9 pages. Rome, January 13, 1622.
Allaccio, Dott. Instruttione à Dottor Allaccio, Scrittore della Biblioteca Vaticana andare in Germani... Ms. 10 pages. Rome, October 23, 1622.
Vescouo d'Anglone. Instruttione à...Monsig. Vescouo d'Anglone Dessinato da...Suo Nuntio in Toscana. Ms. 14 pages. Rome, August 20, 1622.
Vescouo Di Rimini. Instruttione à...destinato Nuntio alla Republica di Venetia dalla...Papa Paolo V. Ms. 14 pages. Rome, June 4, 1607.
POLITICAL AND ECCLESIASTICAL HISTORIES
did.physdesc: 15 documents in manuscript, mostly in Latin, some in

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Italian. 606 pages, numbered ff. 1-313. 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Naples (and other places), 1643 and undated, around the middle of the 17th century.

did.unittitle: Benedetto de Bienna. (A Neapolitan notary). Copy of Agreements signed by the Noblemen of the Sedile of Nilo in 1507. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 1-10.
Vincenzo Orazio Scipione and Giordano Galuzzi. Excerpts from the trial, dated Feb. 28, 1576. Ms. in Latin. 6 pages, numbered ff. 13-15. Naples, May 28, 1643.

Guarino d'Aversa, Silvestro. Diarii. Ms. in Italian. 95 pages, numbered ff. 17-56. These journals contain notations about appointments, salary paid to various officials; mention of the most important events occurring in Naples from 1434 to 1553.

Crasullo, Angelo. Taranti ex Notario Angelo Crasullo. Ms. in Latin. 15 pages, numbered ff. 57-64. Historical notes covering the period from 1352 to 1415; in addition, an excerpt from an old parchment codex relating to events that took place in 1359 and 1362. N.p., n.d.
Amalfi. Cronica Amalphitana. Ms. in Latin. 24 pages, numbered ff. 65-76.
Amalfi, archbishops of. Cronica Archieporum omnium Amalfitanoru... Ms. in Latin. 30 pages, numbered ff. 77-91. A Chronicle concerning all the archbishops of Amalfi, from the year 339 onwards.
Sicily. Compilatio Chronicarum Regni Sicilie... Ms. in Latin. 38 pages, numbered ff. 93-111. A chronicle relating to Sicilian history.

Romualdo. Annali di cose notabili from the Chronica Romualdi. Romualdo was Archbishop of Salerno who wrote a chronicle embracing the period from the beginning of the world to the year 1125; the whole Chronica was printed by L. Muratori in Rerum Italicarum Scriptores. Ms. in Italian. 110 pages, numbered ff. 113-167.
Cronica... Ms. in Italian. 46 pages, numbered ff. 168-194. Excerpts from different Chronicles; among them, one from the Chronicle of the Monastery of Cava (ff. 168 ff.) and from archival material.

Tabula. Transcript from the rolls of the Chancery of Charles I, Charles II, and Robert of Anjou. Ms. in Latin. 30 pages, numbered ff. 198-213. Important material for the political, social, economic, administrative history of Naples. The Rolls (Registri) of the Chancery cover the period 1269- c. 1344.

Naples. Registri Regis...Ms. in Latin. 42 pages, numbered ff. 214-234. Excerpts from the Neapolitan Chancery, covering the reigns of Charles I, Charles II, Charles III, Robert, Queen Johanna, King Ladislas.
Medici. Ms. 2 pages, numbered ff. 235-236. List of Neapolitan physicians.
Notarii. Ms. 3 pages, numbered ff. 237-238. List of Neapolitan notaries.

Naples. Vetusta Napolis monumenta ex Archivo Magnae Regiae Curiae... collecta ab anno 1239 ad 1423. Ms. 96 pages, numbered ff. 240-287. In Latin. Information and lists of most ancient monumnets, notable things, collected in Naples, covering 1239-1423, collected by the Magna Regia Curia Sicula.
Aquino, D'. Discorso della Famiglia d'Aquino. Ms. in Italian. 51 pages, numbered ff. 288-313.
LE 6 MONARCHIE DEL MONDO...
c. 386 pages, numbered ff. 1-193. Manuscript in Italian, in two columns, with many one-column insertions referring to the respective material. N.pl., n.d., apparently written in the 18th century.
Le 6 Monarchie del Mondo. A large volume of compiled information concerning world history. No sources are given. The volume includes an index of 4 pages at the beginning.
DOCUMENTS FROM THE WAR OF THE SPANISH SUCCESSION
did.physdesc: 93 documents, 28 of them printed and 65 in

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: manuscript, comprising c. 519 pages. Small folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, beginning of the 18th century.

did.unittitle: (Naples). Protesta stipulata per mano di pubblico Notaro in questa città di Napoli Segretamente per essentarsi dalle violenze il giorno ultimo d'Aprile 1702. Printed broadside, being a protest by the aristocracy and citizenry of Naples against the Duke of Anjou (Philip V of Spain) and Spanish rule, in favor of the Emperor. 1 page, 4to.

Universis, & singulis Potestatibus, Capitaneis, Vicariis Iurisdicentibus Serenissimae Republicae Venetae. A printed broadside, in Italian, printed in Treviso and dated Jan. 7, 1702. It is a proclamation in the name of Vincenzo Coronelli, the Venetian cosmographer, who had been elected General of the Franciscan Conventuals in 1701, concerning the Order; signed by three provincials. Apparently extremely rare, not listed in Armao's Coronelli bibliography.
Anne, Queen of England. Copy of a letter in Latin to the King of Spain, dated March 20, 1702, the first day of her reign, after succeeding William III who died March 19, 1702. 1-1/2 pages.
Napoli 17.Aple 1702. Report of a naval victory in April, 1702. 2-1/2 pages.

Nota della cariche, Corte e Famiglia della legatione di Napoli. A list of the members of the legation, headed by Cardinal Carlo Barberino, sent by Pope Clement XI to King Philip V in Naples in May 1702. Also includes presents offered to the king (see Pastor XV, pp. 22-23). 4 pages ms.

(Lamberg, Count Leopold Joseph von, German Ambassador in Rome). Copy of a report, apparently a diary entry, dated March 20, 1702, on the fight between Cardinal Toussaint de Forbin-Janson, Ambassador of Louis XIV in Rome and a Neapolitan gentleman, Marchese Cesare del Vasto. (See Pastor XV, p. 21). 3 pages ms.

Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo and Cardinal Fabrizio Paolucci. Copy of a correspondence between the Cardinal Grimani, who complains in the name of the Emperor Leopold I, to Cardinal Paolucci about the legation to the Duke of Anjou (Philip V) in Naples (see no. 5 above). With Paolucci's answer. Both letters are dated May 7, 1702. Also a third, unsigned, letter of May 8 referring to the same matter of the legation. 3 pages ms. (See Pastor XV, pp. 22-23).

Lettere diverse sopra la success(io)ne di Filippo V alla Monarchia delle Spagne e sue dipendenze in risposta al Favoloso Leone. This defense against a book hostile to Philip V consists of an introduction concerning the falsehoods in the book and five letters on the subject of the Spanish Succession. Undated and unsigned (1703). 31 pages.

(Sarto, Andrea del). Two documents relating to the purchase of the altar painting "Madonna and child with St. Francis," originally in the Convent of St. Francis in Florence, by Archduke Ferdinand II of Medici. A copy from the Book of Records with an original certificate from the Bishopric of Florence, dated May 7, 1703, with the original seal and stamp. 4 pages. (The painting is today in the Pitti Palace in Florence).

Doni portati alla Santa Casa dalli 3 Febraro 1703 sino alli 9 Marzo da alcune citta, Terre Castelli, Congregazione...che sono venute a venerare il Santuario, a ringraziare al bellisima Virgine per haverle libertate da tutti li mali, e pericoli del Terremoto. A list of gifts (money, silver chalices, etc.) offered to the Virgin after the earthquake of February 1703. 2-1/2 pages.

Alla S(anti)ta Nostro Sig(no)re Clemente XI, Die 19.Februarii 1703...Per li Conservatori del Popolo Romano. A petition to Pope Clement XI urging special Church ceremonies as a thanksgiving after the earthquake of February 1703. Among others, it is suggested that all carnival festivities and masquerades be suspended for 5 years. Title and four pages.

Stato dell'Anime della Città di Roma. A census of the Roman population from 1703 to 1712, specified into various classes, including parishes, houses, and families, clergy, scholars, poor in hospitals, prisoners, births, deaths, etc. The total averages between 132,000 and 134,000. 2 pages.
Distinta relatione delle rendite e pesi della menza Vescovale di Recanati... A detailed list of the revenues of the Bishop of Recanati, 1720. 3 pages.

A Maggior Gloria di Deo e Merito Dell'Anime Elemosiniere. A printed leaflet, a kind of fundraising letter for the poor. It is interesting in connection with Pope Clement XI's work for church reform and his interest in inner missions. 3 pages. Rome, Gio. Giacomo Komarek Boemo, 1703. 4to.
Paolucci, Cardinal Fabrizio. Copy of a letter concerning incidents between the Venice merchant fleet and French vessels, as reported to him by the Nuncio in Venice. Dated Rome, April 11, 1703.

(Paolucci, Cardinal Fabrizio). Copy of a letter to Cardinal Paolucci by the nuncio in Venice concerning French vessels and the Venetian merchant fleet. Dated Venice, March 31, 1703. Also Paolucci's answer to him, dated April 15, 1703. 4 pages.

Cosimo III de'Medici, Grand Duke of Toscana. Original letter to Cardinal Carpegna, written by a secretary and signed "Il Principe di Toscana." Dated Florence, March 18, 1703. Concerning the commutation of a sentence of Ghirlandi, a nobleman. 1 page, folio, folded.

(Cosimo III de'Medici, Grand Duke of Toscana). Original letter from Lancellotti to the Grand Duke of Toscana (?) apparently to be submited by the Cardinal Carpegna. Written by a secretary and signed Lancellotti. Concerning the arrival of his son, Cavaliere dal Pozzo, into Florence and his marriage. Dated Rome, Feb. 28, 1703. 2 pages.

Cortigiani, Michel Carlo, Bishop of Pistoia. Alli sue Diletti Cooperatori nella saluta dell'Anime. Printed leaflet, exhorting the ministers of his diocese to apply themselves with more zeal to the study of spiritual books and to their flocks. Dated Pistoia, May 31, 1704. 2 leaves. Pistoia, nella stamperia Episc. di Stefano Gatti.
Negroni, Cardinal Gian Francesco. Copy of a letter, in Italian and Latin, to Cardinal Francesco Maria de'Medici in Florence. Dated August 1, 1704. 1 page.

Viaggi che si faranno con la Sacra Imagine della Beata Virgine di San Luca nelli trè giorni delle Rogazioni. Printed pamphlet, with a woodcut of the Virgin of St. Luke and armorial woodcuts, describing the procession of the Miraculous Image of the Virgin of St. Luke of Bologna during the Rogation Days, from Sunday, April 27-Wednesday, April 30, 1704. 2 leaves, each page framed by a double rule. Bologna, nell'Impressoria Archivescovale.

The Column of Antonius).
Notie che da me si sottoscrivono circa l'operato e quella doverà operarsi nel calare la Colonna Antonina. Remains of the ancient Roman column of Antoninus had been excavated in 1703 and Clement XI intended to have it erected in front of the Court of Justice. The technical problem proved quite difficult and was finally solved by Francesco Fontana in 1705. The anonymous writer of the present document finds fault with the work by Francesco's father Carlo Fontana and refers to Domenico Fontana's feat of moving the obelisk in the 16th century. (See Pastor XV, pages 370-371.) Dated, Nov. 25, 1704. 4 pages.
Philippus Baro de Mantico. Apparently the transcription of an epitaph to his wife, dated 1704. In Latin. 1 page.

Ponderatione seconda del Soldato Dalla Mirandola...di Carlo Terzo vero Monarca delle Spagne. Printed pamphlet on the question of the Spanish Succession. The present pamphlet is allegedly translated from a French version. Title page and 46 pages (apparently not complete). Mirandola, March 16, 1704. Small 4to.

Augustus II, King of Poland. Declaratio respectu Costodiae Rever. Episcopi Posnanienses. Printed proclamation to the Bishops of Posen. Dated Sept. 16, 1704. 3 pages. Apparently very rare, not in the catalogues of the BM or the BN.

Katzenelnbogen, Johann Anton Knebel von, Bishop of Eichstatt. Al Sagro Collegio. Two printed letters to the Sacred College. Both are addressed by hand to the Cardinal Carpegna. 4 leaves. Rome, nella stamperia della Rev.Cam.Apost., 1705. (Stained).

Alstalli, Cardinal Fulvio. Sincerissimo, ma altrettanto detestablie fatto, sotta Parole di Fede, successa all truppe Alemane in Figarolo. Printed proclamation by Cardinal Astalli, papal nuncio in Ferrara, concerning the German troops in Ficcarolo at the Po, in the territory of the Church. The Germans eventually left Ficcarolo on June 24. Dated Ferrara, June 20, 1704. 2 leaves. (See Pastor XV, p. 25.)

(Clement XI, Pope). Notificazione. Printed announcement, stating that beginning with the new year, the Pope will hold one public audience on the first Monday of each month, the first being Jan. 5, 1705. Broadside, oblong small folio, folded. Rome, nella stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1705.

(Gigli, Girolamo). Copia di Lettera dell'Imperatore della Cina à Papa Clemente XI. Copy of a satirical letter, ridiculing the Chinese missions of the Jesuits. Undated, unsigned. (c. 1706). 3 pages. Also 1 page: Regalo mandato dall'Imperatore della Cina al Papa. A list of presents sent by the Pope to the Emperor of China, probably part of Gigli's letter. Together 4 pages.

Gerbillon, Jean Francois, S.J. Decretum Ex originali Tartarico versum. Imperial decree, translated into Latin from the Tartar language by Gerbillon, General of the Jesuit mission in Peking. 1-1/2 pages. Undated (1706).

Thomas, Antoine, S.J. Epistola ad superiores singulorum Ordinum Qui sunt in Sina. Letter in Latin, written to the heads of various Orders doing missionary work in China. Signed by Antoine Thomas, substituting for J.F. Gerbillon, the Jesuit General, who was then ill. Dated Peking, Dec. 28, 1706. 2 pages.
Thomas, Antoine, S.J. Another copy of the above letter (#30), with some variants. 3 pages.

(Raimondo Cavaliere de Lauda). Printed broadside, being the obituary in Latin of a Dominican Friar Raimondi Cavaliere de Lauda (Lodi?) who died in his 66th year. Dated Rome, Convent of S. Sabina, March 30, 1706.

Ex Congregatione Consitoriali 27 Januarii 1707. -Conclusione del Voto. Notes on the Consistory of Jan. 27, 1707, listing the attending Cardinals and giving the result of the vote concerning election matters. 3 pages, 8vo.
Zmajevich, Vincent, Bishop of Antivari. Copy of a letter concerning a marriage between a Turkish woman and a Catholic man. Dated Perasto, June 29, 1707. 2 pages.

Clement XI, Pope. Breve...ad Archepiscopum Ebredunensem. Printed breve of Pope Clement XI to Charles Brulart de Genlis, Archbishop of Embrun concerning his position in regards to Nizza and Savoy. (See Pastor XV, p. 250, who does not mention this Breve). Dated August 27, 1707. Montefiascone, Typis seminaris, 1707. 6 pages. This is one of the earliest imprints of Montefiascone. (See Fumagalli, Lex.Typog.Ital , p. 244, who does not include this Breve.)

Indice delle Lezzioni et Anatomiche Dimostrazione...sotto la Direzione del Signor Mario Cecchini. Broadside of announcement of medical lectures and anatomical demonstrations in the Hospital del Santissimo Salvatore ad Sanct Sanctorum in Rome, under the direction of Mario Cecchini, head surgeon and anatomist of the Hospital. 19 courses by various medical and anatomical lecturers are announced from March 10 to April 18, 1707. Oblong folio, folded. Rome, nella Stamperia di Dom. Ant. Ercole in Parione. There is a contemporary ms. note that the introductory lecture had to be postponed from March 10 to March 17.

Note del Regalo che ha fatto presentare nella venuta in Massa il Signor Principre Eugenio Gio. Francesco di Sueson (Soissons?) alla...Principessa sua Futura Sposa...Maria Teresa Cybo... A list of diamonds and other jewelry and finery given to his fiancée. Undated. 3 pages.

Paolucci, Cardinal Fabrizzio. Copia di lettera...scritta alla Cardinale Gualterio sotto il primo Giugno 1707. Copy of a letter from Cardinal Paolucci to Cardinal Francesco Antonio Gualtieri, Nuncio to France who had been made Cardinal by Clement XI in 1706. 1 page.
Lettera scritta dal arescial. di Tessé alla Sta. di N.S. Clemente XI li 18.Decembre 1708. Copy of a letter by Marshal Tessé to Pope Clement XI. 2-1/2 pages.

Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo. Copia di viglietto scritta...alle...Cardinale Paolucci Segretario di Stato di N.S. li 31 Gennaro 1707. Copy of a letter to the Secretary of State, Cardinal Paolucci; also of a letter by him of the same date to José Molines, auditor of the Rota. 2 pages.

(Daun, Wirich Philipp Lorenz, Count). Lettera d'un Gentiluomo d'Ascoli ad un Ministro di Napoli. Printed pamphlet, a contemporary account of the capture of Naples by the Austrian Field Marshal Count Daun. Contains the treaty of the capitulation, dated Sept. 12, 1707, signed by the Duke d'Atri, the Count Wallis, Stefano Bellett, and the Count Daun. 27 pages. N.p., n.d. 8vo.

Confraternitas SS. V. Vulnerum Christi. Reverendissimi, & Celissimi...Confratres. Printed letters by the Directors of the Confraternity to its members, dated Constance, Feb. 18, 19, and 20, 1708, giving news of the members and containing obituaries of members who died between 1707 and 1708. N.p., n.d. 4 leaves.
(Lists of exchange rates of scudis, baiocchis, etc). 6-1/2 pages.

(Sacred College of Cardinals). Serenissimo Principi Josepho Roman. Regi Imperatore... Copy of a letter by the Roman Cardinals in answer to Emperor Joseph I's manifest of June 26, 1708, protesting against the Emperor's anti-papal attitude. Dated Rome, August 12, 1708. (See Pastor XV, pp. 41-42.). 5 pages.

(Clement XI, Pope ?). Alla Santità di N.S. Per li Marchese e Conti non intesi dalla congregatione Depurata sopra li pesi Camerali. Copy of a letter written by the aristocracy to the Pope. Undated, unsigned. 2 pages, 8vo.
Ad Archiepiscopum Camerucensem. Copy of a letter in Latin. 1 page, 8vo. Undated, unsigned.

Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare, Prefect of Rome. Lettera Circolare Alli Monsignori Patriarchi, Arcivescovi, Vescovi, & altri Ordinarii dell'Italia.. Printed circulatory letter to the clergy, signed by the Vicar General, decreeing reforms for the expenditures of Monks. Interesting document in connection with the endeavors for Church reform by Pope Clement XI. Dated Rome, July 28, 1708. 2 leaves. Rome, stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1708.

Barigioni, Filippo. Discorso sopra la fabrica del Palazzo Priorale dell'inclita Città di Velletri. Colla relazione del Sig. Filippo Barigioni Architetto. Printed pamphlet, with armorial woodcut. Treatise on the rebuilding of the Palazzo Priorale in Velletri by the Roman Architect Filippo Barigioni (1690-1753). His work in Velletri seems to be unknown (see Thieme Becker). Barigione was assigned to the palace in Velletri on Feb. 22, 1708. 4 leaves. N.p., n.d.

(Leopold I, Emperor). Lettera con Osservazioni Sopra d'un Libro stampato nell'Anno 1706 in Rotterdam con Titolo "Ultimi Consigli, ò sia Testamento Politico d'un Ministro dell'Imperatore Leopoldo Primo." Printed pamphlet. In answer to Leopold I's political testament. 8 leaves (the last blank). Small 4to. Lucca, July 12, 1708.

(Maigrot, Charles, Apostolic Vicar of Fukien). Estratto d'una lettera della Rocella delli 8. Luglio 1708. Extract in Italian from the original French, concerning the controversy over the Chinese mission. 3 pages.
Copia di viglietto dato del Mons. de Zuenitz(?)... Copy of a letter to a Cardinal of Clement XI, in favor of Charles III as King of Spain. Unsigned, undated. (1708). 1 page.

Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo, Viceroy of Naples. Copy of a letter to a Cardinal of Clement XI, concerning Charles III, King of Spain. Grimani fell into disfavor with Pope Clement XI for his recognition of Charles III. 3 pages.

Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo, Viceroy of Naples. Copia di lettera...alli Signore Cardinali Carpegna, Marescotti e Panfilio. -Copia di lettera...alla Santita...Papa Clemente XI. Copies of 2 letters by Cardinal Grimani: one dated Sept. 22, 1708, the other dated Sept. 20, 1708, both concerning Charles III. 11 pages.
Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare. Copia di lettera...al Cardinale Grimani. Copy of a letter from Cardinal Carpegna to Cardinal Grimani, dated Rome, July 22, 1708.

(Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo). Copy of a letter from Rome to Grimani in answer to his letter of Sept. 22 (see #52 above) and Grimani's reply. The first letter is dated Rome, Nov. 13, 1708, Grimani's answer is dated Naples (?), Nov. 1708. 3 pages.
Alla somma Veneratione... Copy of a letter, dated Naples, August 4, 1708, concerning Comacchio, which had fallen into the hands of the Emperor's troops in May, 1708. 6 pages.
Cardinal of Saxony. Letter in Latin to the Bishops, Cardinals, etc. Dated Vienna, Sept. 3, 1708. 2 pages.
Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare (?). Copy of a letter, dated Vatican, Dec. 20, 1708. 2 pages.
Clement XI, Pope. Copy of a letter in Latin to the Deacon of St. Eustachius. Dated Rome, Sept. 1, 1708. 8 pages.
Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo. Copy of a letter to the Cardinals, dated Naples, Sept. 27, 1708. (Identical with #52 in spite of the variant in date and heading.) 2 pages.
Morgione, Francesco, Bishop of Minori. Copy of a letter, dated Minori, August 3, 1708, asserting his ecclesiastical zeal. 1 page.

Philip V, King of Spain. Edict in Italian, dated Madrid, June 19, 1709, then the height of hostility between Philip V and Rome, after Clement XI had recognized Charles III early in 1709. Philip demands an end to all commerce with Rome. Copy of the letter written for the King by his secretary Gio. Milano d'Aragona. 3 pages. See Pastor XV, p. 50, which dates this edict June 19, 1709.
Joseph I, Emperor. Edict in Latin, dated Vienna, August 8, 1708, hostile to the Roman position, 3 pages.
Moles, Francesco, Duke of Pareto. Lettera...al Cardinale Orsini. Copy of a letter, dated Barcelona, April 28, 1708. 6 pages.
Clement XI, Pope. Breve in Latin to Victor Amadeo of Savoy, dated Rome, July 22, 1708. Copy of one of several letters by the Pope to the Emperor and the Allies in an effort to restore peace. 2 pages.

(Kaunitz, Count Franz Karl von). Copies of two letters to Kaunitz, by the Prince of Salm and the Imperial Vice Chancellor, both dated August 4, 1708, and both in answer to a letter by Kaunitz of July 24, 1708, referring to the hostility of Rome towards the Imperial troops in Parma, Piacenza, and Commacchio. 3-1/2 pages.
(Victor Amadeo II, Duke of Savoy (?)). Risposta al Breve. Copy of the answer to the Breve of July 22, 1708 (see #54b above), dated Aug. 26, 1708. 1 page.
Lettera ducale dekka Serenissima Republica di Venezia responsica a Nostre Signore. Copy of a letter by the Doge of Venice (Aloysius Mozzenico?) to Pope Clement XI. Dated August 4, 1708.

Clement XI, Pope. Ad Archiepiscopos, & Episcopos Hispaniarum. Datae die 24.Augusti 1709. Printed pamphlet. Title page with woodcut of papal arms and three leaves. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1709. Printed Breve of Pope Clement XI to the Spanish episcopacy. (See Pastor XV, p. 53, quoting from the Opera of Clement XI, not mentioning this separate printing.)

Frederick August I, King of Polonia). Two printed letters to the newly elected August II, King of Poland: by Stanislaus, Count Denhoff, dated Torunio, Oct. 12, 1709, and by Stanislaus Szembek, Archbishop of Gnesen, dated Czestochovia, Nov. 7, 1709. 2 leaves. N.p., n.d.

August II, King of Poland (Frederick August I). Manifesto...Nel suo ritorno nel Regno di Pollonia l'Anno...1709. Tradotta dalla Latina nell'Italiana Lingua dall'A.N.S. Printed manifest, dated Dresden, August 8, 1709. 16 pages. N.p., n.d. The BM catalogue does not list the Italian translation.

Articoli Preliminari. Per servire ai Trattati della Pace Generale nell'Haya l'Anno 1709. Printed pamphlet of preliminary peace negotiations at the Hague, dated May 28, 1709, and signed by Eugene, Prince of Savoy, the Duke of Marlborough, Heinsius, etc. The first peace treaty was signed only on Oct. 29, 1709. 12 pages, 4to. N.p., n.d. 1 page.
August II, King of Poland. Manifestum Sacr. Reg. Maj. Augusti II...in Poloniae Regum reducis. Printed pamphlet, 10 leaves. Latin translation of August II's manifest of 1709 (see #57 above). 4to.

(Clement XI, Pope). Copy of a letter by an ambassador, taking leave of Rome because he feels unwanted and unneccessary, offended by ceremonies at public audiences, etc. Dated Rome, Feb. 13, 1709. Also the same letter in French. Together 5 pages.

Curialium et Litigantium Commoditati Dies, in Quibus sit Rota, Camera, Signitura Gratiae, & Iustitiae. Calendar of the Rota , listing the scheduled sessions from October 2, 1709 to July 4, 1710. Broadside, within ornamental border; with woodcut disk listing the various deans of the Papal Court within large ornamental engraving. Large folio, folded.

(Morosini, Giovanni). Relazione Ambasceria. Copy of a report from France, where Morosini was Venetian Ambassador from 1668-1671. This report was published as Relatione di Francia in Barrozi Merchet's "Relationi degli Stati Europaei, Ser. II, vol. 3, in 1856. 32 pages.

Curialium, et Litigantium Commoditati Dies, in Quibus sit Rota, Camera, Signitura Gratiae, & Iustitiae. Calendar of the Rota, listing the scheduled sessions from October 1, 1710 to July 6, 1711. Broadside within ornamental border; with woodcut disk within ornamental engraving. Large folio, folding. A few small holes, without loss of text.

Bonaventura, Sebastiano Pompilio, Bishop of Montefiascone. Lettera Pastorale...al Ciero delle sue Diocesi...sopra gl'Esercizi Spirituali da farsi ogn'Anno. Secondo l'Ordine di nostro Signore Clemente XI. Pastoral letter of religious observance. Printed pamphlet. 31 pages, 8vo. Montefiascone, nella Stamperia del Seminario, 1710. Very rare early print of Montefiascone, not in the catalogues of the BN or BM.

Clement XI, Pope. Charissimo in Christo Filio Nostro Philippo Hispaniorum Regi Catholico. Philip V, King of Spain. Risposta del Ré al Retroscritto Breve del Papa. Copy of Clement XI's breve, in Latin, to Philip V, dated Rome, Feb. 22, 1710 and of Philip V's answer, dated Madrid, June 18, 1710. 21 pages. See L. Pastor XV, pp. 54-55.

Informatione di quanto desidera La Fedelissima Città di Senigaglia di Supplicare la...clemenza di... Clemente XI. Copy of a petition to Clement XI for assistance to the city of Senigallia for construction of the port by a Genoese architect. Unsigned, undated (1711). 2-1/2 pages.
Pignatelli, Cardinal Francesco, Archbishop of Naples. Copy of a letter concerning the Monastery of D'Alvina. Signed and dated Naples, Oct. 3, 1711. 2-1/2 pages.
Proviste di Cariche publicate il di 26 Settembre 1712. A list of the appointees for office at the Papal Court. Sept., 1712. 4 pages.

Requisti del dottore Domenico Chiocci...concorrente alla carica d'Avvocate Fiscale della Ruota Criminale della Serenissima Republica di Genoa. Broadside, shaved on top, concerning the appointment to Fiscal Advocate of Dr. Domenico Chiocci, in 1712. Genoa, Giov. Battista Celle, n.d.

Bentivoglio, Mart. Cornelio, Cardinal. Discorso...fatto nella prima Udienza havuta dal re li...Ottobre 1712. Copy of a discourse held by Cardinal Bentivoglio, Nuncio at the court of France, at his first audience with Louis XIV, priasing him for fighting the "hydra of heresy." 2-1/2 pages.
(Ruggia, Stefano). Letter to Ruggia in Rome by Michel Francesco (signature damaged and illegible), dated Ancona, May 15, 1712. 1 page.
Borromeo, Carlo, Count of Arona, Viceroy of Naples. Copy of a letter to him, signed by the Queen (Maria Louisa of Savoy, wife of Philip V?) and dated Barcelona, March 19, 1712. 9 pages.

Aldrovandi, Pompeo. Discorso fatto...nella Prima Udienza havuta li 5 Giugno 1713 dal Rè di Francia, e Risposta data dalla... Ms. copy of a speech held by Pompeo Aldrovandi at an audience with Louis XIV, and the King's answer. Aldrovandi had been sent to Paris by Pope Clement XI in order to work for reconciliation between Madrid and Rome, since he had been Nuncio in Spain. 3-1/2 pages.

Gondi, Nicolo, Senator. Complimento fatto...La sera de 2.Decembre 1713 a S.A.R. nel Palazzo de'Pitti, accompgnato dà tutto il Senato. Speech held by Gondi, as the leader of the Senate, to Cosimo III de'Medici, Grand Duke of Toscana, at the Palazzo Pitti. The occasion was Cosimo's nomination of Giovan Gastone as his new heir, since his son Ferdinand had just died. 3 pages, 4to.

Victor Amadeo II, Duke of Savoy, King of Sicily. Printed notice concerning postal dispatches within Italy. Broadside, folio, folded. With a large coat of arms of the Duke, engraved by Niccolo Filippone. Palermo, nella Regia Stamperia, 1713.

Gran Croci Capitolari, e Commendi e Aumenti di Grazia conferite nell'anno del Capitolo 1713. A list of honors bestowed in the year 1713. 1-1/2 pages and address page, addressed to Galeotti Uffredum, Rome. Large folio, folded. An original letter with wax seal.
(Congregatione del Santo Angelo Custode). Proposed rules and regulations, dated Milan, March 29, 1713, and signed by Pietro Francesco Vandone, Canceliere. Large folio, folded. 7 pages.

Casanata, Girolamo, Cardinal (?). Copy of a correspondence with Emperor Leopold I concerning the Bishoprics of Passau and Salzburg. With reference to Theodore Heinrich Strattman, Leopold's Chancellor. Undated and unsigned. (c. 1693) 8 pages.
ADMINISTRATIVE AND LEGAL DOCUMENTS
Ms. in Italian, one in Latin. 189 pages, numbered ff. 1-193. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. (Naples?), 17th century.

This volume contains miscellaneous documents concerning various administrative and legal matters of the city of Naples, including relations between the nobility of Naples and the King of Spain and his Viceroy, the Duke of Alba, covering the years from roughly 1557 to 1595. Written in the 17th century.
THE NEAPOLITAN CHURCH AND ARISTOCRACY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary vellum. Italy, probably 17th century.

did.unittitle: Instruttioni per l'Illustisssimo Tribunale della Fortificatione... di questa...Città da Napoli. 26 June, 1665. Printed in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 1-3.
Sentenza Definitiva et Declaratoria dell'Innocenza del P. Sacrestano de Carmelitani Scalzi. Printed in Italian. 1 page (f. 5). (Naples, August 13, 1646).
Paulus Garbinati V.I. Canonicus Neapolitanus... Printed in Latin. 2 pages, ff. 6r-6v. November 24, 1661. An ecclesiastical statement.
Sancti Angeli di Monte sive Sipontina. Purgationis Contumacionae. Printed in Latin. 5 pages, numbered ff. 8-10. Undated.
Raggioni per...Mastro di Campo Don Alvaro della Torre Tenente del Castel Nuovo, con...Don Diego de Quiroga. Printed. 4 pages, numbered ff. 11-12. In Italian. Undated.
I.M.I. Sancte Antoni Defende Causam Tuam. 3 pages, numbered ff. 13-14. Printed in Latin. Undated.
Sanctus Franciscus & Antonius de Padua intercedant pro...Monasterii eorum Religionis...scandala evitent... Printed in Latin. 3 pages, numbered ff. 15-16. Undated.
Francisci...Neap. de Nobilium familiarum... Ms. in Italian. 25 pages, numbered ff. 17-30. Essay on the origins of the families of the Neapolitan nobility.
