Tappia, Carlo de. Discorso del Signor Regente...Marchese di Belmonte... 12 pages, numbered ff. 31-37. Ms. in Spanish. Concerning the census in the Kingdom of Naples. Undated.
Raggioni per...Don Alvaro della Torre Tenente del Castel Nuovo con...Don Diego de Quiroga. Printed. 4 pages, numbered ff. 39-41. Undated.
Paulus Garbinati...Canonicus Neapolitanus... Legal document in Latin. 2 pages, f. 41. Undated.
Raggioni per la...Città di Napoli negli Affari della Santa Inquisizione. Printed document concerning the Inquisition. 20 pages, numbered ff. 43-48. Pesaro, 1661.

Venato, Petrus. Fit fides infra scriptum... Archival document relating to the Venato family. The oldest document is dated 1268, the most recent, 1499. Ms. in Latin. 38 pages, numbered ff. 49-75. The scribe has copied these documents in a broad humanist script. Undated.

Fidem facio ego... Ms. in Latin. 28 pages, numbered ff. 76-95. 4to. Each of the 13 notarial documents is notarized. They relate to various legal transactions, which took place between the years 1413 and 1539.

Pietro de Alessandro, Gioanne de Angelo, et...di Chianura pertinense di Napoli... Ms. in Italian and Latin. 10 pages, numbered ff. 96-110. Dated Jan. 28, 1613 and Sept. 12, 1615. 3 legal documents, all notarized.

Raggioni per la Fidelissima Città di Napoli negli affari della Santa Inqisizione... Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 111-119. Document setting forth the reasons on account of which the city of Naples believes that the Inquisition should not be established there. Heretical cases should be dealt with by ordinary tribunals. The item is a ms. copy of a printed piece of the same volume published by G.B. Giotti, Pesaro, in 1661 (leaves 44 and 48 of this volume). Pesaro, 1661.
Extractum Catholicum. Ms. in Latin. 3 pages, numbered ff. 120-121. Some names of liturgical players (in Greek) and excerpts from sacred texts.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eight ms. documents, comprising 600 pages. Folio. Loose in vellum folder. Italy, probably first half of the 18th century.

did.unittitle: Riflessione sopra la piena liberta ed assoluta independenza dello Stato di Firenze. Ms. in Italian. 75 pages, numbered ff. 1-37. Reflections upon the freedom of Florence, rebutting Emperor Charles VI's claims to the Dukedom of Tuscany. After the Treaty of Ratstatt (1714), which marked the establishment of Austrian supremacy over Italy, Charles VI had already established control of Milan, Mantua, and Sardinia. At the end, bibliographical lists of authors on the subject. Undated (early 18th century).

Enzio, Nicolo. Relazione della Corte di Roma. Ms. 70 pages, numbered ff. 1-35. Detailed report by Enzio, who was Venetian ambassador at the Papal Court during the papacies of Innocent XII and Clament XI, on the events in Rome. Dated Oct. 29, 1702.
Modi per conoscere i buoni Cavalli, loro vizi e difetti e per curare le loro infermita. Ms. 60 pages, numbered ff. 1-30. Treatise on horses and how to treat them. Undated.

Beatrice Cenci. Morte di Giacomo e Beatrice Cenci di lui sorella e di Lucrezia Petroni Cenci loro madringa. Ms. 34 pages, numbered ff. 1-18. An account of the murder of Francesco Cenci with gruesome detail of the execution of his sister Beatrice and her stepmother. The famous story which became the subject of Shelley's romantic tragedy. The execution took place in 1599. Undated.

Priviligei, Indulgenze, et altre Facolta concesse da Pontifici alla Re di Portogallo. Ms. 10 pages, numbered ff. 1-5. A chronological history of the special priviledges granted by Popes to the Kings of Portugal, spanning the years from 1436 to 1600. In Latin. Undated.
Uso delli Vesti per li...Patriarchi, Archivescovi, e Vescovi assistenti al Spoglio Pontifico... Ms. 19 pages. Detailed descriptions of ceremonial vestments and their colors. Undated.

Investiture Neapolitani Regni Carolo VI Imp. concesse... A scholarly historical, geographical, political, and legal treatise in Imperial investitures. Ms. in Latin. 157 pages, numbered ff. 1-79. Undated.
Investiture Neapolitani Regni Carolo VI Imp. concesse... A second copy of the same document as no. 7 above. Ms. 175 pages, numbered ff. 1-88.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: are in manuscript and 47 in print, plus 2 original water colors. Comprising altogether 275 pages. Various sizes. Loose in folio vellum binder. Italy, 18th and 19th century.

did.unittitle: Tres belle methode pour faire un gros vernis... Ms. in French. 5 pages, numbered ff. 1-3. Treatise on the making of varnishes. Undated.

Relazione della Solerne Beatificazione del...Michele de Santi... Printed leaflet. 4 pages, 4to. Rome, Stamp. Cracas, 1779. Account of the ceremonies in the Basilica Vaticana on May 2, 1779 on occasion of the beatification of Michele de Santi.

In Consistorio Secreto Habito die 18.Dec.1711. Ms. in Latin. 8 pages, numbered ff. 1-4. This secret consistory was held to announce to the Cardinals the election of Charles III of Spain, Hungary, and Bohemia, as King of the Romans and future Emperor.

In Consistorio Secreto habito die 16.Feb.1714. Ms. in Latin. 27 pages. This secret consistory confirms the decision of the Electors in Frankfurt in 1712 which had resulted in the election of Charles VI as future Emperor.

Ferrara, Fireworks. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages and 2 folio original water colors. An account of the expenses of the fireworks and machinery used in Ferrara for the celebration of Papal coronations. One water color represents a triumphal arch that was erected, in large folio; the other shows the site in Ferrara where the arch was placed at different locations, small folio. The report is dated April 5, 1736.

Specchio delle Forze Militari Austriache. Printed sheet, 4to., signed by Giuseppe Antonini di Montalboddo. An exact specification of the number of Austrian troops and their headquarters. Undated. Early 19th century.

Serie Cronologica degli...Signori Cardinali Diaconi dell'Insigne Basilica di S. Maria in Cosmedin. Printed leaflet. 6 pages, 4to. Chronological list of the Cardinals of S. Maria in Cosmedin, from 1062 to 1800, taken from Church archives. Undated, early 19th century.
Fra. Constantio. Letter to Sig. Tommaso Concha. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated 1783. 4to.
Pius VII. Copy of a letter. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated July 6, 1809.
Draft of a religious treatise. Ms. in Italian. 36 pages. 4to. Undated (after 1808).
Draft of a treatise in Latin. Ms. 21 pages. Undated.
De Lyceo Gregoriano patribus Soc. Iesu post decem lustra singulari beneficentia Leonis XII...1824 restituto. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, 4to. Rome, Franciscus Nourlaeus, 1824.

Pius IX, Pope, and Italian Politics of 1848. A collection of 43 printed broadsides, sheets and pamphlets, being proclomations for or against the Pope, extracts from newspaper articles, etc., and including three items by or on Vincento Gioberti. Various sizes. Altogether 143 printed pages. Dated 1846-1851.
MISCELLANEOUS HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 15 manuscript documents in Latin and Italian. 358

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: pages, numbered ff. 1-106, plus 2 page ms. index (loose). 4to. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Voti...Barberino Millino, Nazaret et Ascoli... Ms. in Italian. 15 pages, numbered ff. 3-10. Opinions of Cardinal Barberini, Mellino, Nazareth, and Ascoli concerning the Edict issued by the Spaniards and the Monarchy of Sicily. Undated.

Epistola Raimundi de Raimundettis Regii consiliarii Regni Sicilie... Ms. in Latin. 30 pages, numbered ff. 13-27. Signed by Raimundus Raimundettis. Panormi, Dec. 16, 1578. A letter to the Royal Councillor of the Kingdom of Sicily, R.R., to Marc'Antonio Colonna, dealing with the same subject as the previous item.

Ascanii Cardinalis Columna... Ms. in Latin. 12 pages, numbered ff. 29-34. Judicium (opinion) of Ascanio Cardinal Colonna, concerning the matters treated by Baronius in reference to the Kingdom of Sicily. Undated.

Ricordi di Papa Paolo III al Card. Farnese suo Nipote. Ms. in Italian. 13 pages, numbered ff. 35-41. Undated. Pope Paul III (1534-1549) was, prior to his appointment to the papacy, Alessandro Farnese. He is famous for his patronage of Michelangelo, for having convoked the Council of Trento, and for his nepotism. He took an active part in in the work of inner-ecclesiastical reformation.

The biography by C. Capasso (1925), and important books by Jedin and Friedensburg (1960, 1932) deal with him. On the court of Pope Paul III, we have L. Dorez' La Court du Pape Paul III (Paris, 1932) where, presumably, one could find out whether the Ricordi have been published or not.
Il Strattagemma di Carlo Nona Rè di Francia contro i Rebelli di Dio , et Suoi l'Anno 1572. Descritto da Camillo Capilupi. Ms. in Italian. 120 pages, numbered ff. 43-102. Undated.

This is the famous Report by Camillo Capilupi on the St. Bartholomew slaughter in France. Capilupi was born in Mantua and died around the close of the 16th century. The Report was written in Rome, as soon as news about the massacre began to arrive. Capilupi's account was printed, but G. Brunet says that the first edition is introuvable . The report was reprinted, according to Brunet, in Tome I of the Bibliothèque étranère edited by Aignan; also in Tome VII (Series I) of the Archives curieuses de l'Histoire de France .

Monitorio dell'eterna maledizione...fulminata da Papa Clemente VII. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 103-106. Dated October 12, 1526. This monitoro warns, under threat of dire punishment, all those who would abet and protect the adherents of the rebel Colonna family, who had risen against the Pope.

Innocentius Papa VIII. Jacobo Vulterrano. Ms. in Latin. 13 pages, numbered ff. 107-113. Undated. A message to Jacopo Volterrano (Jacopo Gherardi, 1434- 1516), Pope Innocent VIII's "trouble shooter," giving him instructions on what measures to take after the murder of Gerolamo Riario, who was killed April 14, 1488 after being the ruler of Forli for 8 years.

Innocentius Papa VIII Nuntio Suo. Ms. in Latin. 7 pages, numbered ff. 113v-116v. Dated April 24, 1487. Instructions of Pope Innocent VIII to his nuncio, advising him on how to conduct himself during talks with the Florentines and the Duke of Milan regarding the breach of trust committed by Ferdinand, King of Sicily.
Innocentius Papa VIII Eidem Nuntio... Ms. in Latin. 13 pages, numbered ff. 116v-122v. Dated Sept. 1487. Further instruction from Innocent VIII to his Nuncio.

Innocentius Papa VIII Regie Hispaniarum... Ms. in Latin. 9 pages, numbered ff. 122v-127. Pope Innocent states to the King of Spain and the other Christian princes that he has always acted in perfect sincerity and with paternal love towards Ferdinand of Castile, whereas the latter behaved in the opposite fashion towards him. Dated at the end: Sept. 8, 1487.

Innocentius Papa VIII. Ms. in Latin. 23 pages, numbered ff. 127v-138. Instructions of Pope Innocent VIII to the Bishop of Trani, informing him how to conduct negotiations with the Doge Agostino Barbarigo and the Senate in Venice, in regard to the bad faith of King Ferdinand of Spain. Dated at the end: Rome, March 22, 1588.

Supplica delli Conti Agostino Landi, Giovanni Angosciola...portata al signor Don Ferrante Gonzaga, Governator della Stato di Milano. Ms. in Latin. 22 pages, numbered ff. 139-150. Dated at end: Parma, December 1580. Landi, Angosciola (Anguissola?), Pallavinci, and Gonfalieri address Don Ferrante Gonzaga for not complying with the summons issued against them to appear in a Roman court, in order to contest the charge of having conspired to murder Pier Luigi Farnese. The reasons which impelled them to conspire are given.
Copia eiusdem Inquisitionis formatae contra Comitem Claudium Landum. Ms. in Latin. 22 pages, numbered ff. 151-163. Signed by Ferrando Gonzaga. Dated Mediolan, September 30, 1549.
Sixtus Quartus Dilecto Filio Nobili...Joanni Mocenigo... Ms. in Latin. 22 pages, numbered ff. 163-173v. Dated Rome, 1482.

Sixtus Papae Quartus. Ms. in Latin. 30 pages, numbered ff. 174-188. Dated at end 1482. Letter of Sisto IV, responding to some slanderous rumors put into circulation by the Venetians. Sisto lived from 1414-1484.
MISCELLANY
did.physdesc: 7 documents, 5 of which are manuscripts and 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: printed. Copmrising 107 pages. Folio. Vellum. Italy, probably early 18th century.

did.unittitle: Navagero, Bernardo. Di Constantinopoli. Ms. in Italian, 79 pages, numbered ff. 3-40. Navagero (1507-1565) was Venetian ambassador to Constantinople. This detailed report on Constantinople was read in the Venetian senate in February 1553. The present is a ms. copy of the report, which is printed in Alberi, Relazioni d. Abasc. Veneti , III, pp. 33-110.

Considerationi d'un Religioso di Loreto intorno al Parere dell'impedito Accademico Catenato , se Giesu N. Sig. fusse allatado nella Sta. Case di Loreto. Copy of a theological treatise on Loreto. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 41-43. Dated 1626.
Al pio...Lectore il Rigido Accademico humile di Loreto, professore della Sacra Theologica. Copy of an answer to the above treatise (no. 2). Ms. in Italian. 10 pages, numbered ff. 45-49. Undated.

Naples, Inquisition. Ms. in Italian. 31 pages, numbered ff. 51-66. A brief, maintaining the desirability to keep the authority of the Inquisition distinct from the ordinary jurisdiction of the Archbishop in Naples. Undated.
Naples. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (incomplete, belonging perhaps to another volume. Concerning piazzas in Naples. Undated.
Clement XI, Pope. Printed broadside, folio, folded. Rome, ex typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1709. Proclamation by the Pope against the Spanish treatise Relacion de lo sucedidi en Roma.

Tamburinus, Michaelis Angelus, S.J. Declaratio...super postulato unamiter sibi fauto a R.R. Patribus Assistentibus Nationum...Mense Novembri 1711. Printed pamphlet in Latin. 6 pages, 4to. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1711. A Jesuit proposition submitted to Pope Clement XI.
DOCUMENTS CONCERNING EVENTS FROM 1695 TO 1702

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: are in manuscript, 10 in print. Comprising 603 pages and including 1 original water color battle plan. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, early 18th century.

did.unittitle: Berlin. Ms. in Italian. 45 pages, numbered ff. 1-22. An interesting report on Berlin under Frederic III, dated Hanover 1695 and signed "Toland." The report is strongly pro-Prussian and anti-French.

Hanover. Ms. in Italian. 30 pages, numbered ff. 23-38. A report on the court of Hannover, written from Berlin to the Hague, dated 23 Sept., 1702. Apparently a sequel to the previous report by the same writer.
Rome, Teatro Alibert. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages. Copy of a contract by which Count Giacomo Alibert rents the theater to Marcello de Rosis. The theater is about to be rebuilt. Dated May 12, 1695.

Innocent XII, Pope. Ristretto delle Parti che si danno di pane alla Famiglia di Nro. Sig. Papa Innocentia XII. Aggiustato sotto il Primo Febraro 1695. Calligraphically written lists of bread allotments given to the numerous members of the Pope's retinue. 77 pages.
La Genealogia della nobile Famiglia de Marcheselli. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages. The Marcheselli family belonged to the aristocracy of Rimini, where they settled as early as 1160.

Ristretto de Pagamenti fatti...per l'Allogio fatto al Sig. Duca di Medinaceli , Vice Re di Napoli. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. A list of payments between March 1696 and October 1696 to the household of Duke Medicaneli, Viceroy of Naples.

Invito per la Giostra del Saracino...che si celebra li 28 Aprile. Printed broadside, large folio, folded. Ronciglione, 1697. Announcement of a tournament and festivities honoring S. Ferma Virgin in Civita Vecchia in 1697.
Negroni, Gardinal G.F. Printed letter to Monsig. Spinola, Archbishop of Genoa. In Italian. Dated Rome, Jan. 18, 1697. 2 pages.
Donato, Giovanni. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Letter by the Armenian merchant Donato, recounting his adventures on his voyage to Persia. Dated Oct. 9, 1697.

Louis XIV, King of France. Copy of a letter written by Louis XIV to Pope Innocent XII, Dated 27 Dec., 1698. Concerning the excitement caused by the publication of Fenelon de Salignac de la Mothe's Maximes des Saints , a famous document in the controversy about Quietism. The Pope issued a Breve on the book in 1699. Ms. in Italian. 1 page.

In nome del Re Cattolico... Ms. in Italian. 10 pages. A document, dated May 12, 1698, concerning a memo sent to the Pope regarding rights granted to the Jesuits by Pope Pius IV through a breve in 1563, including the Latin text of Pius IV's breve.

Arresto della Corte del Parlamento...sopra la condanna del libro entitclato Esplicacione della Massime de'Santi... Ms. in Italian. 10 pages. Decree by the French Parliament regarding the condemnation of Fenelon's Maxime des Saints by Papal breve. (see no. 9) Dated August 14, 1699.
Cloche, Antonius, O.P. Printed letter in Latin, written by Cloche to the Dominicans, dated Rome, March 26, 1700. 4 pages.
Patrone, Ferdinando. Printed letter in Italian. 11 pages. Undated. (1700). Concerning the cost of water works in the Civita Vecchia.

Casanate, Cardinal Girolamo. Avvertimenti... Printed pamphlet in Italian. 8 pages. Official announcement concerning the preparations for the Anno Santo in 1700. Dated Dec. 1, 1698. Rome, stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1698.
Dubia Proposita in Sacra Congragazione Rituum... Ms. in Latin. 2 pages. Dated Jan. 23, 1700. Concerns questions of ceremonial.
Questions of Clerical and Secular Power. Ms. in Italian. 10 pages. Quoting decisions at the Council of Trent.
Nel passagio per questa Città d'Ancona del Sig. Cardinal d'Este... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. Detailed account of a visit to Ancona by Cardinal d'Este. Undated.
Notitia de Privilegi, che gode L'Illustrissima Casa Campeggi di Bologna. Printed leaflet in Italian. 4 pages. On the privileges of the Campeggi family of Bologna. Undated.

Per li vescovi di Regno di Napoli Contro il Nuntio Apostolico. Ms. in Italian. 35 pages. Protests of the Bishops of Naples against the Papal Nuncio, setting forth their grievances. Undated (end of 17th century).

Discorso Primo (and Secondo) all'Ecclesiastico m=non conviensi lo Studio Profano. Ms. in Italian. 21 pages. Two discourses on whether the study of secular literature befits an ecclesiastic person; the first discourse gives a negative, the second a positive answer. Of interest to the historian of "Christian humanism." Undated.

Bouillon, Cardinal de. Supplica al S. Collegio. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. The Cardinal asks the Sacred College to intervene on his behalf with Louis XIV. As French ambassador to Rome, he had not carried out the French King's instructions concerning the condemnation of Fenelon's book on Quietism (see Nos. 9 and 11) and he desired to regain the King's favor. 1700.

Lettera del S. Collegio al Re di Francia. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Copy of a letter by the Sacred College to King Louis XIV, assuring him that the authors of a damnable leaflet against French interests have been imprisoned.

Copia della Lettera del Clero di Francia al Re. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Copy of a letter sent by the French clergy to Louis XIV, expressing their solidarity with the King in his difficult negotiations with the Pope.

Nota dei Nomi, Cognomi, e partii degl'...Cardinal viventi... Printed broadside, folio, folded. Rome, stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1700. List of living Cardinals, with the dates of their appointments.
Salviati, Marchese. Copy of a letter from Paris, Nov. 16, 1700, announcing that on this date Louis XIV had proclaimed the Duke of Anjou (Philip V) as King of Spain. Ms. in Italian. 1 page.

Albero prodotto da i Francesi nella Congregatione dell'Investitura a fattore della Successione del Duca d'Angio. Ms. in Latin. 3 pages. The genealogical table of the Duke of Anjou, submitted by the French to the Congregation of the Investitures in order to receive the ratification of this appointment. 1700.

Louis XIV. Traduzione della Lettera scritta dalla Maesta del Re Christianissimo...alla Maesta della Regina di Spagna... Printed leaflet. 8 pages. Rome, Eredi del Corbelletti, 1700. Louis XIV's letter to the Spanish Queen, announcing to her the successor to the Spanish throne, dated Nov. 12, 1700; together with an account of the coronation of Philip V in Madrid on Nov. 24, 1700.

In vero Interesse de Principe Christiani... Ms. in Italian. 79 pages. A comprehensive treatise, setting forth the various reasons against the appointment of the Duke of Anjou to the Spanish throne. 1700.

Clausulos del Testamiento que otorgo el Rey Carlos Segundo ...tocantes a la formazion de la Junta de Governio. Ms. in Spanish, dated Oct. 2, 1700. 3 pages. Copy of clauses in the Testament of Charles II of Spain concerning his succession.

Louis XIV, King of France. Lettere patenti del Re. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Copy of a letter by Louis XIV, decreeing that the Duke of Anjou (Philip V of Spain) shall preserve his right of succession to the Crown of France.

Sagra Cesarea e Real Maesta... Ms. in Italian. 6 pages. Copy of a letter to Emperor Leopold I by his emissary in Rome, with information about diplomatic, military, and political events which threaten the status quo, especially inasfar as the Austrian domains in Lombardy are concerned. Dated Rome, Jan. 1, 1700.

Memoria delle oblationi fatte per parte del Re al Duca di Savoia. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. Memoir on the offers made by Louis XIV to the Duke of Savoy in order to preserve the peace in Italy and to prevent Austrian hegemony in Italy. 1700.
Cesarini, Gaetano. Ms. in Italian and French. 1 page. Copy of a letter of apology. 1700.
Philip V, King of Spain. Philippus Dei Gratia Rex. Printed proclamation. 4 pages. Naples, 1701. With woodcut of Spanish arms on title.

Complimento fatto del Principe Eugenio di Savoia coll'Altessa dell'Arciduca nel pertirsi da Vienna... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. An account of the festivities for Prince Eugene of Savoy on departing for Italy. The festivities were held in Vienna and were presided over by the Archduke of Austria. With a list of the Austrian nobility accompanying the Prince of Savoy. 1701.

Risposta al manifesto del Duca di Moles Amb. del già Carlo II, Rè delle Spagne. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages. A point by point refutation of the manifest by the Duke di Moles, the Spanish ambassador, concerning the intentions of Charles II of Spain regarding the succession of the throne. Moles is accused of having conspired against Spain and France with Austria and Holland. He had opposed the appointment of the Duke of Anjou to the throne of Spain. 1701.

Emperor Leopold I. SS. Patri nostro Clementi XI Pontefici... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Leopold's answer to a letter written to him by Pope Clement XI. He is setting forth Austria's claim to the Spanish succession. Dated Vienna, March 20, 1701.

Li stato proclamato il monitoria contro il Duca Gaetani. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Charges against Gaetani, Governor of Rome, of having armed 300 persons to fight against the implementation of Papal bulls, etc. 1701.

Biglietto mandato Domenica mattina per tempo da Monsignor Massei all'amb. di Venzia. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Concerning the impending transit of German troops through Venetian territories, the dispatch of couriers to Vienna and to France, the rejection of the Nunciature of Vienna, etc. 1701.
Sacra Cesarea e Real Maesta. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. A report on the diplomatic and political news from Rome to the Emperor. Undated (1701).

Capitolo di Venezia... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. News relating to the beginning of the War of the Spanish Succession: French Troops marching on Mantuan territory under the General Catinat against the Austrian army under Prince Eugene of Savoy. Dated April 30, 1701.

Copia tratta della Spagnolo... Ms. in Italian, translated from Spanish. 2 pages, 4to. Copy of a letter sent by the Spanish governor of Milan to the Duke of Mantua, relating to the defense of Mantuan territory. Dated April 1, 1701.
Copia di Lettera venuta al amb. di Venezia. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated Venice, April 9, 1701.

Dal campo di Castelluccio. Ms. in Italian, translated from the French. 3 pages. Copy of a letter to the King of France concerning the French troops in Italy during the first months of the War. Dated April 5, 1701.
Instruction sur les rentes Viageres dites de la Tontine que le Roy veut establir en faveur des habitants d'Avignon. Printed leaflet in French. 4 pages, folio, folded. Avignon, M. Chastel, 1701.
Il Re Christianissimo ha fatto intendere... Ms. in Italian. 3 pages. Military news about the positions of the French, Austrians, English, and Spanish. 1701.
Delci, Orazio. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Copy of a recantation by Delci, a nobleman, before his death, of his writings directed agaisnt eminent persons. Dated April 13, 1701.
Rome, April 17, 1701. Ms. letter in Italian. 1 page.
Copia di Memoriale scritto a Nostro Signore. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, 4to. Memoir concerning a celebration in S. Lorenzo di Mantua. Dated August 10, 1701.
Letter from Venice. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Dated Aug. 20, 1701.
Riporte e risposte dell'Amb. Cesareo. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Dated Bologna, Aug. 23, 1701.

Spinelli, Francesco, Duke of Castelluccia. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages. Copy of a manifest by Spinelli, explaining his motives for his expedition on Naples of Sept. 23, 1701. Dated Chiari, Oct. 22, 1701.
Louis XIV. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. Copy of a letter by Louis XIV to the King of Spain, approving of the latter's plan to invade Italy and promising French troops to be sent to Naples. Marly, 1702.

Sagra Cesarea e Real Maesta... Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Detailed report from Rome to Leopold I concerning the repercussions at the Papal Court of the French invasion of northern Italy. Dated Rome, Jan. 22, 1701.

Sacra Cesarea e Real Maesta... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. Another report from Rome to Leopold I concerning the indecision of the Pope and other matters concerning the Papal Court. Dated Rome, Jan. 17, 1701.
Sagra... Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Another report from Rome to the Austrian Emperor, concerning the death of the French ambassador, etc. Dated Rome, Jan. 8, 1701.
Sagra Cesarea... Ms. in Italian. 6 pages. Another report from Rome to Leopold I, including a letter sent to Rome by Count Martinitz from Vienna on Jan. 21, 1701.
Sagra Cesarea... Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Another report from Rome to Leopold I, dated Jan. 29, 1701.

Informazione historica sopra il Ducato di Milano doppo l'erezzione del Regne di Lombardia. Ms. in Italian. 32 pages. An historical memoir intended to supply the background for the controversies which arose after the death of Charles II of Spain. 1701.
Nota della divisione della Monarchia di Spagna firmata in Londra il 15 Maggio 1700. Ms. in Italian. 1 page.

Leopold I, Emperor. Editto di Cesare di Milanese Leopoldus. Ms. in Latin and Italian. 23 pages. An edict by the Emperor, dated May 21, 1701, with a proclamation against the edict by Henry of Lorraine and Marshall Catinat, dated July 22, 1701.

Philip V of Spain. Ms. in Italian. 1 page. Copy of a letter to his sister and aunt, advising her to retire to one of the Spanish cities until rumors, disturbing the harmony between them, have subsided. Dated Bayona, Jan. 10, 1701.

Protesta... Ms. in Italian. 10 pages. A protest by Ferdinand Charles, Duke of Mantua, against the financial damages inflicted on him by the Austrians. Together with a letter from an Austrian official. Dated Mantua, Aug. 20, 1701.

Elector of Cologne. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Copy of a letter to the Electors of Mainz, objecting against the Vienna decree dispensing the subjects of the Duke of Mantua from their oath of obedience to him. Dated Bonn, July 23, 1701.
Sagra Cesarea e Real maesta... Ms. in Italian. 7 pages. Report from Rome to Leopold I on the situation in Italy after the Franco-Spanish invasion. Dated Rome, Feb. 12, 1701.
Sagra Cesarea e Real Maesta... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages. Another report from Rome to Leopold I, dated Dec. 1701.
Battaglia di Chiari, Sept. 1701. Original water color of the battle and a 1 page ms. key and explanation. Together 2 pages.
Ferrara, July 13, 1701. Ms. in Italian, 3 pages. Report on the German military invasion.
FIVE PLAYS
did.physdesc: 5 plays in ms. in Italian. 538 pages, numbered

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ff. 1-271. 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Sordini d'Atri, Pietro paolo. Il Principe Innamorato di se stesso ovvero gli inganni fortunati. Ms. in Italian. 128 pages, numbered ff. 1-64. Undated. Sordini is not mentioned in the standard history of 17th century Italian literature, the Seicento , by Antonio Belloni. This tragicomedy was performed apparently under Francesco Boccalari in 1668.
Della Rivalita Generosa. Ms. in Italian. 154 pages, numbered ff. 67-143. A tragedy, interspersed with lighter scenes. No author's name is given. 17th century.
Il Duca di Baviera, opera Spagnola... Ms. in Italian. 54 pages, numbered ff. 144-170. No author's name is given. 17th century. A pseudo- historical tragedy.
Burlandosi se fa da Vero. Ms. in Italian. 48 pages, numbered ff. 171-194. No author's name is given. 17th century.

Brignole-Sale, Antonio Giulio. La pazza finta pazza. Ms. in Italian. 154 pages, numbered ff. 195-271. A comedy by the author of a collection of heterogeneous and bizarre short stories (Le instabilita dell'ingegno, Bologna, 1635). Brignole- Sale was born in Genove in 1605 and died in 1665. He was Ambassador to Spain, a poet, and entered the Jesuit Order during the last years of his life. This comedy is probably unprinted. 17th century.
MISCELLANY
did.physdesc: 70 documents, 5 in Ms. and 65 printed, together

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: comprising 356 pages. 8vo, 4to, and folio sizes bound into a 4to volume. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 1667 to 1744.

did.unittitle: Relazione dell'incoronazione di Carlo quinto. An. 1529. Ms. in Italian. 31 pages. An account of the coronation of the Spanish Emperor Charles V, which took place in Bologna, by the hands of Pope Clement VII. This is the Italian translation of the Spanish original penned by Gonzalo Illescas.
Discorso Istorico della Incoronazione de i Rè di Napoli. Printed. 1 page. Naples, n.d.
Relatione dell'Allegrezze fatte in Roma per la Nascita di Ferdinando... Printed. 15 pages. In Italian. Rome, 1667.
Vera Relatione dell'Infermità e delle Morte...di Alessandro VII... Printed, in Italian. 8 pages. Rome, 1667.
Breve relacion de la Fiesta que...Marques del Carpio Virrey ...del Reyno de Napoles...Hizo el dia 26 de Iulio del año 1685. Printed in Spanish. 4 pages. In duplicate. Naples, 1685.
Breve Relazione...di Maria Luisa Borbone... dall'...Marchese del Carpio. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Naples, 1685.
Relazione dell'Ultima Infermita, e morte di...Innocenzo XI ... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1689.

Funtione funebre Fatta a di 28 Sett. 1700 nella Morte di papa Innocentio XI... Engraved plate. 1 page, folded folio, representing the funeral of Pope Innocent XI at the Vatican Basilica, showing the funeral procession, with a picture of the Basilica of St. Peter and the Castel s'Angelo, etc. Without name of artist or engraver.

Diario Curioso, et Esatto Di Giorni...dalli 27 Settembre 1700...alli 23 di Novembre ...nel quale fu creato Sommo Pontefice...Giov. Fra. Albani, che volle esser chiamato Clemente Undecimo... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Folio, folded. Rome, 1700.
Nuovo Diario Curioso...Clemente XI... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Folio, folded. With engraved portrait of Clement XI, by Ant. Lesma. Rome, 1700.
Relazione Gio. Francesco Albani d'Urbino. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages.
Relazione della Vittoria Ottenuto dalle...Galere... Printed in Italian. 6 pages. Rome, 1700.
Distinta Relazione...del Nuovo Sommo Pontefice Clemente XI... Printed in Italian. 4 pages, with a large woodcut printer's device on title. Rome, 1700.
Compita, e Veridica Relazione Delle Cermonie...per l'Incoronazione di...Clemente XI. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. (Rome, 1700?)
Breve Notitia...nella Citta d'Urbino per l'Escelatione dell Em.mo Albani al Ponteficato. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Urbino, 1701.
Ragvaglio nella Chiesa di S. Luigi. In Occasione della ceremonia prattica nel conferirsi Il Cordone Bleux... Printed in Italian. 6 pages and title. Rome, 1700.
Esatta Notizia...il Giubileo, e...della solennità colle quale il Pontefice Reng. Clemente XI Volle chiudere della Basiloca Vaticana. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1700.
Relazione della Gare della Giustizia , e Clemenza,. ..della Santità di N.S. Clemente XI... Printed in Italian. 20 pages. Pesaro, 1701.
Veridica, e Distinta Relazione Overo Diario de'danni...dalli 14.Gennaro alli 2. di Febraro 1703. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Folded folio. Rome, 1703.

Lettera scritta da...Giuseppe Guerriri al Sig. Presidente Don Niccolò Caravita. Ms. in Italian. 10 pages. An account of the earthquake which struck Aquila in the Abruzzi, on Jan. 14, 1703. Niccolo Caravita (1647-1717), a Neapolitan law professor, is famous for having written a work, Nullum ius Romani Pontificis in Regnum Neapolitanum , in which he proves the invalidity of Papal claims to the Kingdom of Naples. The copy of this letter is dated: Aquila, March 9,...(1703).
Veridica, e Distinta Relazione de i daneggiamenti causati dalle aescrescenze del Po in Mantova, Ferrara, e Pavia... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1705.
Breve, e Distinta Nototia Dell'antichissimo...Crocefisso...Di S. Lorenzo... Printed in Italian. 6 pages. N.pl., p.d.

Breve Relazione dell'Imagine della Gran Madre de Dio...in S. Marcello di Roma l'anno 1706 nell'Altare del B. Pellegrino. Printed broadside. 1 page in Italian. Folio, folded. With an engraved picture of the Madonna and Child. Rome, 1706.
Estatissima Descrizzione Di tutte le Feste...di S. Carlo 4 del presente Novembre 1709....In occasione del Giorno Natalizio...di Carlo Terzo... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1709.
Vera Imago Acheropaeta SS. Salvatoris...à S. Domino Nostro Clemente Papa XI. Printed in Latin. 1 page. Small folio. With a woodcut representation of Christ. Rome, 1709.
Distinto Ragvaglio...nella Capella detta Sancta Sanctorum... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, n.d.
Vera, e Distinta Relazione Della solenne Processione ...dalla Chiesa Santa Maria sopra Minerva alla Basilica Vaticana... Printed in Italian. 4 pages, 8vo. Rome, 1709.
Relazione del Celebre Miracolo di S. Giacinto... Fatto representar...il Cardinale Pietro Ottoboni... Printed in Italian. 4 pages, 8vo. Rome, n.d. (1711).

Altezza Reale... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, large 4to. Publicata in Casale...2 Lugio 1713. A petition presented to King Vittorio Amadeo of Savoy by his Attorney General, Rivalta, a propos of some disturbances which occurred in the Cathedral of Casale Monferrato on the occasion of a solemn procession.

As a result of these disturbances, the Bishop of Casale had excommunicated Count Giacomo Nemours. To the petition is attached a copy of a decree issued by King Vittorio Amadeo on July 8, 1713, by which he declares the action of the bishop to be unjustified, and he takes action to correct it.
Relazione dell'Ingresso Solenne Nella Città di Narni Printed in Italian. 11 pages. Rome, 1709.
D.O.M. Ornamenti (Trionfi vol Armente detti) per le Tavole ...di...Papa Clemente Undecimo... Printed in Italian. 8 pages, 4to. Rome, 1713.
Descrizione del Publico Ingresso...in Roma li 12.Agosto 1714...dall'...Nicolo Duodo Ambasciator di Venezia...di...Clemente XI. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1714.
Ingresso in Rome dall'...Sig. Gio. Vinceslao di Gallas ...Il di 13.Maggio, 1714. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, (1714).
Descrittione del Corteggio...Data della Santità di...Papa Clemente XI...al Gio. Vinceslao di Gallas. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Rome, 1714.
Solenne Ingresso...in Roma...26.Luglio 1714 dall'Sig...Wolfgango Annibale Schrattembach. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Rome, 1714.
D.O.M. Ornamenti (Trionfi volgarmente detti)...di Papa Clemente XI. Anno MDCCXIV. Printed in Italian. 20 pages. Rome, 1714.
Dichiarazione Dell'Allegoria degl'Ornati... nel Palazzo Apostolico... Printed in Italian. 19 pages. Rome, 1715.
Veridica Relazione Della Infermità, e Morte..Re de Francia Luigi XIV... Printed. 4 Pages. Paris, Sept. 2, 1715. (Rome, 1715).
Illuminazione...in Roma per le Nascita dell'...Carlo VI. Printed in Italian. 12 pages. Rome, 1716.
Racconto delle Feste...in Roma ...si diede Sig. Papa Clemente XI della Nascita del...Leopoldo... Printed in Italian. 12 pages. Rome, 1716.
Relazione Succinta Delle Festività...in Vienna ...della...Nascita del...Leopoldo. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. (Rome?), 1716.
Dimostrazioni di Gioja per la Vittoria, & Acquisto di Belgrado. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Rome, 1717.
Relazione. Il Rè Giacomo III d'Inghilterra... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, large 4to. 1717.
La Piu'Estatta, e Distinta Relazione Della Solenne Cavalcata...del Possesso presso Domenica 16.Novembre 1721...di Papa Innocenzo XIII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1721.
Motti, & Emblemi alludenti al Nome... Printed in Italian. 5 pages. Folio, folded. Rome, 1721. With a large engraving showing the procession.
Veridico Ragvaglio...di Innocenzo XIII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages, folded folio, including an engraved portrait of the Pope, by Felippo Nevi, scul. Rome, (n.d.).

Descrizione della Macchina de'Fuochi di Gioja Fatti in Piazza di Spagna... l'Anniversario della Nascita...del Re Filippo V. Printed in Italian. 7 pages and large folded engraved plate "Dissegno della Macchina di Fuoco..." showing an arch of triumph...by Domenico Paradisi of Rome, architect to the Pope.
Relazione della Cerimonia...di Ludovico XV...di Francia. Printed in Italian. 11 pages. Rome, 1722.
Distinta Relazione...di tutte le Cerimonie della...Coronazione di...Benedetto XIII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1724.
Distinta Relazione della...Cavalcata in Occasione del Possesso preso dalla Santita di...Papa Benedetto XIII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. (Rome, 1724).
Veridica Relazione...di Papa Benedetto XIII Con... Descrizzione dell'Arco Trionfale. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Folded folio. (Rome, 1724).
Hortus Conclusus. Machina de Fuochi Artificiali...in Loreto. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Ancona, 1726.
Relazione dell'Audienza Pubblica...Antonio Rambaldo. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Rome, 1730.
Relazione del Tremuoto Intesosi in Questa Città di Napoli. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Naples, 1732.
Relazione Succinta...accaduto in Ancona. Printed in Italian. 3 pages. Ancona, (1733).
Distinto Ragguaglio Del spaventoso Temporale, e Borasca di Mare...in Ancona. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Ancona, 1733.
Nella Solenne Fondazione della Prima Pietra del nuovo Lazzaretto in Isola ...in Ancona dalla... Beneficenza...Clemente XII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Folio. Ancona, 1733.
Relazione Essendosi deganta le Sanità di Nostro Signore. Printed in Italian. 4 pages, folio. Jesi, 1734.
Notitia del Giovanetto Inglese...alla fede Cattolica. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages. Ancona, May 1735.
Distinta Relazione delle Solenne Feste, e Illuminazioni Fatte in Napoli ...del felice Ritorno...di Carlo, Re di Napoli... Printed in Italian. 8 pages, 8vo. Naples, 1735.
Relazione del...Apparato e delle Sagre Funzioni...in occasione del Triduo ...in Roma...ad Onore della B. Michelina da Pesaro. Printed in Italian. 24 pages, 4to. Rome, 1737.
Relazione delle Funzioni...di Ravenna per l'Erezione della Statua di...Clemente XII. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Ravenna, (1738).
Distinta Relazione...da Raguaglio delle Ceremonie...doppo la morte...di Clemente XII. Printed in Italian and Latin. 4 pages. Rome, 1740.
Succinta Descrizzione...per il Funerale...di Clemente XII. Printed in Italian. 8 pages, 4to. Rome, 1740.
Relazione della...Elezione del...Benedetto XIV. Printed in Italian. 4 pages, small 4to.. Rome, 1740.
Compita, e distinta Relazione di Tutte le Funzioni...nella...Coronazione del...Benedetto XIV. Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome, 1740.
Distinta Relazione della Solenne Cavalcata...Benedetto XIV... With folded folio engraved plate of the "Cavalcata." Printed in Italian. 8 pages, 4to. Rome, 1741.
Distinta Relazione dell'Orrible Terremoto...di Aprile...1741, nelle Città di Camerino, Urbino, Pesaro, Jesi, e Fabriano... Printed in Italian. 4 pages. Rome and Velleteri, (1741).
Breve Relazione d'una Grazia Singloare...da S. Francesco Saviero...nella Chiesa del Gesu' di Roma. Printed in Italian. 8 pages. Rome?, 1744.
DOCUMENTS FROM THE ROMAN CHANCERY
did.physdesc: 6 documents, all in manuscript. Latin and Italian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 188 pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, middle of the 18th century.

did.unittitle: Acta Cancellariae Apostolicae ab Anno 1664 ad (1741). Ms. in Latin. 105 pages. Copies of acts from the Papal Chancellery.
Congregazione 1741. Ms. in Latin. 1 page, 4to.
Noma et Cognomina. Ms. in Latin. 1 page. List of the names of the Abbreviatores of the Presidenza Maggiores for 1664.
Abbreviatores di Maggior Presidenza. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. A petition to Pope Benedict XIII, dated Sept. 5, 1729, from his abbreviatores, asking for permission to use the surplice.

Clement XII, Pope. Ms. in Latin, 3 pages. Copy of a Papal bull, dated February, 1735, acknowledging Clement's gratitude to Giuseppe Filippo Simonetti, one of his abbreviatores, appointing him to abbreviator literarum aposticolarum.
Clement XII, Pope. Ms. in Latin. 6 pages, 4to. A similar bull, conferring a similar appointment to Lazaro Opitio Pallavicini. Dated May 13, 1735.
INTRODUTTIONE MATEMATICA...GEOGRAPHICHE
Introduttione Matematica Per La Intelligenza delle Tavola Geographiche. Manuscript in Italian. 165 pages. Small 4to. Limp vellum. Italy, probably 17th century.
A treatise on cartography, giving the mathematical basis for understanding and for drawing maps and plans.
MISCELLANEOUS POEMS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three manuscripts, comprising 357 pages. 8vo. Limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Lopez de Vega. Diversas Comedias: La Locura por la Hondra; El Perro del Hortulan; La Fortuna Merecida. Ms. in Spanish, 265 pages.

Two Italian Poems: Ad Angelica. Love poem in octaves; Disaggi che si pateno ne le Carcere. Satirical poem in octaves on the discomforts of prison. Author unknown. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 137-143.

Several poems in Italian. Manuscript. 80 pages. A collection of elegaic, satirical, and scatalogical poems. The sonnet on f. 147 is undoubtedly by Luigi Tansillo (1510-1568), and the other poems might also be by him.
FIANO, O.L. CAPITOLI...DA OSSERVARSI...

Fiano, Orazio Ludovisio, Duke di. Capitoli e Leggi Da osservarsi inviolabilmente per ordine espresso dall' Santita di Nro. Sig. Dalle Milizie a piedi, et a Cavallo dello Stato Ecclesiastico. Manuscript. 136 pages. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Rome, 1622.
Manuscript copy of a report by the General of the Papal troops, dated Rome, July 31, 1622, and printed in the Vatican in 1622.
VARIOUS POEMS
Manuscript in Italian. 170 pages, 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, probably 17th century.
An anthology of poems by the 16th century Italian poet Paolo Pacelli and others (?), all copied by the same hand, probably in the 17th century.
ASTROLOGICAL AND ALCHEMICAL TEXTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, probably written in the 17th century.

did.unittitle: Testis est mihi... Manuscript in Latin. 69 pages, numbered ff. 1-42v. With several diagrams. Treatise on Astrology, apparently a compilation. Author not given.
Camillo, Giulio. Fragmento delle tre transmutationi. Ms. in Latin. 14 pages, numbered ff. 43-50. Concerning Alchemy. Camillo was a Renaissance rhetotician and practitioner of mnemonics, etc.
TREATISES ON THE ARTS OF LANGUAGE

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: (Cambiasi, Father ?). De Arte Retorica. Brevis Institutio. Ms. in Latin. 158 pages, numbered ff. 1-79v. A treatise on rhetoric, probably destined for students in Jesuit schools, by Father Cambiasi? On leaf 2 (r & v), a poem in honor of Cambiasi. N.pl., n.d.
De Arte Poetica. Brevis Institutio. Ms. in Latin. 57 pages, numbered ff. 81-109. A manual of Poetics.
Brevis Tractatus de Epistolis. Ms. in Latin. 41 pages, numbered ff. 110-130. A treatise on letter writing.
NEGOTIATIONI DI PACE...

Negotiationi di Pace delli signori Elettori di Magonza e di Colonia, fatte in Francoforto dalle Loro Altezze Elettoral, tra il...Duca di Grandmont et Signore di Lionne, Ambasciatori...di Francia, e il signor Conte di Peñaranda, Ambasciatore di Spagna, nell'anno 1658. Ms. in Italian. 172 pages, 4to. Contemporary vellum. Table of contents at the beginning. Italy, after 1658.

The French original was printed in Paris by Sebastian Cramoisy, Printer to the King and Queen of France, in 1658. This document relates to the Meeting of the Electoral Princes in Frankfurt in 1658 for the purpose of choosing an Emperor. The Emperor chosen was Leopold I, who was later involved in three wars, including the War of the Spanish Succession.
DIARII DELLI VICERE' DI NAPOLI, E LORO GOUERNO.
Ms. in Italian. 995 pages. Thick 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Table of contents at the beginning. Italy (Naples?), 17th century.

Diarii delli Vicere di Napoli, e loro Governo. This volume contains the annals ( Diari ) of the Spanish Viceroys of Naples in the 17th century, with copious information about their governments. If not printed, historically very important material.

The Viceroys are: Pedro de Toledo; Cardinal Pacheco; Ferrante of Toledo, Duke of Alba; Cardinal de la Quena; Duke of Alcala; Cardinal Granvela; Marquis of Mandezar; Juan de Zuñiga; Pedro Giron, Duke of Ossuna; Juan de Zuñiga, Count of Miranda; Count Olivares; Hernando de Castro, Count of Lemos; Pedro Giron, Duke of Ossuna; Cardinal Zappata; Cardinal Gasparo Borgia; Cardinal Zappata; Duke of Alba.
TREATISES ON ARISTOTLE

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary vellum. Italy, c.17th century.

did.unittitle: In Aristotelis Meteorologica compendiaria commentatio. Ms. in Latin. 98 pages, including several blanks, numbered ff. 8-49. A resumé of the Meteorologia of Aristotle and other treatises.
De Horologiis solaribus Compendium. Ms. in Latin. 32 pages, numbered ff. 52-67v. With diagrams in text.
De Universi Mundi Sphaera. Ms. in Latin. 104 pages, numbered ff. 72-123.
Digresso de Geographia Orbis. Ms. in Latin. 27 pages, numbered ff. 125-138.
Aritmeticae practicae Compendium. Ms. in Latin. 78 pages, numbered ff. 139-177.
De Bellicis pauca. Ms. in Latin. 42 pages, numbered ff. 178-196v. This treatise contains some technical remarks on ballistics.
MARETTI, LELIO. LA POLITICA...

Lelio Maretti, La Politica di...divisa in cento novantadue Capitoli, con le autoria e alleganzioni di Cornelio Tacito, Tito Livio, et altri classici authori antichi. Ms. in Italian. 1042 pages. Thick 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, probably first half of the 17th century.

This work on military science, by the Sienese nobleman Lelio Marretti, has presumably never been printed. The name of Marretti does not appear in the standard work on the history of military art, Jahn's Geschichte der Kriegswissenschaft ; nor in the standard histories of Seicento Italian Literature, such as Pompeati, Belloni, or Renda-Operti: Dizionario della letteratura italiana.
BOLVITO, GIOAN BATTISTA. LA ARME DE I RE DE NAPOLI.

Bolvito, Gioan Battista, La Arme de i Re de Napoli, raccolte..., insieme con una brevissima dicharazione della loro origine et dependencia. Ms. in Italian. 169 pages. Large 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. With drawings of coats of arms. Italy, c. 17th century.
The subject treated is the Coat of Arms of the King of Naples, with explanations as to their origins and connections.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Spinola, Gherardo, Marchese d'Arquata. Memorie e Giornali d'un picciolo Viaggio fatto dal Sig...l'anno 1660. Ms. in Italian. 96 pages. An account of a trip taken by Gherardo Spinola through Germany, Austria, Hungary, etc. The complete list of cities is given on pp. 95-96.

Cueva, Don Alfonso de la, Conte di Bedmar. Relazione di Venezia. Ms. in Italian. 240 pages, numbered ff. 97-266. This is the Report made by Alfonso de la Cueva (1572-1655), at the request of King Philip III of Spain, concerning Venice. He was Imperial Ambassador to that city.

Bedmar is famous for having organized a plot to overthrow the government of Venice and had the reputation of being "one of the most powerful geniuses and one of the most dangerous minds Spain has ever produced." (Nuov. Biogr. Univ., Paris, 1855, vol. V, p. 127). This Relazione which he wrote after his ambassadorship (after the discovery of the plot, he was forced to flee Venice and take refuge in Flanders) may be the same as the ms. in Italian in the possession of the Library of Lyons. It is a document of prime importance.

Alcune notizie particolari delle cose di Venezia. Delle case nobili. Ms. in Italian. 29 pages. Some additional information on Venetian nobility. At the end is a list of houses belonging to the aristocracy.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: printed broadsides, and 1 engraved plan. Comprising altogether 1082 pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th and 18th century.

did.unittitle: S. Biagio della Pagnotta. 12 ms. documents in Latin and in Italian. 135 pages, numbered ff. 1-85. Copies of documents concerning this church, its foundation, its architecture, members, inventory, etc. relating to inspections in 1725 and 1731.
Santa Caterina da Rota. 5 ms. in Latin and Italian, 45 pages, numbered ff. 86-111. Copies of documents concerning this church in Rome. 1735.

Narrazione dell'insigne Miracolo, operato da Dio per l'Intercessione del Glorioso S. Pietro...nella Sacrosancta Basilica Vaticana. Printed pamphlet, 10 pages, numbered ff. 112-117. Account of a miracle which occurred in the Anno Sancto 1725. Rome, G.M. Salvioni, n.d.
Relazione dell'Incoronazione della Beatissima Vergine della Neve...nella Citta di Cortona fatta dall'Gio. Andrea Ricci... Ms. in Italian, 20 pages, numbered ff. 118-127. Dated Oct. 8, 1741.
Ricci, Gio. Andrea. Orazione...in occasione della Coronazione fatta in Montepulciano della Miracolosa Madonna delle Grazie. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 130-132. Dated Sept. 24, 1741.
Apone, Don Filippo. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 134-135. Account of the abjuration of a Filippo Apone on March 26, 1706.

Funeral Rites for the Queen of England. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 136-140. The Queen (probably Maria Clementina, the wife of the Old Pretender) was buried in St. Peter near Christina of Sweeden. Jan. 18, 1735. Includes a full page drawing of a chalice.
Cuneo. Engraved plan of the city and its fortifications. oblong folio, folded. Undated and unsigned.
Juramentum prestandum a Canonicis in adeptione canonicatuum. Ms. in Latin. 1 folio page, folded. Undated.
Charles VI. Diploma awarded by Emperor Charles VI to Cardinal Borromeo on his taking possession of Parma and Piacenza. Printed broadside in Latin. Large folio, folded. Dated Milan, Jan. 21, 1731.
Pamfili, Cardinal Benedetto. Il Figliol' Prodigo. Ms. in Italian. 20 pages, numbered ff. 145-154. An oratorio. Undated.
Morei, Michel Giuseppe. Nella morte del Sommo Pontefice Clemente XI. Canzone. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages. Poem on the death of Pope Clement XI (1721).
Domenica 10 Ottobre. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 165-166. A mass celebrated on occasion of the victory in Hungary.
Three sonnets on various states of human life. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 167-170.
Two sonnets. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered ff. 171-172. 8vo. One sonnet on Eugene of Savoy, the other to the Imperial ambassador Count Gallas.
Two canzonettas. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 179-183.
Relazione dell'arrivo della flotta Spagnola a Palermo. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 185-188. The Spanish fleet's arrival at Palermo on July 1, 1718.
Another copy of the above (no. 32). Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 189-194.
Louis XIV's Death. Ms. in Italian. 16 pages, numbered ff. 195-202. Account of the death of the French King on Sept. 1, 1715.

Derwentwater, Count James. Discorso. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 203-204. Speech by the Count prior to his decapitation for high treason against King George I in London on Tower Hill, on Feb. 24, 1716.
Londra, 9 Marzo 1716, Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 205-206. Report from London concerning the Jacobite rebellion, attempts to save Derwentwater, and other political events.

Alexander VII, Pope. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 207-208. Resume of a speech by the Pope to the committee appointed to deliberate on controversial ecclesiastical matters, held on Jan. 30, 1691.
Relazione del seguito nella venuta di Giovanni Andrea Poicet (?) in Montepulciano per coronare La Beata Vergine detta di S. Martino... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 209-210. Undated.
Clement XI, Pope. Ms. in Latin. 4 pages, numbered f. 211. Nov. 11, 1703.
Chi sia lecito in questo... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 213-214. A sermon, undated. Apparently for Easter.
Mi sia lecito in questo giorno... Ms. in Italian. 25 pages, numbered ff. 215-226. An undated sermon. Apparently a draft, with numerous corrections.

Diario della legazione...da...Clemente XI... Ms. in Italian. 72 pages, numbered ff. 227-264. Journal of the legation sent by Pope Clement XI to Elizabeth Farnese, wife of King Philip V of Spain. With a complete list of persons forming the legation. (See Vol. 33, #22).
Gozzadini, Cardinal Ulisse Giuseppe. Printed speech in Latin. 19 pages, numbered ff. 265-273. Faenza, J.A. Archus, 1717. To the people of Ravenna.
Palatius, Jacobus. Ritus Sacrarum Ceremoniarum ad Usum Ecclesiae Principis Apostolorum de Urbe. Ms. in Latin. 46 pages, numbered ff. 274-296. On the rites to be observed in Roman churches. Undated.

Chigi, Cardinal. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 302-303. Description of the entertainment of his guests by Cardinal Chigi in his Garden of the Four Fountains in Rome. Undated (late 17th or early 18th century).
Sabbato, 21 di Maggio, 1663. Ms. in Italian. 71 pages, numbered ff. 304-339. Diary of ecclesiastical events, written by a retainer of Cardinal Barberini.
Forma del Governo Giesutico. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 342-350. On the principles and structure of the Jesuit Order. Dated 1617.
Various journals on ecclesiastical matters. Ms. in Italian. 25 pages, numbered ff. 360-373. Undated.

Die 14 Junii 1691. Description of a Corpus Christi Procession in S. Giovanni in Laterano, after the death of Pope Alexander VIII. With a list of all the attendants. Ms. in Latin. 5 pages, numbered ff. 376-377.
S. Giovanni de Laterano and Santa Maria Maggiore. Various documents concerning these Roman churches. Ms. in Italian and Latin. 40 pages, numbered ff. 380-417. Dated 1667 and 1691.
S. Pietro in Rome. Various documents concerning S. Peter. Ms. in Italian and Latin. 40 pages, numbered ff. 418-441. Dated 1691.

Monitorium... Printed broadside in Latin, folio, folded. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1691. Announcement concerning the Corpus Christi procession, June 1691, after the death of Pope Alexander VIII, before the election of a new Pope.
Monitorium... Printed broadside in Latin. Folio, folded (f. 443). Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1691. A similar announcement to #52.

Edictum... Printed broadside, folio folded (f. 444). Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1691. Announcement in Latin to the Papal Chancery, dated June 10, 1691. With armorial woodcut, printed in red and black.
Editto per le Processioni del Santissimo Sacramento. Printed broadside in Italian. Folio, folded. Rome, stamp della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1691. Dated June 7, 1691.

Lista della Regaglie Nesti delli Ministri et Offiziali di Palazzo et altri nella Canonizatione del B. Gio. da Capistrano. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 446-449. List of the necessary regalia, with the cost.
Discorso sopra l'origine delle tempi. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 450-455. Apparently a draft. Undated.
Discorso sopra l'Elettione del Pontefice. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 456-459. A draft of an essay on the Papal elections. Undated.

D'Estrées, Cardinal Cesar. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 460-463. Rectification of the reports on the French Cardinal D'Estrées and his negotiations with the Republic of Venice. Undated (Between 1693 and 1704).
Origine delle Controversie tra il Sig. Erizzo and D'Estrées. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 466-471. On the controversies between Cardinal D'Estrées and the Venetian Ambassador. Undated.
De Sacris Traditionibus. Ms. in Latin. 24 pages, numbered ff. 474-485. Excerpts of Book 2 on the sacred traditions, refuting the opinions of the reformers. Undated.
(Acciaioli, Cavalier Filippo). Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 486-489. Account of the death of Acciaioli, who died in Rome in 1700.
Sopra il primo e secondo Articolo... Ms. in Italian, 19 pages, numbered ff. 490-499. Critical reflections on a note sent by the Venetian Ambassador. Undated.
Apparatus ad Ecclesiasticam Eruditionem. Ms. in Latin. 296 pages, numbered ff. 502-645. A theological treatise, no author given. Undated.

Copia di una lettera scritta...dal Gio. Pietro Pinamonti. Ms. in Italian. 24 pages, numbered ff. 650-661. Copy of a letter by Pinamonti to the rector to the Collegio di Firenza, eulogizing Father Pietro Segneri, the great Italian preacher of the 17th century. Dated Rome, Dec. 18, 1694.
Relatione del Viaggio della Santita...Innocent XII da Roma a Nettuno alli 21 Aprile 1697. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 662-670.
CONCLAVES

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six manuscript documents and 1 engraved plan, comprising 657 pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, early 18th century.

did.unittitle: Conclave fatto per la sede vacante d'Innocenzo XII nel quale fu creato...Clemente XI. Ms. in Italian. 34 pages, numbered ff. 6-25. With an engraved plan of St. Peter, with an exterior view of the church and the names of the Cardinals in that Conclave. (1700).
Conclave in cui fu assunto Papa Innocenzo XIII. Ms. in Italian. 37 pages, numbered ff. 27-45. (1721).
Conclave fatto per la more d'Innocenzo XIII nel quale fu eletto ...Benedetto XIII. Ms. in Italian. 67 pages, numbered ff. 47-80. (1724).
Istoria del Conclave Nel quale per morte di Benedetto XIII... Ms. in Italian. 452 pages, numbered ff. 81-306. On the Conclave that elected Clement XII, on July 12, 1730.
Conclave tenuto per l'elezione di Benedetto XIV. Ms. in Italian. 36 pages, numbered ff. 307-324. 1739.
Aforismi Politici per i Sig. Cardinali del Conclave fatti dal Cardinal Arzolini. Ms. in Italian. 30 pages, numbered ff. 325-339.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: consisting of 106 manuscripts, 43 printed leaflets and broadsides, and 2 engravings, plus 1 pen drawing. Comprising altogether 596 pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, end of the 17th and beginning of the 18th century.

did.unittitle: Roma, li 2 Genaro 1683-Aprile 7, 1683. Ms. in Italian. 48 pages, numbered ff. 1-24. A diary of news bulletins.

Carolus Dei Gratia Rex... Printed leaflet. 4 pages. Napoli, Salvatore Gastaldo, 1683. A proclamation by Gaspar de Haro y Guzman, Viceroy of Naples, concerning the regulation of currency in the Kingdom of Naples. Dated Naples, May 29, 1683.
Mustafa Carra Gran Visir, che ritorna dall'assedio di Vienna a Constantinopili. Engraving of Mustafa, returning crying after his defeat in Vienna. 1683. Oblong folio, folded. (f. 27)
Lo Stendardo Ottomanico Spiegato. Printed leaflet in Italian and Arabic. 6 pages, and 1 engraving of the Turkish standard captured in battle. Rome, 1683.

Breve relatione di quello, che appartiene allo Stendardo. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 32-33. Roma, Michel Ercole, 1683. Account of the capture of the Ottoman flag which was presented to Pope Innocent XI.
Pronostico dell'Astrologo del Re di Francia. Ms. 3 pages (ff. 34 and 37). Dated Paris, August 3, 1683.
The Ottoman Standard. An original pen drawing of the Ottoman flag that was captured in Vienna 1683, with explanation in Italian. 2 pages (f. 36).
News Bulletin about the Turkish-Polish War. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 38). 1683.
Venetia, 12 Settembre 1683. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 39-40. A news bulletin about the same conflict.
Linz, 28 Septembre 1683. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 41-42. Another news bulletin on the war.
Vienna, 15 Septembre 1683. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered f. 43 and f. 46. Report concerning the long siege of Vienna by the Turks.
Di Venetia li 19 Septembre 83. Ms. in Italian, 3 pages, numbered ff. 44-45. News report from Venice and Rome concerning the Turkish-Polish War.
Diario delle cose piu notablie...nel assedio di Vienna. Ms. 9 pages, numbered ff. 48-51. On the Turkish siege of Vienna.
John III, King of Poland. Letter to the Cardinal Barberini, announcing the liberation of Vienna from the Turks. 1683. Ms. 1 page (f. 52).
Dal Campo Cesarea vicino all'Isola...30 Septembre 1683. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 53). News report from the Imperial Headquarters about military operations against the Turks.
Pronostico dell'Astrologo del Re di Francia, Parigi 3 Agosto 1683. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 55-56. See no. 6.
Alla Regina di Polonia Duchessa di Lorena... Ms. 3 pages (ff. 58 and 61). Letter, dated Sept. 19, 1683.
Del Campo Vicino a Presburg. Ms. 3 pages, numbered ff. 59-60. 1683.
Colonna, L. Letter to Cardinal Spreti. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 62). Dated March 20, 1683.
Riconoscendo il Sig. Cardinale de Medici... Ms. 1 page (f. 63). Statement on Marcello D'Aste. Undated.
Bruno in Moravia, 19 Septembre. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 64-65. Concerning a battle with the Turks. (1683?).
Dal Campo appresso...29 Agosto 1683. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 66). News report.
Passavia, 18 Agosto 1683. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 68-69. News report from Passau.
Il Mostre della Posta di Venetia... Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 70-71. News report, undated.
Venetia, 8 Agosto 1683 e dal Campo 27 Luglio. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 72-73. News report.
Graz 24 Agosto 1683. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 74). News letter, signed Francesco Reggi (?).
Venetia, foglio del Baron Tastis, and 22 Agosto del Ambasciadore Cesarea. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 75). Undated (1683).
Passavia, li 22 Agosto 1683. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 76). News report.
Roma, 10 Maggio 1684 (-26 Agosto 1684). 4 news letters. Ms. in Italian. Together 24 pages, numbered ff. 78-85 and 87-91.
Nota delle Privilegii...nel Contado dell'Aquila et Regno di Napoli. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 86 and 91). (1684).
Malta 19 June 1684. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 92-93. News letter.
Duca di Mantua. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 94). News that the Duke has imprisoned the Marquis de Canosa. Undated.
Diario delle rivoluzioni d'Inhilterra. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 95-98. News report from England, concerning the English Civil War. Dated May 30, 1685.

Copia della riposta del Re Christianissimo alla Santita... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 101). Copy of a letter by Louis XIV to the Pope concerning the request by the Genoese to be placed under French protection. Dated Versailles, June 29, 1684.
Fuligno. Four issues of a news sheet (nos. 5, 6, 14, and 27), printed at Foligno. Together 16 pages, numbered ff. 102-110.
Nell'anno 1685. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 111). News item concerning Ottaviano Acciaioli.
Roma, 13 Maggio 1684 (and 26 Aug. 1684). Two letters from Rome. Ms. 8 pages, numbered ff. 112- 113 and 115-116.
February 27, 1684. Copy of a letter to the Papal Council, concerning the War with the Turks. Ms. 3 pages, numbered ff. 114-115.
Dal Campo Cesareo...Aug. 17, 1685. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 118-119. News report from Imperial Headquarters.
News Reports. Three letters dated 1685. Ms. in Italian, together 6 pages, numbered ff. 120-123. 8vo.

Distinta Notizia di Tutta la Morea. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, folio, folded. Venetia, n.d. With half-page engraved map of the Peloponnesus, being the territory where the Venetian troops were fighting the Turks.
Londres 19 Juillet 1685. Ms. in French. 2 pages (f. 128). Report on the insurrection by James Scott, Duke of Monmouth, against James II.
Londra, 19 Luglio 1685. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 130-131. Italian version, with an abstract from a report printed in London on the insurrection.
Vienna and Venice, 1685, 7 news reports, dating from July to Oct. 1685. Ms. in Italian, together 15 pages, numbered ff. 133-142.
Bruno en Moravia. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 146 and 149. News report dated from Bruno, Innsbruck, and Vienna, Sept. 1686.
Vienna, 4 Agosto 1686. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 147-148. News Report.
Fuligno, 3 Maggio 1689. Printed news sheet (see no. 18). 4 pages, numbered ff. 150-151.
Vienna, 30 Agosto, 1686. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 152-154. News report.
Heney. Letter to the Emperor Leopold I by his ambassador to the Diet of Baden (Switzerland), dated July 20, 1692. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 156-159.

Amelot, Marquis de. Memoriale presntate alla Dieta di Bada, li 3 Decembre 1692. Ms in Italian. 10 pages, numbered ff. 160-164. Memoir from the French Ambassador Amelot to the Diet in Baden, Switzerland.

Louis XIV. Copia di Lettera del Re scritta a Monsig. Arcivesco di Parigi. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 165-166. Letter to the Archbishop of Paris, with a list of French troops and their deployment in Germany, Italy, etc. Dated May 27, 1693.
Copia di Lettera di Venetia 19 Marzo 1701. Ms. 2 pages (f. 167). Report from Venice to Rome on the movement of Austrian troops and other events and rumors.

Copia di Lettera della Segretaria dell'Ambasciatore Cesareo. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 168). Letter by the Chancery of the Imperial Ambassador with important news and military reports. Dated Vienna, April 30, 1701.
Roma, il primo Novembre 1694. Ms., 4 pages, numbered ff. 169-170. News letter.
Copia di Lettera dell'Segretaria dell'Ambasciatore Veneto. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered ff. 171. News letter from the Austrian ambassador to Venice. Dated Venice, May 7, 1701.
Letter from the Republic of Holland to Louis XIV. Expressing satisfaction with the appointment of Philip of Anjou to the Spanish throne. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 173).

Two copies of letters from Rome to Leopold I. Dated March 5, 1701 and Feb. 19, 1701. Ms. in Italian. Together 11 pages, numbered ff. 174-179. News report containing a list of Italian military leaders.
Naples. Two reports concerning the uprising of Neapolitan grandees against Charles VI, King of Naples. Dated Sept. 14 and 27, 1701. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 181-183, 186.
Veridico Ragguaglio dell'arrivo de Prencipi della casa Reale di Francia, in Avignone. Printed leaflet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 184-185. Roma, Eredi del Corbelletti, 1701.

Relatione di Napoli. Ms. 7 pages, numbered ff. 187-190. Detailed report on the uprising in Naples, including a copy of a letter sent by Venetian residents in Naples to the Venetian Ambassador in Rome. Dated Sept. 24, 1701.
Philip V, King of Spain. Manifesto relating to the so-called Conspiracy of Macchia, the Naples Uprising of 1701. Ms. in Latin. 3 pages, numbered ff. 191 and 194.

Punti principali conclusi nella Dieta Universale dell'Imperio...in Ratisbona li 18 Settembre 1702. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 191-192. The points of policy established in Ratisbon contain the declaration of war by Leopold I against Louis XIV and directions towards the conduct of hostilities.
Venezia li 14 Ottobre 1702. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 195-196. News reports on the events following the capture of Ulm during the War of the Spanish Succession.
Roma, 21 Ottobre 1702. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered ff. 197.

Punti Principali...della Dieta di Ratisbona... con il Re di Francia. Another version of the points established at the Diet of Ratisbon. Dated Sept. 28, 1702. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 198-199.
Livorno 12 Giugno 1702. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 200-201. Report on festivities held in Livorno.
Roma, 14 Aprile 1703. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 201-202. Report on news events, including an earthquake.
Roma, Feb. 17, 1703. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 203-204. More news from Rome.
Foglio Strordinario 5 Settembre 1703. Printed news sheet, 2 pages (f. 205). Concerning the battle-order of the Imperial troops. Schematic representation of army.
Diario della Dieta Generale...à Lublino in Polonia per li 19 di Giugno 1703. Printed leaflet. 8 pages, numbered ff. 206, 208-210. News sheets on the Diet of Lublin in Poland.
Entwuff Wie die Frantzoesische Armee... Printed broadside from the War of the Spanish Succession, regarding the French Army in Baden, with an engraving of the battle plan. Numbered f. 207.
S. Agostino Li 12 Giuno 1703. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 211-212. News report about the progress of French troops.
Foglio aggiunto all'ordinario. Two extra printed news sheets, dated June 9 and 20, 1703. Together 4 pages, numbered ff. 213 and 215.

Relazione distinta...della Ritirata dell'Essercito Francese sotto il Duca di Vandome dall'Attaco di Ostiglia. Printed newssheet. 2 pages (f. 214) describing the successful actions by the Germans against the French, June 10 and 11, 1703.

Articoli e Conditione in Virtu della Citta di Bonna...si e rese agli Alti Confederati. Printed news sheet. 2 pages, numbered f. 216. Issued by Il Duca di Marlborough Allegre. 1703. With a duplicate of the same printed sheet, numbered f. 218.
Sentenza Finale nella Causa d'Inquizitione ordinata...di Sua Maesta Cesarea...contro Francesco Ragozzi... News sheet. 2 pages (f. 217), publishing the sentence against a rebel.

Ferrara, 16 Giugno 1703. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 219-220. Intelligence report on the actions and troop movements of the French army under the Duke of Vendome in the territory of Ferrara.

Breve e Succinta Relazione... Printed news sheet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 221-222. Report on the victory over the Imperial army on August 13, 1704, with a list of prisoners, etc. Translated from the French into Italian. 3 more copies of the same, ff. 331- 334.
Corriere Ordinario. 2 printed news sheets, with 2 extra folios, dated Oct. 22 and 25, 1704. Together 10 pages, numbered ff. 223-227.
Continuazione del Viaggio del Re Cattolico... Printed news sheet. 4 pages, numbered ff. 228-229. On the triumphal reception of Charles III, King of Spain, in Lisbon on Aug. 9, 1704.
Rimini 25 Novembre 1708. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f.235). With a copy of a letter by the Count of Daun.
Bologna li 7 Maggio, 1709. Number 18 of a printed newspaper. 4 pages, numbered ff. 237-238.
Ristretto de Capitoli che dimanda al nuovo Principe... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 240-241. Conditions requested by Naples from its new ruler. 1709.
January 27, 1709. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 242-243. Concerning a treaty between the Pope, the Emperor, and Charles III of Spain.

Relazione delle Offerte della Francia a sodisfazione di tutti gl'Interessati nella presente Guerra... Printed news letter. 8 pages, numbered ff. 244-245, 250-251. Napoli, n.d. Concerns the negotiations for peace, dated Utrecht, March 5, 1712.

Trattato di Pace...Concluso in Utrecht il di undeci Aprile 1713. Printed leaflet. 8 pages, numbered ff. 246-249. Venetia and Bologna, 1713. Translated from French. The Peace Treaty of 1713 which ended the War of the Spanish Succession.
Roma, 28 Gennaro, 1713. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 252-253. News letter.
Lotterie de Hollande. Printed announcement. 2 pages (f. 254). In French. The Hague, 1713. Concerning the National Lottery.
Nouvelles de divers Endroits. No. XXVI of a printed newspaper in French, dated March 31, 1714. 4 pages, numbered ff. 255-256.
22 April 1713. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 257-260. News letter.
Abrege des Articles du Traité de paix signé à Rastat... Printed broadside (f. 261) in French, with the Treaty of Rastatt, signed between Prince Eugene of Savoy and Marshall de Villars in March 1714.
1714. Three printed newspaper numbers, together 13 pages numbered ff. 262-268. Two in Italian and one in French.
Louis XIV, King of France. Copy of a letter from Louis XV to the French parliament, announcing the death of Louis XIV. Ms. in Italian. 1 pages (f. 269).
1715. Five news letters, dated Naples and Rome, April to December 1715. Ms. in Italian. Together 15 pages 8vo and 4to, numbered ff. 270-277.
Napoli 14 Luglio 1716. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 278). News letter announcing the victory of the Venetians over the Turkish fleet.
1715. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 282). News letter from Ancona.
Napoli, 19 Gennaro 1716. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 283). News letter from Naples.
Ripartizione degl'accampamenti Imperiali in Ungheria per l'anno 1716. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 284-285. List of the Imperial troops in Hungary.

Lista delle Squadre de il Re di Portogallo... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 286-288. List of the fleet sent to Pope Clement XI by the King of Portugal to protect the Papal States from Turkish attack, with the placement of the ships. Dated Lisbon, July 4, 1716 (wrong date, added later; should be 1717. See below.).

Relazione della squadra, che sua Maesta di Portogallo... Printed sheet. 2 pages (f. 291). List of the fleet that the King of Portugal sent to Pope Clement XI. The fleet left Lisbon April 28, 1717 and arrived in Palermo on May 24, 1717.
August-September 1717. Three printed announcements in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 292-294. 8vo.
Engraved map of Belgrade. small 4to.
Capo S. Maria 4 Agosto 1717. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 295-297. Logbook of the commander of the Venetian fleet sent to fight against the Turks.
Copia della lettera scritta dal Ministro del Duca di Savoia... Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 299). 8vo. Copy of a letter from the Minister of the Duke of Savoy to the Senate of Genoa. Dated August 1717.
Clement XI, Pope. Discorso... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 300-301. Speech by Clement XI held before the Consistory in July 1717, appointing Giulio Alberoni to the Diocese of Piacenza.
Corfu, 28 Giuglio 1717. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 303). Letter by the Admiral of the Venetian fleet, announcing his victory over the Turks at Corfu.
Relazione della Seconda Battaglia nell'acque di Corfu. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 304). Report on the second sea battle at Corfu.
Melazzo, 5 Octobre (1718). Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 305-306. Report on the operations of the English fleet under the command of Admiral Bing in the waters of Corfu.
Messina, li 24 Luglio 1718. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 307-308. Report on ship movements around Sicily.
Reggio, 10 Ottobre 1718. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 309-310. On naval engagements.
Acquaviva, Cardinal. Billet sent to Cardinal Giudice, dated Jan. 6, 1718. With Giudice's answer. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 311).
Lede, Marchese di. Copia di Lettera scritta...al Signor Marchese di Montemar. Printed leaflet. 9 pages, numbered ff. 313-317. Palermo, F. Cichè, 1719. Letter on the victory.
Relazione Distinta...delle solenne Entrata in Vienna delle Grande Ambasciata Ottomana...14 di Agosto 1719. Printed news supplement sheet. 2 pages (f. 318).
Charles VI, Emperor. Printed announcement. 3 pages, numbered ff. 319-320. Napoli, 1719.
June 24, 1719. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 321-322. Report on the battles fought between Spaniards and Germans in the waters off Messina.
Vienna, 29 Aprile 1719. Printed extra sheet to an Italian newspaper. 2 pages (f. 323). On the Imperial legation to the Turks.

Distinto Ragguaglio della solenne Udienza...4 Settembre 1719. Description of the meeting between Emperor Charles VI and the Turkish Ambassador. Printed extra sheet to an Italian newspaper. 4 pages, numbered ff. 324-325.
Relazione del ingresso solenne...3 Agosto 1719 in Constantinopili. Entry of the Italian ambassador into Constantinople. Printed extra sheet to an Italian newspaper. 2 pages (f. 326).
June 24, 1719. Another ms. copy of item 115. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 327-328.
Journals 1726-1727. Ms. in Italian. 22 pages, numbered ff. 329-339. Diary notes on current events.
Ancona, 5 Agosto 1733. Printed news sheet (no. 33 of an Italian newspaper). 4 pages, numbered ff. 340-341. With international news events.

Manifeste de la Republique de Bologne approuvé dans le Champ Electoral entre Varsovie et Wola. Printed leaflet in French and Italian in two columns. 4 pages, numbered ff. 342-343. Dated Sept. 4, 1733.

Capitula di Carta del Conde de Montemar... Printed pamphlet in Spanish and Italian in two columns. 6 pages, numbered ff. 344-346. Letter from Count Montemar to Monsignor Ratto, Bishop of Cordova, May 27, 1734. With a duplicate, ff. 361-363.
Napoli, 26 Marzo 1734. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 349-351. An address by the Neapolitans to the Emperor.
Ancona, 22 Sept. 1734. Printed news sheet. 2 pages (f. 352).
Don Carlos. Don Carlos por la Gracia de Dios... Printed proclamation in Spanish and Italian in 2 columns. 1 page, folio, folded (f. 353). Dated March 14, 1734.
Don Carlos por la Gracia de Dios, Infante de Castilla... Ms. in Spanish. 3 pages (f. 354). Don Carlos appointing Manuel de Orleans, Count of Charney to the Naples Government. Dated April 13, 1734.
Bologna, Li 19 Ottobre 1734. Printed newspaper (no. XLII). 4 pages, numbered ff. 356-357.
Conde de Clavigo. Ms. in Spanish. 1 page (f. 358). Copy of a proclamation, dated Naples, March 24, 1734.
Copie d'une Lettre de M. le Marechal de Coigny. Printed leaflet with French and Italian in two columns. 3 pages, numbered ff. 359-360. Dated Parma, June 30, 1734.
Regimen y Disciplina que deven observar Los Regimentos de Cavalleria y Dragones Que Serven en este Estado de Milan. Printed leaflet in Spanish. 11 pages, numbered ff. 365-370. Undated (1735).
Ancona, November 16, 1735. Printed news sheet in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 371-372. With international news.
Napoli, December 1736. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 373). News about a victory of the Spaniards over an Algerian fleet.
RELATIONE DI CONCLAVE
Manuscript in Italian. 569 pages and 703 pages. Bound in 2 volumes. Folio. Contemporary brown morocco, vellum backs. Italy, 17th century.

Relatione di Conclave. Accounts of the conclaves from the election of Clement V in 1305 up to the election of Innocent X in 1644. The first volume leads from Clement V to Gregory XIV (1591); the second volume from Innocent IX (1591) to Innocent X (1644), the latter being the most comprehensive account.
HISTORIES

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three manuscripts, comprising 630 pages. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Tassoni, Alessandro. Annali Ecclesiastici, Volume Primo. Ms. in Italian. 557 pages, numbered ff. 1- 279. Tassoni (1565-1635), best known as the inventor of the "mock-heroic poem," writes here an ecclesiastical history, based on the famous Annales Ecclesiastici by Cardinal Baronius. The first volume of Tassoni's abrégé leads up to the year 226.
