Gualterio, Guido. Sixti V Pontificis Optimi Maximi Ephemerides. Ms. in Latin. 333 pages, numbered ff. 280-447. Detailed annals of the Papacy of Sixtus V (1585-1590).

Relatione della Dieta di Polonia et Elettione in Re dil Sig. Duca Michaele Wiszniewiecki. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 449-458. Account of Poland and the elecion of Muchael Korbut Wiszniewiecki to the Polish throne in 1669.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 18th century.

did.unittitle: Strozzi, Lorenzo. Vita di Filippo Strozzi di Fiorenze. Ms. in Italian. 85 pages, numbered ff. 1-43. The life of Filippo Strozzi (1488-1538) by his brother Lorenzo. This biography was printed in the 1727 edition of Varchi's Storia Fiorentina .

Regolamente di Vita Civile per una Dama Giovane. Ms. in Italian. 36 pages, numbered ff. 45-62. Advice and maxims of behavior in social life for a young lady, by an unknown author of the early 18th century.
Relazione de Tumulti accaduti in Roma l'Anno 1736, loro origine e sequele. Ms. in Italian. 77 pages, numbered ff. 63-101. Refers to the political opposition in Rome against Spain in the year 1736.

Maghetti, Geronimo. Per l'Armamente del Anno 1744. Ms. in Italian. 23 pages, numbered ff. 102-113. Memoir to Pope Benedict XIV with suggestions for improvements in the recruitment and organization of the Papal army.
La Predica della Carita Pelosa. Ms. in Italian. 17 pages, numbered ff. 114-122. A satirical sermon showing how charity may turn from a virtue into a sin.

Donazione di Constantio alla Chiesa, se sia stata reale o pur sognata. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 123-125. An essay on the Donation of Constantine, proving it to have been an historical event, not a legend. Undated.

Scrittura Lasciata nelle mani del Sig. Francesco Maria Saoli... Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 127-129. Paoli was the head of the delegation sent to negotiate with General Selané, commander of the French troops sent by Louis XIV against Genoa, after the Genoese had placed themselves under Spain's protection.

Louis XIV and the Turks. Lettera scritta del Gran Turco al Re Christianissimo. Copy of a letter by Mahomet to Louis XIV and the French King's answer, dated Paris, July 9, 1669. Also with the oath (in Latin) by Francis I, King of France, testifying to his desire to remain on good terms with Soliman of Turkey and the latter's promise of friendship. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 131-135.

Vita, Profezie, Morte, e Miracoli del Beato Bartolomeo Carosi , alias detto Brandano il Pazzo di Gesu Cristo della Citta di Siena. Ms. in Italian and Latin. 64 pages, numbered ff. 136-167. Contains a biography of Carosi (1483-c. 1550) in Italian and his prophesies in Latin.

Vita di Tiberio Fiorelli , Sopra nominato Scaramuccia, Famosissimo Comico et Istrione del Suo Tempo, e Gracioso Buffone. Ms. in Italian. 94 pages, numbered ff. 168-214. A life of the famous Italian comic actor of the 17th century, who created the stock character of Italian comedy, "Scaramouche."

Lettera del Gran Turco all'Imperator Leopold Primo L'Anno 1701. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 215-216. Copy of a letter by Mustafa II, Sultan of Turkey, to Leopold I, dated Constantinople, 1701.

Copia di Lettera dell'Imperatore della Cina a Papa Clemente XI... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 216-218. Copy of a letter of the Emperor of China to Pope Clement XI, translated by a Jesuit. Dated 1706.
Regalo mandato dall'Imperatore della Cina al Papa. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 219). Sequel to the above (no. 12).
Lettera d'Alfonso Secondo, Re di Napoli. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 220). Dated Rome, 1667.
Ridicolosita degli Ebrei Del Talmut. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 221-226. An essay, ridiculing the Jews and the Talmud. Undated.
Ridicolosita de Turchi. Ms. in Italian. 19 pages, numbered ff. 227-236. Essay ridiculing the Turks and the Qu'ran. Undated.
Difference des Cinq Nations. Ms. in French. 4 pages, numbered ff. 237-238. Characterization of the national traits of the Germans, the English, the French, the Italians, and the Spanish. Undated.

Relazione della morte che fece il Principino Savelli... Ms. in Italian. 14 pages, numbered ff. 239-245. Account of the murder of the young prince Savelli by a rival, under the Papacy of Paul III (1534-1549).
VITE DI HUOMINI...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Vite di Huomini, et Donne Illustri di Filetimo Alicarnasseo. 8 biographical sketches, with an introduction. Dived into two books, the first comprising Items 1-5; the second Items 6-8. ff. 1-212. Small folio. Contemporary vellum; uncut. Italy, n.d.

did.unittitle: Avolos, Dorotea d', Duchess of Francavilla. Vita della Principessa di Francavilla. Laudatory biographical sketch, undated. Dorotea d'Avalos was apparently a sister of Inigo d'Avalos (d. 1503). 15 leaves, numbered ff. 3-17. Preceded by an introduction to the volume, ff. 1-3. In Italian.

Colonna, Prospero. Vita di Prospero Colonna. Laudatory biographical sketch of Prospero Colonna, son of Antonio Colonna and an Italian captain, who died in 1523. 14 leaves, numbered ff. 18-32. In Italian.

Isabella of Aragon, Duchess of Milan. Vita di Donna Isabella d'Aragona, Duchesa di Milano. Biographical sketch, with introductory sketch of Petrarcha. Isabella, daughter of King Ferdinand II of Naples, married to Gean Galeazzo Sforza, Duke of Milan. Isabella became Duchess of Bari in 1500, and died in 1524. 11 leaves, numbered ff. 32-43. In Italian.

Avalos, Ferdinando Francesco d', Marquis of Pescara. Vita di D. Ferrando Francesco d'Avalos Marchese di Pescara. Undated. Biographical sketch. The Marquis of Pescara, born in Naples in 1490, was married to Vittoria Colonna, and died from wounds received at the Battle of Pavia, in 1525. 15 leaves, numbered ff. 44-58. In Italian.

Colonna, Vittoria, Marchioness of Pescara. Vita d'Vittoria Colonna, Marchese di Piscara. Undated. Biographical sketch. Vittoria (1490-1547) married Ferdinando Francesco d'Avalos, Duke of Pescara in 1507, being widowed in 1525. She is known for her poetry and for being loved by Michelangelo when she was 35 years old. 16 leaves, numbered ff. 60-75

Avalos, Alfonso d', Marquis del Vasto. Vita di D. Alfonso d'Avalos d'Aquino, Marchese del Vasto. Undated. Biographical sketch in Italian. The Marquis of Vasto (d. 1546) distinguished himself in the battles of Italy, and against the Turks, under Charles V. He was a son of Inigo d'Avalos, Marquis of Vasto. 68 leaves, numbered ff. 76-144.
Maria of Aragon, Marchioness of Vasto. Vita di D. Maria d'Aragona Marchesa del Vasto. Undated. Biographical sketch in Italian. 34 leaves, numbered ff. 145-179.

Pedro de Toledo, Marquis of Villafranca, Viceroy of Naples. Vita di D. Pietro di Toledo V.R. di Nap. Undated. Biographical sketch in Italian. Pedro de Toledo (1484-1553), warrior and governor of Naples. 33 leaves, numbered ff. 179-212.
REPUBLIC OF PISA

History of the Pisans. 132 numbered leaves. With full-page pen and water color drawing of a coat of arms, with inscription "Bened(ictu)s Ludovici Vitalis obdecus Carr()s N." 8vo. Contemporary vellum. N.pl., n.d. (17th century).
A history of the Republic of Pisa from the time around the year 1000 AD to October 8, 1406 when the Republic of Florence occupied Pisa.
Annexed is a list of the major buildings in the city of Pisa, including their measurements, followed by facts concerning Church government of the Republic.
MARRETTI, LELIO. RICCORDI POLITICI
Lelio Marretti, Riccordi Politici. Manuscript in 2 parts. Together 1608 pages, numbered ff. 1-401 and ff. 1-403. Folio. 2 vols. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

This comprehensive work on politics, written in accordance with the rules of Tacitus, Livius, and other historians of antiquity, is divided into two parts: La Politica Civilie and La Politica Economica.

The author, Lelio Marretti from Siena, was active in the late 16th and early 17th centuries. He was an erudite gentleman who served as consultant in affairs of the state and in legal matters to several princes and cardinals and was well versed in the policies and laws of the court of Rome. He was the author of several works on political science, none of them published, of which Azzolini said (in 1649) were "an arsenal of wisdom and admired by everyone who had the good fortune to read them."
The work is present here in a manuscript copy, written in three or four 17th century hands.
See Azzolini, Le Pompe Sanesi , (1649), II, pp. 41-42.
BARBETTA DA SINIGAGLIA, C. IL PLETTRO DELLE MUSE
Ms. in Italian. 266 pages, numbered ff. 1-133. Italy, n.d.

Barbetta da Sinigaglia, C. Il Plettro delle Muse. This volume contains a collection of Italian poems by Carlo Barbetta da Sinigaglia, a minor poet of the 17th century, unmentioned in the standard works on 17th century literature (Belloni, Pompeati, etc.).
ASSORTED NEWS ITEMS, 1689-1732
did.physdesc: 95 manuscripts, 382 pages; and 54 printed news items,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 320 pages; together, 702 pages. Thick 8vo. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 18th century.

did.unittitle: Colonia, 20 Marzo, 1689. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 2-3. A report on military events in Germany during the war of 1689, when Louis XIV invaded and devastated Germany, whose Emperor at that time was Leopold I.
A letter by a Sig. Nardi , dated Oct. 26, 1694. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 4).
Rome, 20 April, 1701. Political news report. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 5-8.
Rome, July 13, 1701. News report. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 9-12.
Rome, October 21, 1702. News report. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 15 and 16 (skipping a printed pamphlet).
Copia d'Una Lettera scritta Dal Marescial di Villars al Re Christianissimo...a'19 di Febbrajo (1703). Printed in Italian. 6 pages.
Manifesto del Duca Moles... Imbasciador di Carlo II, Re di Spagna, alla Corte Cesarea. Printed in Italian. 15 pages. Vienna, March 19, 1703.

Vienna, 15 Sept. 1703. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. A report giving information about the ceremonies accompanying the appointment made by Emperor Leopold I of Austria of his son Charles III to the Kingship of Spain.
Warsaw, August, 1703. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages. A report concerning military events of 1703, which marked the entire occupation of Poland by the Swedes under Charles XII, after the Battle of Clissow.
Mellarede, Monsieur de , Ambassadeur de S.A.R. le Duc de Savoye au Mémoire de...Marquis de Puysieux... 7 November 1703. Printed in French. 3 pages (skipping a leaflet).

Venezia, 13 June, 1703. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 17-20. A report concerning the international events of 1703. "If the King of Sweeden fails to decide to give peace to Poland, Venice will declare war against him."
Relacion de la Victoire...près du Danube. Aug. 13, 1704. Printed. 2 pages. In French.
Lettre de...Baron de Hompesch... Printed in French. 2 pages. Dated Hoghster, Aug. 13, 1704. Clipping.
Hesse-Cassel, Fredrich, Prince of. Lettre...a leurs Siegneurs, Les Etats Generaux. Printed 1 page (Clipping). Dated Aug. 13, 1704.
Nouvelles Extraordinaire. Printed in French. Clipping, 1 column.
Marlborough, Duc de. Letter. August 14, 1704. Printed in French. 1 column.
Chara Deo Pietas ey vero Consona Vera. Printed. 3 pages. Report and extract of a letter by Principe Eugenio to the Count of Lamberg, Imperial Ambassador in Rome. August 22, 1704.

Capitulazione della Città...di Milano . Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, dated Sept. 24, 1706. A copy of the Document of Surrender of the City and Duchy of Milan, on the part of the Duke of Savoy (and of Count Gian Battista Scotti and Alberto Stampa) to the Emperor of Austria. The Duke of Savoy and Counts profess their loyalty to the Emperor and place themselves under his protection.
Gaceta de Madrid. Printed in Spanish. Together 12 pages. News items.
Grimani, Sig. Card. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 21 and 24. Dated Rome, Feb. 12, 1707.

Levito, Augustin. A copy of a speech delivered by Don Augustin Levito to the King of Sweeden in Poland, by order of the Pope. Ms. in French. 4 pages. Dated Berlin, November 8, 1707. Some news items follow.
Ascoli, Sig. d' Lettera d'un Gentiluomo d'Ascoli ad un Ministro di Napoli. Printed in Italian. 27 pages. The last letter is dated Barcelona, August 14, 1707.
Napoli, November 8, 1707. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages. Business matters and news.
Napoli, Nov. 8, 1707. Printed in Italian. 8 pages.
July 28, 1708. Ms. 1 page, numbered f. 29.

July 29, 1708. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 30-31. In Italian. Report from a policeman or secret agent concerning the activities of a certain Colonel Don Antonio Caraccioli. Dated July 19, 1708.
Report. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages.

Report about the defeat of the French Army in its attempt to cross the river at Oudenarde, Belgium. The Battle of Oudenarde is famous as a great victory gained by Marlborough and Eugene over the French under Vendome. It took place on July 11, 1708. Datelined July 12, 1708. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 33 and 36.

Lettera scritta dall'...Grimani. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 34-35v. A letter by Grimani to Podiucci, Papal Secretary of State, concerning political claims of the Holy See. Dated June 29, 1708.

A letter, unsigned, dated April 29, 1708. Concerning political and military matters (war, refusal of Pope to quarter German troops, danger of Neapolitan invasion of Papal States, etc.). Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered f. 38. 4to., folded.
Letter dated Aug. 4, 1708. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, 4to, numbered ff. 39r and v.
Boletino...1708. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 40-41. News bulletin about the events of the War of 1708.
Boletino...1708. Ms. in Italian. 21 pages, numbered ff. 44-55. More news bulletins about military events of 1708, sent to Baron Carlo D'Asti in Rome.
13 News bulletins of the same kind in forms of letters. Ms. in Italian. 22 pages, numbered ff. 58- 80. From the years 1708 and 1709.
Milano, 22 Settembre 1709. Printed news bulletin. 4 pages. Milan, 1709.
Bull. Barcelona, 1709. Ms. in Italian. 1 page, numbered f. 81.
Barcelona, 25 Agosto 1720. Ms. in Italian. 1 page, numbered f. 82. A news bulletin, announcing the victory gained by the army of the King of Spain.

Lione, 25 Nov. 1712. Ms. in Italian. 1 page, numbered f. 83. A diplomatic dispatch from Lyons, unsigned and dated, announcing that peace will be proclaimed at the end of the fall. The peace between England and France was signed in 1713 (Utrecht).
Discorso di Sua Ecc...Don Lorenzo Verzuso Beretti Landi... della Maesta Filippo Quinto... Printed in Italian. 4 pages.
Supplemento. Ms. in Italian. 16 pages, numbered ff. 84-91. News items and rumors from Rome, relative to the year 1713.
Discours de son Excell...Marquis de Chatreauneuf... Printed in French. 1 page. Dated Jan. 18, 1714.

Sacrae Vaesarae Majestatis Caroli Sexti. Ms. in Latin. 2 pages, numbered ff. 92r & v. Dated Feb. 8, 1714. Official decree by Charles VI, German Emperor, expelling the diplomatic representatives of the Kingdom of Piedmont-Savoy (in particular, Ambassador Provana) from the territories of Germany.

Articoli di Pace conclusi in Rastat...March 7, 1714. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered f. 93. Articles of the Peace of Rastadt which set an end to the War of the Spanish Succession. The peace between Austria and France was signed on March 7, 1714, between Prince Eugene (for Austria) and Marshal Villars, for France.
Nouvelles Extraordinaires de Divers Endroits...27 March 1714. 5 various news letters, printed in various languages. ca. 34 pages, in different sizes, covering the year 1714.
Ferro, Carl Antonio. Letter to Baron Carlo D'Aste. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages. Signed, dated June 15, 1715. Rome.
Ancona... Report, unsigned, sent from Ancona, August 9, 1716, informing about the inefficiency and obsolescence of the galley ships anchored in the harbor of Ancona. Ms. 3 pages, numbered ff. 96-97.

Bologna, Sept...1717. A police report. Ms. 1 page. From Bologna, informing about a plot to assassinate the King of England. The assassin designate, a certain Galimberti, has been arrested and placed in jail. He was found to be in possession of a check for 10 thousand pounds, drawn upon a businessman in Venice.
Ristretto Diario... and 12 other newsletters. Printed, mostly in Italian. 85 pages, covering the years 1717-1719.
Bologna, April 15, 1719. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages, numbered f. 99. A report informing that, according to a rumor, the Spaniards had landed on the Isle of Wight and occupied Portsmouth.
Risposta... 5 Printed news letters. 48 pages, different sizes, covering the years 1719 to 1720.
Li Seminaristi del Seminario Romano... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 102 and 107. Report on the Seminarianists, dated Rome, June 12, 1723.

Dal Campo Cesareo nella Sicilia... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 103 and 106. Report from the Imperial camp near the fortress of Milazzo, 1723, giving details about the military campaign against the Turks.
Ex voto certè editu... Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 104-105. A letter to the Emperor of Austria concerning some feudal territorial rights and claims.
Monsig. Nugnes de Flores Auditor... Ms. in Italian. 7 news letters, mostly dated Rome, 1723. 23 pages, numbered ff. 108-121.

Contessa de Altimira... Ms. in Spanish. 1 page, f. 122. A letter from the King of Spain, dated July 7, 1724. It concerns the "disorders" of the Queen, Elizabeth Farnese, daughter of Odoardo Farnese, and Philip's second wife. The letter was sent from El Buen Retiro and is signed Yo el Rey , and is addressed to the King's cousin, the Countess of Altamira.
Sollennizandosi nella Chiesa di Santa Maria d'Araceli... Printed in Italian. 1 page. Announcement, Feb. 1, 1724.
Mercordi Viglia to tutti li Santi... Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 126-128. Dated Rome, Nov. 3, 1725.
3 newsletters. Ms. in Italian. One dated Naples, 1725. 11 pages, numbered ff. 130-136.
27 newsletters. Ms. in Italian. 184 pages, numbered ff. 138-241. News items, mostly dated Rome, 1727.
12 Newsletters. Printed in Italian. 52 pages, covering the year 1730.

Lunedi Mattina... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 242-244. A letter informing about events which caused the son of Vittorio Amadeo, Duke of Savoy, to imprison his father. Dated Milan, Oct. 7, 1731.
2 printed news letters , dated Naples, July 15, 1732 and May 26, 1733. 10 pages.
A letter, dated Malta, June 20, 1733. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 245-246. About arrival and departures of ships from Algiers, Spain, and England.
VERI GALLICANI DE ECCLESIASTICA POTESTATE DECLARATIO
Ms. in Latin. 448 pages, with a 2 page index at the end. 4to. Contemporary vellum. Italy, beginning of the 18th century.
Vere Gallicani de Ecclesiastica Potestate Declaratio. These are annotations and propositions to a book, issued under the title: Veri Gallicani de Ecclesiastica Declaratio , in the year 1682.
HISTORIE DI FIORENZE
Ms. in 2 volumes. 430 and 592 pages, together 1022 pages. In Italian. 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.
Historie di Fiorenze. These volumes contain tomes IX-XIII of Florentine history, ranging from the reign of Pope Clement VIII to 1527.
HISTORY
Ms. in Latin. 399 pages, numbered ff. 1-200. 4to. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, most probably around 1700.
A Digest of World History, from the birth of Christ to the year 1201.
ZAZZERA, FRANCESCO. NAPOLITANO. GIORNALE

Francesco Zazzera, Giornale...Nel felice gouerno dell Ecc. D. Pietro Girone Duca d'Ossuna Vicerè del Regno di Napoli dalli 7 di Luglio 1616. Ms. in Italian. 362 pages. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Naples (?), 17th century.

These are journals on the reign of Don Pedro Giron, Duke of Ossuna, Viceroy of the Kingdom of Naples, starting from July 7, 1616. The Duke of Ossuna was Pedro de Tellez Giron y Guzman. He was born in Osuna in 1574 and died in Madrid in 1624. The appointment of Giron as a Spanish Viceroy of Naples was due preponderantly to the good offices of the great writer Francisco de Quevedo y Villegas, and to those of the Confessor of Philip III.

Giron, during his tenure as Viceroy, strengthened the Spanish fleet, with a view to checkmating Turks, Venetians, and other enemies of Spain. Keeping in contact with the Marquis of Villafranca, Governor of Milan, and the Marquis of Bedman, Spanish Ambassador in Venice, he planned to dominate the whole of Italy, thwarting a similar ambition on the part of France. (Encicl. Universal, vol. 60, p. 649).
LIPPOMANI, GIROLAMO. RELATIONE DI SAVIOA..1579
Ms. in Italian. 86 pages, 8vo. Contemporary boards. Italy, 16th century.

Lippomani, Girolamo. Relatione di Savoia...1579. This volume also contains: Descrittione del Portogallo, et Historia di quel Regno fatta l'anno 1578. (f. 29v); and Summario di una Relatione fatta nel Conseglio di Guerra di Sua SSta. Catt. sopra il modo d'impadronirsi di esso Regno, bisognando pigliar armi. (f. 40v)
VOYAGE OF THE PAPAL FLEET

Viaggio Felicissima fatto dalle galere pontificie in Levante...l'anno 1651. Ms. in Italian. 166 pages. In addition, 8 congratulary ms. letters, all dated 1651, on double pages. 16 pages. 4to. Contemporary limp vellum. Together 182 pages. Italy, presumably 17th century.
This voyage was made by the Papal ships under the command of Fr. Bartolomeo Mascioli. The ships joined the Malta squadron in Messina, and the Venetian fleet in Candia in 1651.
STUDENT'S CLASS BOOK

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two ms. documents, bound together in different sizes, containing material most probably collected by a student and used for class. On rhetoric, speeches, eulogies, dramatic scenes, etc.

did.unittitle: Dialogo di Doi filosofi e dei loro discepoli Eraclito e Democrito. Ms. in Italian. 32 pages. A versified dialogue.
Montis Aetne descriptio. Ms. in Italian and Latin. 142 pages. Mostly conventional pieces, most probably collected by students, on the subject of rhetoric.
MISCELLANY
did.physdesc: 69 documents, 66 of them in manuscript, 3 in print.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprising together 809 pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 18th century.

did.unittitle: Treatise on the Roman Church. Ms. in Latin. 71 pages, numbered ff. 1-36. Consists of 20 chapters, with an index. Undated.
Distinto Ragguaglio...nella Uscita e Solenne Processione... Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 37-40. Account of a procession held by the monastery di S. Girolamo in Montepole on Oct. 24, 1726.
Satyra I Ms. of a satire in Latin verse. 4 pages, numbered ff. 41-42.
Della Germani. Ms. in Italian. 13 pages, numbered ff. 43-49. A geographical description of Germany. Undated.
Elettione di Pio Papa Quinto. Ms. in Italian. 87 pages, numbered ff. 57-100. An account of the election of Pope Pius V in 1566.

Copie de la lettre du Primat de Pologne... Printed leaflet in French, 3 pages, numbered ff. 101-102. Concerning the recognition by Poland of August III of Saxony as King of Poland. Dated June 29, 1734.
Sopra le fenetre che gardano dentro le Chiese. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 103-104. A decree, confirmed in 1717, prohibiting open windows looking into a church.
Cardinal de Bouillon. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 105). The Cardinal gives up his position as Grand Almoner of France. Undated (1700?).
Chronology of Papal Elections. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 107-109. From Clement IV (1268) to Martin V (1417).
Ultima tariffa fatta dale S.M. Urbano VIII li 22 Luglio 1644... Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 113). On new tax regulations.
Copia di Lettera di Monsig. Pio Vescovo di Montepulciano. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 115-116. Dated October 1754.
Draft of a memoir. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 117). Concerning the Dominicans of the Convent di Monte Dio in Naples. Undated.
Spade, Cardinal Fabrizio. Notes referring to the Cardinal. Ms. in Italian. 1 page, narrow folio. (after 1765).
Sopra il Furlo. Ms. in Latin. 1 page (f. 121). Undated. Fragment of a poem in hexameters.
Abbati, Marchese Ferdinando. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 122 and 125. Copy of a letter by Abbati concerning reforms. Dated Oct. 22, 1740. Ferrara.
Abbati, Marchese Ferdinando. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 123). Another letter, dated Ferrara, Nov. 12, 1740.
Decree to the Signori Curiali. Ms. in Italian and Latin. 1 page (f. 126). Jan. 22, 1761.
Cenci, Cardinal Baldassare. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 128-129. Edict concerning the reclamation of the Pontine Marches. Dated Jan. 2, 1763.
Progress report on engineering works. Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 130-133. Dated Jan. 25, 1762.
Rappresentanza di corte de Baveria mandata al Clement XIII. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 134-136. 1765.

Lettera scritta da un amico in Napoli ad altri in Roma per dargli conto di quello si e potuto sin qui sapere intorno ai liberi muratori. Ms. in Italian. 41 pages, numbered ff. 140-160. Letter concerning the Freemasons. Undated.
Bajardi, Mons. Lettera al Marchese Fogliani. Ms. in Italian. 25 pages, numbered ff. 161-173. Letter on the Freemasons. Dated July 1751.
Notes on baptism. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 175). Undated.

Sicotti, Giuseppe. De Praesentissimo Ecclesiae Duce ac Imperatore Omni Potentissimo Michaele. Oratio IV. Ms. in Latin. 13 pages, numbered ff. 176-183. An oration held in Rome's Archigymnasium in October, 1738.
Albani, Cardinal Alessandro. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 184-185. Copy of a letter on a victory over the French at Piacenza. Dated July 20, 1746.
A decree by Fr. Giovanni Antonio, Cardinal Vicar. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 186). Dated Rome, Sept. 10, 1746.
Alberoni, Cardinal. Ms. in Latin. 3 pages. Letter to Pope Clement XI, dated Genoa, March 11, 1720. Numbered ff. 188 and 201.

Alberoni, Cardinal. Ms. in Italian. 18 pages, numbered ff. 191-199. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Paolucci, Pontifical Secretary of State, rebutting charges made against him in connection with the War of the Quadruple Alliance against Spain. Dated April, 1720.
Letter to Louis XV, King of France, by the bishops of Bourgogne. Ms. in French. 8 pages, numbered ff. 202-205. This letter concerns rights of the episcopacy. 1755.

Lettera risponsiva scritta...sopra la Coronazione del Re Christianissimo celebrata in Rems a 25 Ottobre, 1722. Ms. in Italian. 31 pages, numbered ff. 208-223. Account of the coronation of Louis XV in Rheims.
Progretto d'accomodamente o di Pace. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 224-228. Plans of a settlement by the King of England to the parties involved in the War of the Polish Succession. 1735.
Votum. Ms. in Latin. 46 pages, numbered ff. 230-252. The judgement of a Roman judge or lawyer concerning a case of rape. Undated.
Notes and excerpts from various authors on sacred history. Ms. in Latin. 90 pages, numbered ff. 254- 312. Undated.

Latin Poem. A satire in the style of Horace, apparently a rejoinder to a prior poem called Satira Segnitatum . On the last leaf there is an ennumeration of all of the imporatant European humanists. The author is presumably a French Latinist. Ms. 6 pages, numbered ff. 314-316.
Sentimento sopra l'abolizione del appalto del Tobacco. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 318-320. A comment on the abolition of tobacco contract. Undated.

Quirini, Cardinal. Copia di lettera scritta a Benedetto XIV. Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 323-329. The Cardinal clears himself from charges in connection with addresses to the Protestants. Dated Aug. 9, 1751.
Memo addressed to the Roman Curia. Concerning the parish priest of the Madonna Santissima del Pianto Camillo de Angelis. Ms. in Italian. 16 pages, numbered ff. 330-337. Undated.

Benedict XIV, Pope. Ms. in Latin. 1 pages, numbered ff. 338-343. Copy of a letter to the Grand Inquisitor in Madrid concerning the expurgation of the Historia Pelagiana by Cardinal Enrico Noris. Dated Rome, July 31, 1738.

Quirino, Cardinal. Viglietto scritto a Monsig. Caraccioli... Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 344-345. Copy of a note by Quirino to the Papal Nuncio in Venice concerning the pastoral messages issued by Quirino. Undated.

Father Lombardo. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages. On occasion of Father Lombardo's visit to Brescia, in order to install his brother as Bishop of Crema, he is advised to read the dissertation in the Bulla Celebrationum , an abstract of which he is given. Undated.

Quirini, Cardinal. Copia di Lettera...al P. Bianchini, dell'Oratorio di Roma. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 349-354. Quirini corrects misinterpretations made by Bianchini of his statements. Undated.
Quirini, Cardinal. Copia di lettera...a Sua Santita. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered ff. 355-360. Copy of a letter to Pope Benedict XIV, dated Brescia, Aug. 26, 1751.
Copia di lettera scritta dalla Germania al Sig. Cardinal Quirini. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 361-362. Undated letter sent from Germany to Cardinal Quirini.

Roma, 8 Gennaro 1751. Ms. in Italian. 12 pages, numbered f. 366-371. A letter, signed "L'Ingenuo," with opinions about two Roman theaters, the Argentina , and the Alberti . The writer gives his penetrating criticism of the performance of the opera Merope , of each singer's performance, of the choreography, the mise-en-scene, the costumes, etc.
Manzi, Archbishop. Copia di lettera...al Gonfaloniere della Republica di Lucca. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 372-373. Concerns the amortization of law. Dated Sept. 20, 1764.

Ancient Epigraphy. Comments on a discovery of ancient grave inscriptions with red lead, found near Florence, connected with the goddess Cibele. Ms. in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 376-377. Undated. Referring to a book published in 1731.
Legal cases. Ms. in Latin. 4 pages, numbered f. 378-379. On legal matters, undated.
Republic of Genoa. Ms. in Italian. 9 pages, numbered ff. 380-384. Legislative provisions concerning the island of Corsica, referring to a Genoese edict of Jan., 1733.

Corsica. Three documents concerning the status of Corsica. Ms. in Italian, altogether 5 pages, numbered ff. 384v-386. Contains: Guarantee by the French King for preservation of Genoese rule in Corsica, with a guarantee by the German Emperor; a letter by Joseph, Prince of Liechtenstein, dated Oct. 18, 1738; and a copy of a letter by the leaders of the Corsican movement--Carle, Ortigoni, and Gaffori-- dated Oct. 11, 1738.
Theodor, First King of Corsica. Ms. in Italian. 11 pages, numbered ff. 388-393. Manifest of the King of Corsica, dated June 2, 1736.

Pace, Marchese della. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 394). Copy of a letter, translated from the Spanish, to the ministers of France, England, Holland, and Germany, on the rumor concerning the pregnancy of Duchess Henrietta of Parma. Dated Sevilla, June 6, 1731.
Orvieto. Ms. in Italian. 7 pages, numbered ff. 395-398. Discussion concerning the controversial question as to whom the tax collected by the commune of Orvieto should be paid. Undated.
La Corte di Spagna... Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 399) Diplomatic report to the King of Sardinia concerning the invasion of Lombardy by Spanish troops. Undated (after 1740?).

Philip Gotthard, Bishop of Vratislav. Ms. in Latin. 8 pages, numbered ff. 401-405. Proclamation to the clergy concerning admission requirements for entry into the ecclesiastical life. Dated Oct. 13, 1748.
Benedict XIV, Pope. Ms. in Latin. 10 pages, numbered ff. 406-410. Copy of a letter by the Pope concerning the clerics of Silesia. Dated Rome, Aug. 1, 1748.
Sotto di regione appartenente all'Abbadia di S. Vincentio ed Anastasio a Turin... Ms. in Italian. 5 pages, numbered ff. 411-413. Undated.
Copia del Giornale d'Olanda. Ms. in Italian. 4 pages, numbered ff. 415-416. Abstracts from an article published in a Dutch newspaper of 1745.

Memoriale fatta dal Sagro Collegio... Ms. in Italian. 8 pages, numbered ff. 417-420. Memento drawn up to dissuade Pope Benedict XIII from appointing Monsignor Bichi as Cardinal. Signed by 26 cardinals. 1726.
Quirini, Cardinal. Ms. in Italian. 15 pages, numbered ff. 421-428. Polemical letter against the procedures employed by Cardinal Quirini in his effort to convert the heretics. Unsigned, undated.

Congregatione a Sanctissimo Deputata... Romana Fidei commissorum de Ursinis super Juribus patronatus. Pro D. Duce Gravinae. Contra D. Ducem Lantes de Ruvere... Memoriale Juridicum. Printed legal document. 17 pages, numbered ff. 437-444. Typis Gianinni & Mainardi, 1729.
Congregatione a Sanctissimo...pro D. Duce Gravinae. Summarium. Printed legal document, in Italian. 39 pages, numbered ff. 446-465. Typis Giannini & Mainardi, 1729.
Gazetta di Colonia... Ms. in Italian. 23 pages, numbered ff. 469-480. Abstracts from news items concerning Italy, as published by a Cologne newspaper of February 1763.
Re di Prussia... Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 481). Transcript of the provisions of a peace treaty between Frederick II of Prussia and the Austrian Emperor. Undated. After the 7 Years' War?
Della Segretaria di Stato, le 21 Settembre 1770. Ms. in Italian. 2 pages (f. 482). Announcement of a meeting to be held Sept. 24, 1770.

Joseph, King of Portugal. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 484). Copy of a letter by the King of Portugal to his Tribunal, concerning negotiations between Portugal and Rome and suspending the decree of August 4, 1760. Dated Aug. 13, 1770.

Traduzione dal Portoghese Editto. Ms. in Italian. 6 pages, numbered ff. 486-488. The edict, dated July, 1769, concerns the prohibition of the sale and circulation of the book Memoires sur la liberté de l'Eglise Gallicane , which was published in 1755.
Consiglio straordinario convocato del Re di Spagna. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 490). Points to be examined and submitted to the Bishops at a planned extraordinary session of the Council. Undated.
Joseph II, Emperor. Ms. in Italian. 1 page (f. 491). Copy of a letter to Cavaliere Papini of Forli. Dated Vienna, Oct. 1, 1770.
Speech in Latin. Ms. 1 page (f. 492). Speech to a scholar upon conferring the title Doctor Legum upon him. Not complete. Undated.
MISCELLANEOUS HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 9 manuscript documents in Italian and Spanish, with

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: an index, comprising 497 pages, numbered ff. 1-268. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, mid 17th century.

did.unittitle: Racconto distinto di cio che successo nella detentione alla Corte di Madrid della Principessa di Carignano Moglie del P(ri)n(ci)pe Tomasso di Savoia. An account of negotiations for returning the Princess Maria di Carignano, wife of Prince Tommaso of Savoy, after she had been detained at the Court of Madrid with her two young sons. Unsigned. Jan. 11, 1641. 52 pages, numbered ff. 3-28.

Relatione di Constantinopili del 1629. A comprehensive report of Constantinople in the year 1629, describing the city, including Pera and Galata, its geographic site, its buildings, churches, and mosques, its antiquities; its inhabitants, their costumes, religion, education, etc.; the reaches of the Turkish Empire, its government, its army and navy, with detailed lists of the court expenses, etc. 91 pages, numbered ff. 29-74.

Relatione delle Chiese, e di Religiosi del Rito Latino, che sono nella Città di Pera di Constantinopili. An account of the Roman Catholic church in Pera, describing the churches in which the Latin rites were used. Unsigned, undated. 11 pages, numbered ff. 74-79.

Relatione della Gran Citta di Constantiopili, dove si tratta ti tutta la forma della Città Colline, Valla, Fortezze, Porti, Palazzi, Moschee, Fontane, Botteghe, Luoghi mercantinoli, Alloggiamente de forastieri, Hospitali, Colegii, et luoghi di mentione. A comprehensive account of Constantinople. Dated 1611. 56 pages, numbered ff. 80-107.

(Ahmad I, Sultan of the Turks). La Vita del Gran Turco. A description of the life of the Sultan, his residence, costume, the members of his household & government, etc. Undated, unsigned (ca. 1611?). 32 pages, numbered ff. 108-123.
Del rito della Legge di Mahometto in Generale. A discourse on the laws and rites of Islam, its holy days, pilgrimages, etc. Undated, unsigned (ca. 1611). 25 pages, numbered ff. 124-136.

Cardoino, Andrea. Relatione di Genevra, nella quale si ragiona compendiosamente dello strato di quella citta, particolarmente dell'anno 1535, che vi fu introdotto il Calvinismo e mutato il governo fino all'anno 1625. An historical treatise on Geneva, its origin, geographic situation, and history, especially the impact of Calvin on Geneva and the raids of Charles Emmanuel I, Duke of Savoy, against Protestant Geneva.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a bibliography of Calvin, his life and his teachings. Andrea Cardoino, according to the title, was a Neapolitan born in Geneva. Apparently never published. The treatise contains 41 chapters and covers the government, the military, and the clergy of Geneva, its noble families and the Italians living there. An authentic report, undated, written after 1625. With numerous marginal notes. Title page and 155 pages, numbered ff. 137-215.

did.unittitle: Castracani, Alessandro, Bishop of Nicastro. Relatione del negotiato fatto da Monsignore Castracani Vescovo di Nicastro, Collettore in Portogallo, e dal Vescovo di Sinigaglia, Nuntio à Madrid, per consavare alle Chiese di quel Regno i beni lasciatigli da fideli Christiani con obligo di messe et Anniversarii in suffragio dell'anime loro, e di gli accidenti occorsi sino all'espulsione del medesimo Collettore dal Regno.

A report on the difficulties of the Apostolic Collector, the Papal Nuncio in Lisbon, Alessandro Castracani (1634-1639), who was expelled from Portugal in 1639, under Philip IV of Spain who did not recognize the authority of the Roman Church. (See Pastor XIII/2, p. 728-729.) Undated, unsigned (c. 1639) Title page and 25 pages, numbered ff. 217-243.

(Risposta in spagnuolo alla Relatione dell'espulsione di Mons. Castracani collectore di Portogallo). Copy of a letter to Pope Urban III, in Spanish, unsigned and undated, in answer to the report (see no. 8) on the expulsion of the collector Castracani from Portugal. With historical recapitulations, apparently in justification of Portugal's view of the matter. 46 pages, numbered ff. 246-268.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folio. Contemporary vellum; uncut. Brussels and other places, c. 1555-c. 1644.

did.unittitle: Venice, Republic of. Risolutioni de Dottori legisti intorno le controversie frà le Serenissima cassa d'Austria, et la Republica di Venetia, cioé se li SSri. Venetiani sono SSri. et padroni del Mar Adriatico... (In two different hands). N.d. A legal decision concerning Venetian sovereignty in the Adriatic Sea over Austrian ships and the right to raise the "gabella" and other taxes. 24 leaves, numbered ff. 1-24.

Cornaro (Corner), Marcantonio. Discorso sopra la laguna di Venetia. N.d. Suggestions for the preservation of the lagoon at Venice. The treatise was recorded by Cristoforo Tentori in Della Legislazione Veneziana sulla preservazione della Laguna , Venice, 1792. It was apparently not published separately. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 26-29.

Charles Emmanuel I, Duke of Savoy. Risposta alle scritture intitulate Le Filippiche. N.d. Refutation of a number of political pamphlets denouncing Charles Emanuel as the chief war monger for his seizure of Montferrat and his invasion of Lombardy (1615-1617). 11 leaves (one blank), numbered ff. 30-40.

Louis XIII, King of France. Declarazion del Rey de Francia sobre el Rompimento contra el Rey des Pana (sic). Dated June 19, 1639. Statement, addressed to Philip IV of Spain, concerning the United Provinces, a French ally. 5 leaves, numbered ff. 42-46. In Spanish.

Henry IV, King of France, and Charles Emmanuel I, Duke of Savoy. Articoli concludi et accordati tra il Re et il Duca de Savoya per conto del marchesato de Saluzzo, à Paris li 25 de Febraro 1600. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 50-52.

Frederick, Elector Palatine. Manifesto di noi Frederico d'Iddio gratia Rè di Boemia, Conte Palatino, etc. Dated from the Castle in Prague, Sept. 7, 1619. A request for goodwill for Frederick upon his installment as King of Bohemia, and assurance of his peaceful intentions. 6 leaves, numbered ff. 54-59.

Pius V, Pope. Taxa per l'Armamento della lega contro il Turco al tempo di Pio V. In Latin. Schedule of subsidiaries in troops and money to be contributed to the Liga which Pius V had called up against the Turkish danger. 16 leaves, numbered ff. 60-75. Concerning the years 1566-1567.
Sicily, Kingdom of. Historical survey, 514-Charles V. N.d. (17th century copy?). 8 leaves, numbered ff. 76-83.

Francavila, Pedro de Toledo, Marquis of, Viceroy of Milan. Demanda fatta a Don Pietro de Toledo Governatore di Milano dal...di Bethune Ambasciadore di Francia. Dated Milan, July 25, 1616. Demands made of the Viceroy of Milan, representative of King Philip III of Spain, on behalf of the French government which guaranteed Asti and other possessions to Charles Emmanuel, Duke of Savoy. 1 leaf (f. 84).
Risposta à M. di Bethune del Signor Don Pedro di Toledo. N.d. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 85-87.
Osuña, Pedro Girón, Duke of. Copia de Carta del Sr. Don Pedro Girón para el Sr. Duque de Osuna su padre dela Capitana de...à los 18 Julio 1617. In Spanish. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 88-89.
Satirical piece , in the form of a memorandum to the Pope, about some affairs in Naples. N.d. (17th century). 3 leaves, numbered ff. 90-92. In Latin.
Sermon. N.d. 6 leaves, numbered ff. 94-99.

Alba, Ferdinand Alvarez de Toledo, Duke of. Supplicandole tome la defensa del libro que há estampado sobre el Rito 235 de la Gran Corte de la Vicaria...que han intentado en Roma prohivillo. N.d. (1555-1558). In Spanish. Request, made by Pedro of Urries, Auditor General, to the Duke of Alba, in his capacity as Viceroy of Naples, to defend a work on a certain rite of the Naples Vicariat which had been condemned in Rome by the Inquisition, under Pope Paul IV. 33 leaves, numbered ff. 100-132.

Braccini, Giulio Cesare, Abbot. In constitutionem Sanctissimi D.N.PP. Urbani Octavi super Residentia episcoporum, cogitationes. N.d. (1623-1644). In Latin. Braccini, an abbot at Lucca, wrote a report on the fire caused by an outbreak of Vesuvius in 1631. 10 leaves, numbered ff. 136-145.

Fernel, Jean. Curatorio Fernelii in Secretum pro Gutta. N.d. Autograph expertise by the famous French physician on gout, or arthritis, and its cures, including detailed prescriptions for dieting. Possibly referring to a certain personality ("dominus")?. 2 leaves, some stains and tears, numbered ff. 147-148. In Latin.

Douai, University of. Extractum ex Libro... Duacensis. Memoriale dato à M. Vescovo sopra la discussione di varii puntium pugnati dalli Padri Giesuiti. In relation to the famous dispute on Grace between the Jesuits (Molina) and the Dominicans (Bajus, Bañes). In the Netherlands, the Universities of Louvain, Douai, etc. favored Bañes during a lengthy dispute with Jesuit Leonard Lessius, who supported Molinas' book, published 1588.

The present piece refers to an edict which was to be published in the Jesuit colleges; dates June 28 and July 8, 1591. The Bull of Gregory XIV, confirming the Jesuit constitutions, was also issued on June 28, 1591. The extract is signed by A. Herronius (?). 1 leaf (f. 149). In Latin.

Douai, University of. Letter from the Magistri Facultatis et Scholae Theologicae at Douai University to Calatino, Papal Nuncio for both Germanies. Dated Douai, August 13, 1591. Objections of the Theological Faculty to two edicts issued by the Nuncio concerning Jesuit teaching. 7 leaves, numbered ff. 152-158. In Latin. signed by Balduinus Rhytonius, temporal Dean of Theology.
Glyns, Johannes de, Prior of the Charterhouse School at Roermonde (Limburg). Autograph letter to the same Nuncio. Undated (1591). Same subject as above. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 159-162. In Latin.
Douai, Rector of the University. Copy of a letter to the Nuncio at Cologne. Dated Douai, August 24, 1591. 1 leaf (f. 163). In Latin.

(Henry IV, King of France). Copia literarum Consilii Primati ad rectorem Universitatis Duacensis quibus mandatur ut edictum Bmi. D. Nuncii Apostolici pro Lovan. etiam Duaci publicatur. Dated Brussels, June 25, 1591. 1 leaf (f. 164). In French.
Nos. 18-21 in original wrapper, with embossed seal of the University of Douai.

Afflighem, Abbey of. Supplicatio Religiosorum Abbatiae Affliginiensis. Petition from the monks at the Benedictine Abbey of Afflighem (Brabant) addressed to Octavio Mirto Frangipani, Bishop of Tricario (Naples), Papal Nuncio in Belgium. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 166-167. In Latin.

Hovius, Matthais, Archbishop of Mecheln. Copia litterarum...Domini Nuntii Apostolici ad Archepiscopum Mechliniensem daterum Bruxella XII ma Septembris 1597. -Responsio marginalis Domini Archiepiscopi ad...D. Nuncii Apostolici literas. The first dated Brussels, Sept. 12, 1597. The reply dated Mecheln, Dec. 4, 1599, with the autograph signature of Matthias Hovius, Archbishop of Mecheln. 7 leaves, numbered ff. 170-176. In Latin.

Afflighem, Benedictine Abbey of. Copy of a letter, dated Brussels, May, 2, 1601, informing a person at the court of Pope Clement VIII of the dispute between the Archbishop of Mecheln, Matthais Hovius, and the Abbey of Afflighem. Possibly by the Papal Nuncio of Belgium, at Brussels. With marginalia in another hand. 7 leaves, numbered ff. 178-185. In Italian.

Manaraeus, Oliverius, S.J. Copia literarum R. P. Oliverii Manaraei Praepositi Provincialis Societatis Jesu per Belgium ad Reverednissimos Atrebatensem et Cameracensem. Dated Tournai, Feb. 27, 1592. Manaraeus, Dutch minister with the Provincial of the Belgian Jesuits, was among the active Jesuits to found and further the mission of the Jesuits in Holland and Belgium. 1 leaf (f. 186). In Latin.
Douai, University of. Copy of a letter from the Dean of Theology, dated Douai, July 24, 1591, and signed by Baldvinus Rychtonius, temporal Dean. 1 leaf (f. 188). In Latin.

Deckers, Jean, S.J. (1560-1619). Copia literarum P. Joannis Deckerii Professoris Duacensis Colegii Societatis Jesu ad R.P. Oliverium Manaraeum Praepositum Provincialem. Dated Douai, June 12, 1591. Concerning exiled Catholic ministers, living in Douai. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 190-191. In Latin.

Frangipani, Ottavio Mirto , Bishop of Tricarico, Papal Nuncio in Belgium. Original letter with autograph signature, to Matthais Hovius, Archdeacon of Mecheln. Dated Trier, Sept. 23, 1595. Concerning the visitation of Jesuit colleges. 1 leaf (f. 192). With original address flap bearing the embossed seal. In Latin.

Manaraeus, Oliverius, S.J. Extractum Literarum provincialis Societatis Jesu ad Rev. Episcopum Attrebatensem. Dated Luovain, June 21, 1591. The Bishop of Arras, Mattheaus Moulart (1575-1600) was the founder of the College of Douai and one of the most active figures in the Catholic reform in Belgium. 1 leaf (f. 194). In Latin.

Frangipani, Ottavio Mirto , Bishop of Tricarico, Papal Nuncio in Belgium. Original letter addressed to him, at Nieuwport, signed "Matrinus Daims (?), sacerdos et canonicus Yprensis." N.d. With outside address and red wax seal. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 196-197. In Latin.

Manaraeus, Oliverius, S.J. Copia litterarum P. Provincialis Jesuit. ad Episcopum Adonaicensem (sic: Atrebatensem). Dated Louvain, June 21, 1591. Copy verified by Thomas Cox (?), Notarius Apostolicus, below. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 198-199. In Latin.

Lessius, Leonardus, S.J. Copia ex litteris Leonardi Lessi ad Reverendum P.P. The Jesuit Lessius is known for taking Louis Molina's side in the famous dispute on the operation of Grace, in which the Dominican monk Domingo Bañes took the other view. The letter is dated from Louvain (where Lessius taught), Dec. 13, 1587. Molina's treatise, Concordia liberi arbitrii cum gratiae donis... , was first published in 1588 in Lisbon. 1 leaf (f. 200). In Latin.

Frangipani, Ottavio Mirto, Bishop of Tricario, Papal Nuncio in Belgium. Autograph letter to Cardinal Aldobrandini, in form of a draft, without signature. Dated April 28, 1602 in the beginning and Brussels, 2 May (?), 1602 at the end. Concerns the dispute between the Archbishop of Mecheln, Matthias Hovius, and the Benedictine Abbey of Afflighem. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 201-204. In Italian.

Frangipani, Ottavio Mirto, Bishop of Tricarico, Papal Nuncio in Germany. Draft of a letter to the clerical heads in Germany. Dated Wuerzburg, January 26, 1596. Up to the year 1596, Frangipani had been active in the Catholic reform movement as Papal Nuncio of Germany. In 1596, he was appointed Nuncio for Belgium. 5 leaves, numbered ff. 206-210. In Latin.

Frangipani, Ottavio Mirto , Bishop of Tricarico, Papal Nuncio in Germany. Copy of a letter to Prince Ferdinand of Bavaria. Dated Wuerzburg, Jan. 26, 1596. About mutual assistance in the Catholic reform. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 211-213. In Latin.
Louvain, University of. Memorandum to the Jesuit Fathers residing at the College of Louvain. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 216-219. In Latin.

Petrus Simonius, Bishop of Ypres. (1586-1605) Assertiones ex publicis per lectionibusque R.R. Patrum Societatis nostris Jesu anno 1586 in Universitate Lovianense habitis verbatim excerptae... Dated Ypres, December 14, 1587. Signed by the Bishop of Ypres, Johannes Silvester, lic. theol., and others. 31 assertions made by the Jesuits and their confutations. Contemporary ms. copy. 9 leaves, numbered ff. 220-228. In Latin.

Oxanus, Franciscus, Rotae Auditor. Copy of a letter of institution, mentioning the auditor Pomeio Arrigoni, Don Pedro de Toledo, Marquis de Villafranca, Spanish ambassador to Holland, and others. Dated Rome, Apostolian Palace, Feb. 12, 1597. Verified below by Curtius Guidottus of Rome, notary of the Rota. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 229-231. In Latin.
Index. 1 leaf.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: pages, numbered ff. 1-419. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, late 17th and early 18th century.

did.unittitle: Manifesto sopra le Cagioni del Fuedo di Farnese... Manifest on the controversy about the Duchy of Castro, proving that it was a freehold within the Papal States. Undated, unsigned (middle 17th century). 6 pages, numbered ff. 1-3. 8vo.

Serlupi, Marchese Francesco Mario. Scrittura d'Autore incognito intorno l'accidente occorso fra il Marchese Francesco Mario Serlupi... The account of an accident, a collision between two carriages on the way to the theater, which led to a legal battle between Marchese Serlupi and Count Zucchi, containing several letters, dated from January to February 1698. Also includes a statement by representatives of both parties in the presence of Cardinals Ottoboni and Francesco Barberini. 24 pages, numbered ff. 5-16. 8vo.

Victor Amadeus II, Duke of Savoy. Breve Ristretto delle Raggioni piu palpabili di S.A.R. di Savoia... Statement on the differences between the Duke of Savoy and Pope Clement XI concerning worldly and ecclesiastical powers, with quotations of earlier papal decisions. At the end, a note of protest by the Duke's minister against the Court of Rome. Dated Feb. 22, 1711. 66 pages, numbered ff. 17-49. 4to.

Ciampoli, Giovanni. Discorso dove s'essamina la caggione dell'Investitura della due Sicilie... An historical treatise on Robert Guiscard (c. 1015- 1085), Norman conqueror of Southern Italy, by the Tuscan poet and writer Giovanni Ciampoli (1589-1643). At the end, two dedicatory letters, dated April 7, 1641 and July 20, 1643. Apparently never published separately. Title page and 156 pages, numbered ff. 51-131. 4to.

Clement XI, Pope. Damnatio, ac prohibitio quorundam Foliorum Hispanico idiomate impressorum... Printed broadside, with woodcut Papal arms and woodcut medallions of SS. Peter and Paul. Rome, ex Typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1709. Large folio, folded. Pope Clement XI's prohibition of the so-called "Folio Hispanico," a book in Spanish on the War of the Spanish Succession. According to Palau 259165, no copy of the Roman first edition of the book survived.

Cenci, Beatrice, Giacomo, and Lucrezia. Relazione della morte di Giacomo e Beatrice Cenci e di Lucrezia Petronii Cenci... A detailed early account of the sentencing and death of Beatrice Cenci, her brother, and their stepmother for the killing of their father Francesco Cenci in 1598. They were executed in 1599. 31 pages, numbered ff. 135-150.

Il Tribunale della R.C. alla Santita di Nostro Sig. Clemente XI. A plea to Pope Clement XI (1700-1721) by the College of Cardinals (?) in defense of their treasurer, Mons. d'Aste. Unsigned, undated. 16 pages, numbered ff. 151-158.

(Frederick IV, King of Eenmark). Considerazioni sopra il ricevimento del Re di Danimarca... Considerations on the reception of the Protestant monarch of Denmark in Rome, 1708. 5-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 161-163.

(Martinitz, Georg Adam, Count of). Risposta al Manifesto del Sig. Amb. Cesarea... Answer to a manifest by the Imperial Ambassador, Count Martinitz (d. 1714), concerning the Procession of the Corpus Domini. 3 pages, numbered ff. 165-166.
(Martinitz, Georg Adam, Count of). Reflessioni sopra la scrittura publicata... Answer to previous document (no. 9). Unsigned, undated. 11 pages, numbered ff. 167-172. Large folio, folded.

Pallavicini, Rannuccio, Governor of Rome. A proclamation by the Governor, dated Oct. 5, 1703, concerning a criminal case involving a Roman, Scipi Sant Croce, a Florentine, Camillo Corsini, and a Bolognese, Philippo Bentivolo, and the death by duel of a Signor Angelo Gavotti. In Latin. 4 pages, numbered ff. 173-174.
Gavotti, Ortentia Capizucchi. A plea for the safety of her sons, referring to the death of her husband (see above, no. 11). Dated Nov. 17, 1713. 2 pages, numbered ff. 175.

Vasto, Marchese Cesare del. Almae Urbis Gubernatore in Criminalibus Romana Moderationis Monitorii. Printed brief in the case of the Marchese del Vasto that became a cause célèbre. Vasto had a fight with Cardinal Forbin wand was sentenced to death on March 18, 1702. Political pressure by the Imperial party, however, prevented the execution. This is a defense by the Roman advocate Hyacinthus de Archangelis.

The pamphlet seems to be extremely scarce; it is not cited by Pastor (XV, p. 21), nor is it in the catalogues of the British Museum or the Bibliothèque Nationale. Rome, typis Rev. Cam. Apost., 1702. 8 leaves, numbered ff. 177-184.

Vasto, Marchese Cesare del. Sentence, in Latin, pronounced by Rannuccio (here misspelled Raymundus) Pallavicini, Governor of Rome, dated Rome, Feb. 27, 1702 and undersigned by several officials (see above, no. 13). 11 pages, numbered ff. 185-190. Also a copy of a short statement about the case of del Vasto, undated, unsigned. 1 page. 8vo.

Ristretto dell'Abiura Semipublica... An account of the Inquisition in Rome, Nov. 26, 1698, against one Fra Pietro Paolo, accused of carrying heretical documents and pretending to see visions of the Saints. He was apparently a Quietist and a follower of Molinos. He was sentenced to life inprisonment. 4 pages, numbered ff. 191-192.
Relazione dell'Abiuro Semipublica... Another account of the same hearing (or another of the same year) against Fra Pietro Paolo. Undated, unsigned. 3-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 193-194.

Articoli accordati nel trattata fatto in Pisa... Copy of the Treaty of Pisa, of Feb. 12, 1664, when peace was made between Pope Alexander VII and King Louis XIV of France. Contains 15 points, regarding Comacchio, Avignon, Castro, etc. Undated, unsigned. (See Pastor XIV/1, p. 378). 12 pages, numbered ff. 195-200.

(Louis XIV, King of France). Copia delle lettera del Rè... Copy of a letter, dated Jan. 23, 1702, by Louis XIV to Pope Clement XI regarding proposals to stem the conquests of the Imperial party in the north of Italy. 3 pages, numbered ff. 203- 204.
(Philip V, King of Spain). Traduzione di Lettera del Re... Translation of a letter by Philip V of Spain to Cardinal Ludovico Portocarrero, dated March 20, 1702. 3 pages, numbered ff. 205-206. 8vo.

(Visit of Philip V of Spain in Naples, April-May, 1702). Several letters and reports from eyewitnesses of the visit of Philip V to Naples in the spring of 1702. 26 pages, numbered ff. 207-223. Various sizes, 8vo to folio.

Declaratio Legati a Letere In Consistorio Secreto facta...8 Maii 1702. Copy of the official document, naming Cardinal Carlo Barberini as Papal legate to Naples for the visit of Philip V. 1-1/2 pages (f. 224). In Latin.

Protesta stipulata di Pubblico Notaro in questa Citta di Napoli... A protest by loyal citizens of Naples against the violence that broke out on April 30, 1702 during the visit of Philip V of Spain to Naples. 3 pages, numbered ff. 225-226.

Quantum ad relationem tam enormis tam inauditi tam improvisi facinoris in Personam Principii Monaci... A statement in Latin concerning the Prince of Monaco. Undated, unsigned. Apparently not complete. 2 pages (f. 227).

Lettera venuta da Genova sopra gl'avvinimenti... An anonymous report, signed N.N., on Fra Tommaso Granelli, Provincial of the Observants in Genoa, against whom an investigation by the Roman ecclesiastical tribunal was being conducted. Printed pamphlet, dated Genoa, Jan. 4, 1713. Turin, nella stamperia di F.M. Marciano, n.d. Title page and 13 pages, numbered ff. 229-236.

Acta Renunciationis Cardinalatus... Two bibliographical notes on proclamations of the Cardinals' College: one concerning Ferdinand I de'Medici, Grand Duke of Tuscany, of 1588; the other of 1643, concerning Charles Emmanuel II, Duke of Savoy. 1 page (f. 237v). In Latin.

Venerabile Fratres. Copy of a proclamation by the College of Cardinals, relieving Cardinal Francesco Maria de'Medici of his Cardinal's rank upon his own request, as he wished to marry and prevent the name of de'Medici from being extinguished. Undated and unsigned. The permission was given on June 26, 1709. 3 pages, numbered ff. 238-238a. In Latin.
Medici, Cardinal Francesco Maria de'. Copy of a letter in Latin to Pope Clement XI, asking him to relieve him of his Cardinal's rank, dated Florence, June 15, 1709. 2 pages (f. 239).
Medici, Cardinal Francesco Maria de'. Copy of another letter to the Cardinals in the same matter as above (see nos. 26 & 27). 2 pages (f. 241).

(Medici, Cardinal Francesco Maria de'). Copy of a letter to Pope Clement XI by a legal authority concerning Cardinal de'Medici's request. In Latin, undated, unsigned. (June, 1709, see previous three items). 2 pages, numbered ff. 242-243.

(Medici, Cardinal Francesco Maria di'). Copy of a letter in Latin, written in the name of Cosimo III de'Medici, Grand Duke of Tuscany, to Pope Clement XI in the matter of Cardinal de'Medici's request (see previous numbers 26-29). Dated Florence, June 8, 1709 and underwritten by several secretaries. 6 pages, numbered ff. 244-246.

Il Collegio et il Universita de Mercanti fondecali di Roma. Alla Sagra Congragatione sopra la riforma et moderatione del vestire. A supplication by the merchants of Rome concerning high taxes on brocades, silks, and laces, with a summary of regulations by earlier Popes concerning the reform of vestments. Undated and unsigned, probably first quarter of the 18th century. 17-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 248-256.

Il Collegio et Il Universita de Mercanti fondicali di Roma. Two slightly varying statements by the merchants of Rome concerning the reform and moderation of luxury. 8 pages, numbered ff. 257-261. Undated, unsigned. In the time of Innocent XII's papacy (1691-1700).

(Altieri, Cardinal Paluzzo, Camerlengo). Folium examinandum in Congregatione Annone... New regulations concerning the trade and distribution of wheat, baked goods, etc., established under the aegis of Cardinal Altieri. In Latin. Dated Nov. 18, 1689. 4 pages and title, numbered ff. 262-265.

(Altieri, Cardinal Paluzzo). A letter of complaint by the ambassadors of France, Spain, Germany, and Venice against the Cardinal Altieri who did not grant them an audience with Pope Clement X. Undated, unsigned. 1674-1675. 9 pages, numbered ff. 266-270.
Ristretto della Congragatione tenuta Domenica 7 Novembre 1683. Comments on the edict against the immodesty of ladies' dresses. 4 pages, numbered ff. 272-273.

Lollus, Paul, S.Th.D. Disceptatio Theologica et Canonica circa acceptionem, recusationem aut renunciationem Cardinalatus. A dissertation on Canon law on acceptance and refusal of the Cardinalship. In Latin. Undated, unsigned. 10 pages, numbered ff. 274-278. 1681, according to a heading added later.

Alibert, Count Giacomo d'. All'Illustrissimi... Prelati, e Deputati dell'Archiconfraternita de S. Girolamo della Carrita. A letter and statement, unsigned and undated, on the construction of a new theater by the architects Carlo Fontana and Giovanni Antonio de Rossi. Circa 1693. This new Theatro di Tordinona was opened on Jan. 25, 1696. Count Alibert was the originator of the first public musical theater in Rome. 7 pages, numbered ff. 280-285.

Padrone, Ferdinando. Alla Sagra Congregatione Deputata... Printed leaflet, with detailed costs, of an aquaduct to Civita Vecchia. Rome, nella stamperia della Rev. Cam. Apost., 1695. 8 leaves, numbered ff. 286-293.

Ristretto e dimonstratione degl'utili, e commodi, che sono per resultarne dalla Condotta dell'Aqua... A printed discourse on the advantages of the aquaduct in Civita Vecchia, with detailed specifications, which was being built by Ferdinando Padrone. Rome, per Antoni de Rossi, 1703. 8 pages, numbered ff. 294-297.

Utrumque edictum Mediolanense procul dubio subiacet dispositioni Bullae Caenae Domini... A treatise in Latin, apparently a draft concerning a Milan edict referring to a Papal Bull (by Innocent XII?) with historic references to controversies between the Lombardic states and the Court of Rome. Also with passages in Italian. Undated and unsigned. 10 pages, numbered ff. 298-303.

Relazione dell'arrivo fatto in Praga da Carlo terzo Re della Spagna. A detailed description of the ceremonies and festivities at the visit to Prague of Charles III, King of Spain. Charles, son of Leopold I, and later Charles VI as Holy Roman Emperor, was acknowledged King of Spain as Charles III in 1703 against Philip V. Dated Sept. 26, unsigned. The visit to Prague must have taken place between 1703 and 1711. 5 pages, numbered ff. 304-306.

(Louvain, University of). Pareri dell'Universita di Lovanio... The opinion of the doctors of the University of Louvain in the case of William of Orange, allied with Austria, against James II of England who had converted to Roman Catholicism and whom the Prince of Orange succeeded in 1689 as William III of England. The political situation was deeply involved in the controversies of Jansenism and the "case of conscience." Undated, unsigned (before 1689). 15 pages, numbered ff. 308-316.

Sincerissimo ma altretanto detestabile fatto sotte la parola di fede successo alle Truppe Allemanne... An account of the evacuation of German troops from Ficcarolo on the Po River through the intervention of the Papal Legate in Ferrara, Cardinal Fulvio Astalli. Containing copy of the letter by Astalli, dated June 20, 1704, and the account of the return of the French to the city despite contrary promises to the Germans. 6 pages, numbered ff. 317-319.

Ceremoniale per Sua Maesta...il trattamento dei li Cardinali. Instructions for the ceremonial to be observed at the visit of Maria Casimira, widow of John Sobieski, King of Poland, who retired to Rome in 1698, with references to Christina, Queen of Sweeden. At the end, a copy of a letter in Latin to the Queen of Poland by Pope Innocent XII, dated Dec. 1, 1698. 5 pages, numbered ff. 320-322.

Vigili, Fabio, Bishop of Spoleto. Imperatori. Super actis in Conventu Spirensi. Copy of a letter by the Bishop of Spoleto to Emperor Charles V, concerning the Imperial Diet at Speyer of June, 1544. In Latin. Dated Rome, August 24, 1544. Some holes and stains, effecting a few words. Title and 17 pages, numbered ff. 323-332.

Corsini, Ottavio, Archbishop of Tarsos. Copy of a letter by Corsini, Pope Gregory XV's Nuncio to France, written to Louis XIII, exhorting him to continue to fight against the Hueguenots. Dated April 15, 1622. 14 pages, numbered ff. 335-341.

Ragguaglio del'Viaggio datto da N.S. Papa Innocentio XII... Report of a trip made by Pope Innocent XII in April of 1697, with description of the churches and palaces visited, including the works of art, the receptions, the gifts received, and gifts given to the Viceroy of Naples. 22 pages folio and 6 pages 8vo, numbered ff. 349-362.

Nota de preparamenti fatti dal Principe Borghese nella Tenuta di Carocceto... Preparations made by Prince Borghese for Pope Innocent XII's visit to Nettuno, including the meals served, the hostelries closed for security reasons, etc. Also, the presents given to the Pope by various persons. Apparently referring to the same papal trip as in the item above (no. 47). 11 pages, numbered ff. 363-368.

...in Relatione del Viaggio fatto dalla...Papa Innocentio XII à Civita Vecchia. Report on the trip to Civita Vecchia by Pope Innocent XII, written by "N.N." With lists of presents given to the Pope by Cardinals, princes, etc. Also a list of presents to the Pope in Castle St. Guido. All referring to the Pope's trip in 1697 (see above two items, nos. 47 & 48). 12 pages, numbered ff. 369-377.

Racconto della Legazione del Card. Boncompagni alla Regina de Romani... A detailed description of the reception of the Queen of Romania in Modena by Cardinal Giacomo Boncompagni, archbishop of Bologna, who had been assigned this task by Pope Innocent XII. With enumeration of the attending officials and questions of the ceremonial. Unsigned. (16 January, 1699). 10 pages, numbered ff. 378-382.

Aste, Cardinal Marcello d', Archbishop of Ancona. Testamento. Printed testament of the Cardinal Marcello d'Aste who died in Bologna on June 11, 1709. The testament was published and opened by the notary Paolo Novello on June 15, 1709. With large woodcut of the Cardinal's arms on the title. 12 pages, numbered ff. 384-389. Rome, nella stamperia di Gio. Francesco Chracas, 1709.
Pallavicini, Cardinal Ranuccio. Schedola Testamentaria. Printed testament by the Cardinal Pallavicini who died June 30, 1712. 3 pages, numbered ff. 390-391. N.p., n.d. (1712).

Rospigliosi, Maria Camilla Pallavicini, Duchess of Zagarolo. Testamento... Printed testament, dated May 2, 1707, and published in 1710. 12 leaves, numbered ff. 392-403. N.p., typis de Comitibus, 1710.

Charles II, King of Spain. Copia del Testamento che alli 2 Ottobre 1700, e del Codocillo, che alli 5 del medesimo Mese, ed anno hà fatto...Dopo la di cui dispozione mancòdi Vita il primo Novembre susseguente. Printed testament of Charles II of Spain, whose death on Nov. 1, 1700 caused the War of the Spanish Succession.

In this will as his 13th point, he names Philip d'Anjou (Philip V) as his heir and successor. It is published herein Galleria di Minerva , Tome IV, Part IV, pp. 65-84, with a title leaf and a full-page engraved portrait of Charles II. Venice, Girolamo Abrizzi, 1700. Title, engraved portrait, and 9 pages, numbered ff. 404-415.

Reflessione sopra il Manifesto del Conte di Melgar, Almirante di Castiglia... Reflections on the manifest by the Count of Melgar from Lisbon, Jan. 29, 1704, concerning the testament of Charles II of Spain (see above, no. 54) and the Spanish Succession. (c. 1704, unsigned). 8 pages, numbered ff. 416-419.
INSTRUTTIONI PER LI NUNTII IN ELVETIA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Instruttioni per li Nuntii in Elvetia. 23 manuscript documents and 1 printed broadside, comprising 327 pages, numbered ff. 1-189. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Aste, Marcellus de, Archbishop of Athens. Proclomation by Marcello de Aste, Pope Innocent XII's Nuncio in Switzerland, concerning tax regulation. Printed broadside, 4 columns within a frame of typographical ornaments. Large folio, folded. Dated Lucerne, March 17, 1694.

Ristretto del Instrutione per Monsignore Nuntio d'Elvetia. Short instructions to the Nuncio in Switzerland, unsigned, undated. Probably for Alessandro Scappi, the successor of Ludovico di Sarego, who was Nuncio from 1613-1621. Gives information of the temporal and spiritual organization of the 8 Catholic cantons of Switzerland, on the bishops, abbots, orders, and monasteries. 11 pages, numbered ff. 1-6.

Cinque sono li Vescovi soggetti alla Nunziatura dll'Elvezia... Report of a Nuncio in Switzerland, on the 5 bishoprics, the jurisdiction of the bishops, etc. Undated, unsigned. Probably at the time of Pope Alexander VIII (1689-1691), with mention of Pierre Montenach, Bishop of Lusanne (1688-1707), other personalities and events of Catholic interest in the Swiss cantons. 8 pages, numbered ff. 7-10.

Notizie d'alcune particolarita ritratte dal Legature di Monsig. Borromeo che venne a Roma... Notes on the Swiss nunciature from a report of Frederico Bartolomeo, made on a visit to Rome in 1664. Bartolomeo was Nuncio in Switzerland from 1655-1665. 3-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 11-12.

Notizie per il nuovo Nuntio ai Suizzieri. Rules for the household of the Swiss Nuncio, his staff, food, furniture, his official duties, his relations to the clergy and to diplomats. Unsigned and undated. Probably around 1665, after Borromeo finished his nunciature. 5-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 13-15.

(Relazione della Nunziatura). A detailed report from Switzerland, apparently by a staff member of the Papal Nuncio there, to the Pope. Contains accounts of the government of the Swiss cantons, of the ceremonies of the Nuncio at audiences, the duties and jurisdiction of the Nuncio, and the diplomacy needed in the ticklish situation between the Catholic and Protestant sections of the country. With lists of the monasteries of the various orders in Switzerland. Undated, unsigned. (After 1630, probably under the Papacy of Pope Urban VIII). 54 pages, numbered ff. 19-45.

Borghese, Cardinal Scipione. Instruttione à Mons. Sarego, Vescovo d'Adria destinato Nuntio nell'Elvetia da PP. Paolo V. Detailed instructions to Ludovico di Sarego, who was Nuncio in Switzerland 1613-1621. Dated Rome, Sept. 2, 1614 and signed by Cardinal Scipione Borghese, then camerlengo of the Church. 112 pages, numbered ff. 49-104.

(Assemblea del Clero, tenuta in Parigi l'anno 1682). A report on the assembly of the French Clergy in Paris, 1682, which, on the order of Louis XIV, decided on the controversies of the Regalia and the Papal power as opposed to worldly power, problems which led to constant tensions between Pope Innocent XI and Louis XIV of France. 28 pages, numbered ff. 107-120.
(Innocent XII, Pope). Letter in Latin, naming Marcello d'Aste Archbishop of Athens. Unsigned, undated (Dec., 1692). 2 pages (f. 123).
(Baldeschi, Fredericus). Copies of several letters by and concerning Baldeschi, Papal Nuncio in Switzerland 1665-1668, to the Catholic cantons. Undated, unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 125-128.
Ristretto delle Facolta de' SS. Nunzii come Prelati famigliari et Assistenti. On certain privilidges granted to the Nuncios. 1 page (f. 129).

Informazioni delle cose versenti con Monsig. Vescovo di Losanna, del Card. Colonna. Instructions by Cardinal Colonna to the Bishop of Lusanne. Undated, unsigned. Possibly at the time of Borromeo's nunciature in Switzerland, 1655-1665. 6 pages, numbered ff. 130-132.

Instruzione per Mons. Ilustrissimo d'Asti. Specific instructions for Marcello d'Aste, who was Nuncio in Switzerland from 1692-1695, referring to various abbeys, to ceremonies, to trouble spots in certain counties, etc. Undated, unsigned. Probably written early in his nunciature. Title page and 14 pages, numbered ff. 135-142. Large folio, folded.

(Informationi dalla Secretario di Stato). Information of Switzerland which the Nuncios are urged to study before departing from Rome. This information seems to be based on the experience of Giacomo Cantelmi who had been Papal Nuncio from 1685 to 1687 and had been made cardinal in 1690. Probably directed to Marcello d'Aste who started his Nunciature in Lucerne in 1692. Unsigned, undated. 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 143-146. Large folio, folded.

Alcuni informationi circa la Nuntiatura e Citta di Lucerna. Some notes concerning the house occupied by the Papal Nuncio in Lucerne, the senate of the city, the bishoprics under the Nuncio's jurisdiction, etc. Undated, unsigned. Circa 1667. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 147-148.
Notizie per il nuovo Nunzio. Notes for a new Nuncio in Switzerland, what he should do on his arrival in Lucerne, how much money he should carry with him, etc. 1 page (f. 149). Undated, unsigned.

Informatione per Mons. Nunzio di Lucerna. More notes of advice for a new Nuncio coming to Switzerland, about his staff, expenses, questions of diplomatic ceremony, his relationship withthe citizens and government of Lucerne, etc. Undated, unsigned. The same secretary (Giov. Antonio Rusconi) is recommended as in No. 15. The date is probably around 1668, and the instructions might be for the successor of Fridericus Baldeschi who left Lucerne in 1668. 4 pages, numbered ff. 150-151.

Nota di quello costano a Mons. Illustrissimo Nuntio la Lettiga con suoi finimenti, e due muli, quali adesso saranno di anni otto. An account of the cost of the carriage and mules for the Nuncio in Switzerland, apparently taken from the costs incurred by Giacomo Cantelmo and his successor, given as useful information to the new Nuncio, Marcello d'Aste. Undated, unsigned. Circa 1692. 1 page (f. 153).
Paramenti per Mons. Illustrissimo Nuntio... Lists on the Church requisites and on the staff needed by the Nuncio in Switzerland. Undated, unsigned. 2 pages (f. 154).

A Mons. Nunzio inviato alle Hti. Suizzeri, Grigioni, e Loro Sudditi e Confederati possono darsi le seguenti notitie. Information for the new Nuncio on the Swiss people, of whom it is said are well-educated, that they don't like innovations or ostentatious bahavior; on money needed. Giacomo Cantelmo is mentioned who was Nuncio in Switzerland from 1685-1687. Undated, unsigned. 4 pages, numbered ff. 157-158. Large folio, folded.

(Aste, Marcello d'). Quando Mons. Illustrissimo d'Asti non habbia sin'hora scritto alli Cantoni Cattolici... An urgent advice to Marcello d'Aste, who went as Nuncio to Switzerland in 1692 to write two letters to the Catholic cantons. Also other briefings on Switzerland and on the Nuncio's duties there. Undated, unsigned (c. 1692). 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 159-162. Stained.

Che debba fare il Nunzio per dar sodisfazione in cose temporali nella Nunziatura de Suizeri. Information on the character and government of the Swiss people, how to treat them, and how to behave in negotiations with them in order to win their confidence. Undated, unsigned. 8-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 163-167.

(Una breve relatione della Nuntiatura de Suizzari). Information on the political situation in Switzerland, particularly in the Veltlin, with advice to the Nuncio, the moneys and credentials he has to bring, etc. Undated and unsigned. 9 pages, numbered ff. 169-173. Possibly directed to Alessandro Scappi, who was Nuncio in Switzerland from 1621 to 1628.

Instruzione all'...Duca di Fiano, Destinato della Santita di...Papa Gregorio XV a pigliar il deposito a Nome di S. Santita e della Sede Apostolica delli Forti della Valltellina. Instructions to Orazio Ludovisi, the Duke of Fiano, brother of Pope Gregory XV, when he was sent with the Papal troops to Veltlin in 1623. Dated Rome, April 5 (1623). 29-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 175-189.
RELATIONI DI CONCLAVI

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relationi di Conclavi. 18 manuscript documents, comprising 1063 pages, numbered ff. 1-536. 4to. Contemporary vellum. Italy (Rome), 17th century.

did.unittitle: Conclava delle Sede Vacante di Papa Leone Xmo nel quale fu creato Papa Adriano VI. Account of the election of Pope Adrian VI in 1521, with a list of the Cardianls at the Conclave. 21 pages, numbered ff. 1-11.
Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Adreano VI nel qual fu creato Papa Clemente VII. Account of the election of Pope Clement VII in 1523. 20 pages, numbered ff. 12-21.
Questa elettione piace a molti... An historical survey of the papacies of the two Medicean Popes Leo X and Clement VII, made upon the election of Pope Paul III in 1533. 61 pages, numbered ff. 22-52.
Conclave della sede vacante di Papa Clemente VII ne qual fu creato Papa Paolo Terzo. Account of the election of Pope Paul III in 1533. 21 pages, numbered ff. 53-63.
Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Paolo Terzo nel quale fu creato Papa Giulio Terzo. Account of the election of Pope Julius III in 1534. 66 pages, numbered ff. 64-96.
Conclave delle Sede Vacante di Papa Giulio Terzo nel quale fu creato Papa Marcello Secondo. Account of the election of Pope Marcellus II in 1555. 28 pages, numbered ff. 97-110.

Conclave delle Sede Vacante di Papa Marcello Secondo nel quale fu creato Papa Paolo IV. An account of the election of Pope Paul IV in 1555; with a list of Cardinals at the conclave. 31 pages, numbered ff. 111-126.
Conclave delle Sede Vacante di Papa Paolo IV nel quale fu creato Papa Pio Quarto. An account of the election of Pope Pius IV in 1559. 24 pages, numbered ff. 127-138.
Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Pio IV nel quale fu creato Papa Pio Quinto. Account of the election of Pope Pius V in 1566. 73 pages, numbered ff. 139- 175.

Conclave delle Sede Vacante di Papa Pio V nel quale fu creato Papa Gregorio XIII. Account of the election of Pope Gregory XIII in 1572, with a list of Cardinals at the Conclave. 19 pages, numbered ff. 176-185.

Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Gregorio XIII nel quale fu creato Papa Sisto Quinto. Account of the election of Pope Sixtus V in 1585; with a list of the Cardinals at the Conclave. 32 pages, numbered ff. 186-201.

Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Sisto Quinto nel quale fu creato Papa Urbano Settimo. Account of the election of Pope Urban VII in 1590; with a list of Cardinals at the Conclave. 36 pages, numbered ff. 202-219.

Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Urbano Settimo nel quale fu creato Papa Gregorio Decimo Quarto. Account of the election of Pope Gregory XIV in 1590; with a list of the Cardinals present at the Conclave. 191 pages, numbered ff. 220-313.

Conclave della Sede Vacante di Papa Gregorio XIV nel quale fu creato Papa Innocento IX. Account of the election of Pope Innocent IX; with a list of Cardinals present at the Conclave. 78 pages, numbered ff. 314-352.

Conclave della Sedia Vacante di Papa Innocento IX nel quale fu creato Papa Clemente VIII. Account of the election of Pope Clement VIII in 1592; with a list of Cardinals at the Conclave. 91 pages, numbered ff. 353-398.
Conclave di Gregorio Decimo Quinto. Account of the election of Pope Gregory XV in 1621; with a list of Cardinals at the Conclave. 39 pages, numbered ff. 400-419.

Conclave del anno MDCXXXIII (sic) nel quale fu Messa la prima Volta in uso la Bolla della Elettione publicata dal Gregorio XV. Fu creato...il Cardinal Maffeo Barberino detto Urbano VIII. Account of the election of Pope Urban VIII in 1623. This was the first Conclave where the Bull by Gregory XV on the elections was put into effect. Title page and 197 pages, numbered ff. 421-518.
Conclave di Papa Urbano VIII. Another account of the election of Pope Urban VIII in 1623. 34 pages, numbered ff. 520-536.
HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 13 manuscript items in Italian and Latin. 247

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: numbered leaves in all. Small folio. Contemporary vellum (back partly damaged); 3 (of 4) leather ties; uncut. Italy, middle of the 17th century.

did.unittitle: Index. Loose. 2 leaves.
