Christina, Queen of Sweeden. Oratione fatta alli Comitii d'Upsala nel mese di Febraio 1654 dalla Regina di Suezia nella Renunza, che fece del Regno di Suezia. The speech made by the Queen at Upsala, previous to her solemn abdication on July 6, 1654. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 1-3.

Innocent X, Pope. Bolla assolutoria fatta da Innocentio Decimo al P. Principe Lodovisio di tutti li eccessi...nel tempo del suo Pontificato. Dated Rome, July 16, 1654. Contemporary ms. copy. Niccolo Ludovisi, Prince of Piombino, son-in-law of the Pope's favorite Olimpia Maidalchini, was expelled from Rome in July, 1654, soon after the expulsion of Cardinal Pamfili. (See Pastor XIV/1, p. 37 and note). 2 leaves, numbered ff. 5-6.

Guise, Henry, 2nd Duke of. Planetus Guisii Ducis adverso certamine fugienti. In Latin. Poem recording the unfortunate attempt made by the Duke to take over the Realm of Naples on behalf of the King of France. He was captured by the Spaniards near Capua in 1648. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 7-8.

Naples, Kingdom of. Ristretto delle Mosse de Francesci per l'Acquisito di Napoli...date nell' Istorie doppo Carlo Primo. Historical survey of the French attempts to govern Naples from Charles I of Anjou (1266) to 1557. In the beginning stanza X, canto 33, by Ariost. 5 leaves, numbered ff. 9-13.

(Alexander VII, Pope). Lettera d'un Cortegiano sopra quattro Cardinali Papabili. Copy of a letter discussing the prospects of the Cardinals eligible for the Papacy, restricting the final number to four. N.d. (1655?). 4 leaves, numbered ff. 15-18.

Novelli (Lionardo?), Cardinal. Aggionta de G. Cardinali Novelli alla Relatione del Baly di Valenze Ambasciatore di Francia. A refutation (possibly written by Lionardo Novelli, author of a work on papal authority) of a report written by Henri d'Estampes-Valençay, French Ambassador in Rome, 1652- 1653, entitled: Instruttione del Sig. Baili de Valencé...al suo successore (1653, printed 1681). Estampes report describes the inofficial reign of Olimpia Maidalchini, favorite of Pope Innocent X. N.d. (1655). 4 leaves, numbered ff. 19-22.

Trelles (?). Copia de Carta escrita por el Regente Trelles, Giov. Tellez Girón, Duke of Ossuna, Viceroy of Sicily 1655-1666, Al senor Conte de Oñate à Madrid. Iñigo Velez de Guevara y Tasis (d. 1658) had rejected, as Viceroy of Naples, a papal bull, issued by Innocent X on Oct. 15, 1652 which ordered the confiscation of monastic property from non-self- sufficient orders. Later, Oñate became Governor of Milan. This letter, written to him from Naples, may be from Trelles, his successor in Naples. 11 leaves, numbered ff. 23-34. Dated Naples, May 28, 1654.
Genoa, Republic of. Breve Narratione delle Cose seguite ultimamente in Spagna circa l'Interessi de Genovesi, dopò che l'Ambasciadore si abboccò con sua Maestà. N.d. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 35-36.

Finale, Republic of. Memoriale della Republica di Genova presentato dall'Ambasciadore Gio. Fran. Santi al Rè Cattolico contra Risposta di Sua Maestà. N.d. Memorandum from the Ambassador Santi, of the Genoese Republic, to the King of Spain, concerning the sovereignty over the sea area bordering on the Republic of Finale. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 37-40.

Finale, Republic of. Ristretto del fatto, e ragioni della serenissima Republica di Genova, per conto de gl'affari del Finale. Report on the history of the sovereignty in the Ligurian Sea and the Republic of Finale from 1100 to 1652. N.d. (1652). 13 leaves, numbered ff. 41-53.

Castaldo, Antonio. Rumori et Rebbellioni del Principe di Salerno on tempo di D. Pietro di Toledo del 1547; in tempo di Thomas' Aniello... 4 books. History of the Kingdom of Naples during the rebellion under Pedro di Toledo, marchese di Villafranca, to the death of Cardinal Granvelle.

Ms. copy from the time of King John IV of Portugal, with two letters by him attached at the end. The report was published in 1769 in Naples, under the title "Dell'Istoria di notar Antonino Castaldo libri quattro, ne'quali si descrivono gli avvenimenti più memorabili succeduti del regno di Napoli." 91 leaves, numbered ff. 56-147.

Manfred, King of Sicily. (c. 1232-1266). De Frederico Imperatore, Corrado, et Manfredo eius filiis. De Rebellione Regnicolarum Sanctae Romanae Ecclesiae insistentium. De Coronatione ptti. Manfredi Panormis. De Bellis gestis inter Regem Manfredum, et Sumum Pontificem. N.d.

Sicilian history from Emperor Frederick II (Here mistakenly named Fr. IV) to the Kingdom of Manfred, natural son of Frederick II, his death at Benevento in 1266, the invasion and defeat of Conradin in 1268, and the reign of Charles of Anjou. Author unknown. 93 leaves, numbered ff. 154-247. In Latin.
INSTRUCTONS TO NUNCIOS
did.physdesc: 7 manuscript documents, comprising in all 237 leaves,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: numbered ff. 1-237. Many originals are listed in Pastor, vol. XIII. Small folio. Contemporary vellum (lower corner of front cover frayed); uncut. Italy, (1623-1630).

did.unittitle: Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione a Mons. Sacchetti Vescovo di Gravina, Nuntio destinato appresso la Maestà Cattolica. Copy of the papal instructions addressed to Giulio Sacchetti who was appointed nuncio at the court of Madrid, relieving Innocenzo de'Massimi. The original document is dated Jan. 27, 1624 and forms part of the Biblioteca Casanatense (Cod. X.V. 15, p. 149-194). 34 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione à Monsig. Spada Vescovo d'Amiata Nuntio destinato appresso la Mta. Christianissima. Dated Rome, Jan. 23, 1624. Copy of the papal instructions to Bernard Spada, Archbishop of Damiette, upon his appointment as nuncio in Paris. 38 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione à Monsig. Agucchia Arcivescovo di Amafia alla Serenissima Republica di Venetia. N.d. (1623). Copy of the instructions by Pope Urban III introducing Giovan Battista Agucchi to his new post as papal nuncio in Venice. 14 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione à Monsig. Caraffa, Nuntio in Colonia... N.d. (Original dated May 26, 1624). Copy of the papal instructions to Pier Luigi Carafa, Bishop of Tricarico, upon his appointment as nuncio in Cologne. The original Ms. is in the Bib. Casanatense (Cod. X.V. 15, p. 341). 39 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione à Monsig. Antonio Diaz, Vescovo di Caserta, per la nunciatura ordinaria di Nro. Sigre. à Napoli l'anno 1626, li 15 Maggio. Copy of the instruction for Antonio Diaz as Nuncio in Naples. 36 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione à Monsig. Palotta Collettore nel Regno di Portogallo. N.d. (1624). Copy of the papal instructions for Palotta upon his appointment as Collector of the Church in Portugal. Abuse of Church liberty and immunity had created an intolerable situation which the Collector is advised to relieve. 40 leaves.

Urban VIII, Pope. Instruttione a Monsig. Campeggi Vescovo di Caserta per la Nunciatura di Turino. N.d. (c. 1630). Copy of the papal instructions for Campeggi who had been appointed Nuncio to Turin. 27 leaves.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: numbered ff. 1-204. Also a partial ms. index (2 numbered pages). Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy (Naples), 17th century.

did.unittitle: (Charles Emanuel I, Duke of Savoy?). Risposta da darsi dal serenissimo Duca... Copy of a letter by the Duke (probably of Savoy) in Italian, together with two copies of letters in Spanish by Pietro Colomma and by G.B. Serra to the Ambassador Sauli. Undated and unsigned. Probably after 1622. This correspondence concerns Genoa and Milan and the Duke of Savoy's relations with Spain. 3 pages, numbered ff. 1-2.

Scritto per Risposta...del Signor Cardinal Panfilio al Sig. Conte d'Ognatte... A discourse on the Bull of Pope Innocent X in 1652, decreeing the abolition of small convents. The bull was much opposed by the Spanish ambassador and Viceroy of Naples, Count Oñate. Undated, unsigned (c. 1652). 15 pages, numbered ff. 3-10.

Oñate, Count of, Inigo Velez de Guevara. Instruttione...All'Ambasciadore suo Successore del modo per haura da regolares... Instructions by the Count of Oñate to his successor as Spanish Ambassador in Rome, before Oñate became Viceroy of Naples in 1648. Undated and unsigned (1648). Title page and 20 pages, numbered ff. 11-21.

(Rossi (?), Alessandro, Dean of Tortosa). Informatione data a Filippo IV...sopra i Servitii fatti dalla Nobilita Napolitana al tempo delle revolutione. Report to King Philip IV of Spain of the 1647 rebellion in Naples. In Spanish. Undated, unsigned. 11 pages, numbered ff. 23-31.

Index Magistrorum Capellae... Lists in Latin of Royal Chapels and Chaplains in the Kingdom of Naples, from the year 1269 to 1431 and from 1441 to 1612. The lists are taken from the royal archives, esp. from the Royal Chancery. Both are in duplicate. 20 pages, numbered ff. 33-43.

Vincenti, Pietro. Trattato nel Cappellano Maggiore...al Sig. Regente Montoia. A treatise on the Neapolitan "mayor chaplains" by the jurist and archivist Vincenti. Dated Naples, Sept. 5, 1613. In Italian, with excerpts in Latin. 12 pages, numbered ff. 44-50. Apparently unpublished.

Vincenti, Pietro. Al sig. Gioa Montoija Regente di Cancellaria... A letter supplementing the historical treatise on Neapolitan chaplains (see above, no. 6). Dated Naples, Oct. 5, 1613, and signed. In Italian, with quotations in Latin. 19 pages, numbered ff. 51- 60.

De Pheudo Regni Neapolitani... Historical discourse in Latin on the feuds between Naples and Rome, covering the period from the 13th to the 16th century, the last bull being mentioned is that of Leo X in 1521. Title page and 59 pages, numbered ff. 61-91.

Origine della Regia Dohana di Foggia. A historical treatise in Italian on Foggia in Apulia. Alphonso I of Aragon, King of Naples, made it a royal domain in 1443 and named it the place at which the tax on sheep would be paid and the wool sold. 52 pages, numbered ff. 93-119.

Archivo di notar Ruggerio Pappa Insogna nobile del seggio della Montagna. Copy of an archive by the notary Johannes Rugerius (Ruggieri) of the year 1399 at the time of the reign of Ladislaus, King of Naples. Concerning the noble families of the region, with entries of births up to 1425. Signed by the copyist: Jo. Scipio Ametrano. 15 pages, numbered ff. 121-128.

Notamente di tutte quelle si contiene in uno Protocollo di Notar Dionisio de Sarno Gentil'huomo del Seggio di Montagna... Copy from the protocols of the notary Dionisio de Sarno, containing entries concerning noble families at the time of Ladislaus, King of Naples, and his successor, Queen Giovanna II. (c. 1400-1435). 12 pages, numbered ff. 129-134.

(Urban VIII, Pope). An Italian work against the decline of the Roman Church, especially under Pope Urban VIII, in the form of a parable: St. Paul comes down to earth and finds the shocking conditions in Lucca, Parma, Florence, Venice, and Rome. With a preface "Al scrupoloso Christiano." Unsigned and undated (c. 1644?). 61 pages, numbered ff. 137-167.

Trattato di confederatione d'armi, soccorso, promisce mutue... Treaty, probably from the Grand Alliance of 1701, concerning Naples freed from Spanish tyranny. In the introduction, the historical background is given of the various reigns in the Kingdom of Naples; it is followed by 66 points of the treaty. 59 pages, numbered ff. 170-200. Unsigned, undated.

Privilegii e grazie concesse a quelli che saranno devoti ai Monache e porteranno li loro ritrattie medaglie impretrate da un di loro grande devoto assicurando ciaschuno che sono certissime ne mai rivarate. Certain privileges for the carrying of medallion portraits. Undated, unsigned. 6 pages, numbered ff. 202-204.
RELATIONI DI PIU CONCLAVI

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relationi di Piu Conclavi. 72 manuscript documents and 3 engravings, comprising 1445 pages, numbered ff. 1-787. Folio. Contemporary (late 17th century) vellum. Italy, 16th-17th century.

did.unittitle: Discorso sopra Conclavi. A general discourse on conclaves for the election of a Pope. The last page contains a paragraph on the conclave that elected Pope Leo X in 1513. 25 pages, numbered ff. 1-13. Paper browned, some stains and fading. Probably written in the late 16th century, see watermark (Heywood 2833).
Conclave Clementis VII Pontificis Maximi. An account in Latin on the conclave that created Pope Clement VII in 1523. 208 pages, numbered ff. 17-120.

(Conclave 1549-1550, Julius III). Detailed report in 4 letters and the scrutinies of Dec. 3-Dec. 15, 1549 of the Conclave that finally elected Pope Julius III in Feb. 1550. The letters are all directed to the humanist Giovanni della Casa who was then Papal nuncio in Venice and Archbishop of Benevento; they are dated from Nov. 30-Dec. 24, 1649; the last letter is not quite complete and undated.

The writer, Gio. P.F. could not be identified. These are all original letters, with the address on the covering leaves and traces of the wax seal. Some leaves are stained and brittle. Together 30 pages and 3 pages with the address, numbered ff. 121-138.

(Conclave 1549-1550, Julius III). 4 original letters by Antonio Anselmi to Giovanni della Casa (see above), dated Nov. 30 to Dec. 21, 1549, containing detailed information on the progress of the conclave. Also includes some gossip. The letters are written in a calligraphic hand. They all carry the address on the covering leaves and bear traces of the wax seal. Together 11 pages and 4 pages of address, numbered ff. 139-146.

(Conclave 1549-1550, Julius III). Another set of 10 original letters to Giovanni della Casa, Archbishop of Benevento and papal nuncio in Venice, on the conclave that elected Julius III. The writer is Rocco Cataneo, a humanist who edited Cicero in 1545. His informative letters are dated from Nov. 25- Dec. 21, 1549, each with the address on the covering leaf and traces of the wax seal. Together 20 pages and 10 address pages, numbered ff. 147-166.

Elettione de Giulio III. A day by day report of the events during the long conclave for the election of the new Pope, lasting from Nov. 29 to Feb. 8, 1550. Contains accounts of the conclave sessions from the 30th to the 71st day and includes all the voting lists, the proceedings concerning a reform of the elections, and the intrigues from all parties. Author unknown. In Latin. 300 pages, numbered ff. 167-316.

Guidus, Antonius. Elezzione di Pio IV. Account of the vacancy at the death of Pope Paul IV and of the long conclave from Sept. 5 to Dec. 25, 1559 when Pope Pius IV was elected. Guidus was a conclavist, probably of Cardinal Gonzaga; his account was published in 1911 by Merkle. Probably a contemporary ms. copy, with dedication to Cardinal Carlo Borromeo. 130 pages, numbered ff. 317-371 (misnumbered). In Latin.

Conclave fatto per la morte di Papa Leone XI...nel quale fu eletto Papa il Cardinal Borghese detto Paolo V. Account in Italian of the conclave of 1605 that elected Pope Paul V, with the attendence and voting records. 30 pages, numbered ff. 373-387.

Pianta del Conclave fatto in Sede Vacante di Gregorio XV nel quale...Cardinali entrarono adi 19 di Luglio 1623 per elegere il nuovo Pontefice. Engraving, showing seating plan of the 67 cardinals in the Vatican for the conclave of 1623 when Pope Urban VIII was elected. With the names of participating cardinals and exact floorplans. Oblong folio, folded. Small hole in fold. 1 page (f. 389).
(Elezzione di Urbano VIII). Account in Italian of the conclave that led to the election of Pope Urban VIII in August 1623. 19 pages, numbered ff. 390-399.
Conclave di Papa Urbano VIII. Another account in Italian of the conclave of 1623, when Urban VIII was elected Pope. 7 pages, numbered ff. 402-405.
Casale, Andrea. Four Italian sonnets to an Andrea Casale, satirical poems relating to some scandal. 4 pages, numbered ff. 406-408. Undated, unsigned.
(Pasquinade to a Conclave). A satirical poem in Italian, urging not to make a Jesuit or a Theatine Pope. Undated, unsigned. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 409-410.

(Conclave 1644, Innocent X). A dialogue in tercets between the cardinals attending the conclave after the death of Urban VIII, when Innocent X was elected. Undated, unsigned. 7 pages, numbered ff. 411-414.

O Papa Gabella. Humorous Italian poem in Quatrains, with the refrain "O Papa Gabella." Undated, unsigned. Probably composed during the vacancy after Urban VIII's death (1644). 5 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 415-416. See Pastor XIII/2, p. 880.

Conclave 1644, Innocent X. A poem in Italian in dialogue form between the cardinals on the election of a new Pope. With an epitaph in Latin on Urban VIII. Undated, unsigned (1644). 5 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 417-418.
(Conclave 1644, Innocent X). Italian poem in tercets on the election of a new Pope after Urban VIII's death. 3 columns on 2 pages (f. 419).

(Conclave 1644, Innocent X). Italian poem in octaves to the Sacro Collegio, exhorting the cardinals to elect a worthy successor to Urban VIII. 4 columns on 2 pages, numbered ff. 420-421. Undated, unsigned.

(Conclave 1644, Innocent X). Italian poem in tercets in form of a dialogue between the cardinals, assembled in conclave after Urban VIII's death. 8 pages, numbered ff. 422-425. Undated, unsigned (1644).
A Don Tadeo Barberini, Nelle Presenti Guere di Parma. Italian poem to Taddeo Barberini who had been made prefect in the war for Parma. Undated, unsigned, c. 1640. 4 pages, numbered ff. 426-427.

...sopra i Cardinali Vecchi, che pretendono il Papate. Italian poem in tercets to the elder cardinals who claim the papacy. Undated, unsigned. Probably referring to the conclave held after the death of Urban VIII. (1644). 3 pages, numbered ff. 428-429.

(Conclave 1644, Innocent X). Italian poem in tercets in form of a dialogue between the cardinals in conclave after the death of Urban VIII. Undated, unsigned (1644). 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 430-431.

Molti Cercano Padrone. A satirical poem on the cardinals in the conclave after Urban VIII's death; in octaves, with the refrain: "molti cercano padrone." With marginal annotations. 5 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 432-433.

Tocca Musa il Colascione. A long poem in 25 octave stanzas on the death of Urban VIII (1644). A strongly satirical poem against the Pope. 9 columns on 4-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 434-436. See Pastor XIII/2, p. 80.

Pulci, Alessio. Roma gioconda per la ricuperata Sanita di N.S. Papa Urbano Ottavo. Idilio. Poem on the recuperation of Urban VIII after his illness. Apparently original poem, signed by the poet and dedicated to a cardinal, his patron. 4 pages, large folio, folded; numbered ff. 437-438.
Musa allegra ritorna... A satirical Italian poem on court life, apparently directed at Florence. Undated, unsigned. 6-1/2 columns on 3-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 439-440. Large folio, folded.

La Nove Pianta del Conclave fatto in sede vacante de Papa Urbano VIII. Engraving, showing a ground plan of the Vatican, with the seating of the Cardinals, including numerous illustrative scenes: entrance of the Sacred College, sessions, masses, processions, soldiers on horseback, a front view of St. Peter's, view of the Castello S. Angelo, etc. With the names of the 62 attending cardinals of the Conclave of 1644, after the death of Urban VIII. Oblong folio, folded, with break and slight loss in middle fold. Numbered f. 441.

Vero disegno della Pianta dell Conclave fatto in sede vacante di Papa Urbano VIII. Engraving of the ground plan of the Vatican with the seating plan of the 62 attending cardinals. Engraved by Horatio Marinari, Rome. Oblong folio, folded. Numbered f. 442.

Relatione del Conclave di Papa Urbano Ottavo nel quale e stato eletto Papa Innocentio Decimo dell'anno 1644. An account of the conclave. 62 pages, numbered ff. 443-473. 4to. Unsigned, dated Rome, Oct. 4, 1644.

Conclave e succitti della sede vacante de Urbano Ottavo...et la felice assuntione di Gio. Battisite Panfilio chiamata Innocentio X. Another account of the conclave of 1644. Undated, unsigned. 87 pages, numbered ff. 475-518. 4to.
Il Foletto Spione. Conclave di Papa Innocento Decimo L'Anno 1644. An account of the intrigues of the conclave of 1644, and its political background. 23 pages, numbered ff. 519-530. 4to.
Corse nel Conclave in cui fu eletto...Innocento X. Another account of the same conclave, a contemporary copy. 9 pages, numbered ff. 531-535.

(Innocent X, Pope). A satirical poem in Italian, beginning and ending with a sonnet with tercets in between; apparently against the newly elected Pope Innocent X, alluding to his influential sister-in- law, Olympia Maidalchini-Pamfili. Undated (c. 1644), unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 536-539.

Dialogo. -Sonetto. Several satirical poems, dialogues, and sonnets, alluding to a tyrannical Pope (Innocent X?), to a governor of Rome (Arimberto?), etc. Undated, unsigned. 4 pages, numbered ff. 540-541.
Innocento X Pontifici omnium Pessimo Cui. A satirical epigraph in Latin on Pope Innocent X, ending "Gloria Nulla." 1 page (f. 542).
Sen'ando Papa Simone. A satirical poem against Pope Innocent X. 6 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 543-544.

Discorso fra un Cieco di Ponte et una Sentinella di Castel d'Angelo. A dialogue between a blind man on the bridge and a sentinel of the Castel S. Angelo, being a satirical discourse on the papacy and political intrigues, alluding to Innocent X and Olimpia Maidalchini, etc. 8 pages, numbered ff. 545-548. Undated, unsigned.

Non piu guglio, nonpiu fontane... Apparently a satirical lament of Olimpia Maidalchini-Pamphili after she had lost her influence on Pope Innocent X. 3-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 549-550. Undated, unsigned poem.
(Satirical poem in Italian). Apparently alluding to Mascambruno who had faked papal bulls. 3 columns on 2 pages (f. 551). Undated, unsigned.
Lamento di Pimpa. Satirical poem, being Olimpia Maidalchini's lament on hearing of the death of Pope Innocent X. Undated, unsigned. 3 columns on 2 pages (f. 553).
Sentimenti di Pasquino. A pasquinade on the Vatican, treating the conclave (of 1655?) as a Comedy. Undated, unsigned. 8 columns on 4 pages, numbered ff. 554-555.
Poiche quest'anno il Populo Romano... Satirical sonnet on the Vatican, with allusions to Olimpia Maidalchini (identical to the last sonnet in no. 33 above). 1 page (f. 556).
Tocca Musa il Chitarrino... A pasquinade satirizing the nepotism of Innocent X, alluding to Camillo Pamphili, son of Olimpia, etc. 5 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 557-558.
Dalla Cappana Rustica... A pasquinade on the death of Pope Innocent X (1655). 8 columns on 4 pages, numbered ff. 559-560. Undated, unsigned.
Dialogo Don Olimpia Suegliata dall'Anima d'Innocento X. A satirical dialogue in verses between Olimpia Maidalchini and the soul of Pope Innocent X. Undated, unsigned. 4 pages, numbered ff. 561-562.
La veglia delli Dei. Opera Dramatica. A verse drama in which the Gods from Olympus watch the events on earth at the time of Innocent X. 11 pages, numbered ff. 563-568. Undated, unsigned.
Pigra e ancor' la Nave. A sonnet of an allegory on the ship of the Argonauts, possibly alluding to the vacant seat of a pope. Undated, unsigned. 1 page (f. 569). See no. 56 below.
Sopra i Cortegiani... A sonnet on the courtiers and the Rota, the Papal court. Undated, unsigned. 1 page (f. 570).
Non conviensi a pari vostri... -Olimpia la formara afflitto. Two satirical poems in quatrains. Undated, unsigned. 4 columns on two pages (f. 571).
O Febo tu, che nel morir d'Urbano... A poem in octave stanzas, speculating on the successor to the papacy after Urban VIII's death in 1644. Undated, unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 572-575.
Scenda Musa di Parnaso... A satirical poem in quatrains on the 11 years of Innocent X's papacy. Undated, unsigned (1655). 4 columns on 2 pages (f. 576).
Le Risa di Don Olimpia. A satirical poem on Olimpia Maidalchini. 4 columns on 2 pages (f. 578).
Risposta del Gran Turco alla Lettera dell'Ebreo Manasse. Poem in tercets on the Turkish conquests at the time of Pope Innocent X. Undated and unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 580-583.

Questi nostri Signori Cardinali per temperare la noia... Satirical prose essay suggesting that the cardinals should avoid boredom in a long conclave by negotiating in musical terms. Undated, unsigned. 3 pages, numbered ff. 584-585.
Satira sopra Papa Scarpone. Satirical poem on the death of Innocent X. 8 columns on 4 pages, numbered ff. 586-587.
Abati, Antonio. Pigra e ancor la Nave... Sonnet on the ship of the Argonauts by a satirical poet of the 17th century. Identical with no. 47 above, but with author's name. 1 page (f. 588).
Sopra i Cortegiani... A sonnet on the courtiers and the Rota. Identical with no. 48 above. 1 page (f. 589).
Gazzetta poetica dello Stato Pontifico. Satirical poem in tercets on the conclave of 1655. Undated, unsigned. 6 pages, numbered ff. 590-592.
Pianto di D. Olimpia. Satirical poem, being the lament of Olimpia after the death of Innocent X in 1655. 3 pages, numbered ff. 594-595. Undated, unsigned.

Dialogo fra Pasquino e Marforio. A satirical dialogue between Pasquino and Marforio, making fun of the cardinals. At the end, the mottos of all the cardinals of the Sacred College. Undated, unsigned. 8 columns on 4 pages, numbered ff. 596-597.
Tocca musa il Colascione. Satirical poem in quatrains on all the cardinals under Pope Inncoent X. Undated and unsigned. 10 columns on 5 pages, numbered ff. 598-600.
Paulus Petrus Cardinales. A Latin dialogue on the cardinals after the death of Pope Innocent X. Undated, unsigned (1655). 4-1/2 columns on 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 601-602.
Te Papa negamus... Latin Poem against a Pope. 1 page (f. 603).

Divenuto il Conclave e un Hospitale... Sonnet on the Conclave of 1655, after Innocent X's death, when Alexander VII was elected. Alludes to the sickness that befell many of the cardinals during conclave. 1 page (f. 604).

Al Gran Signor di Turchia... Satirical poem in tercets, referring to an alleged letter written by the Jew Manasse after the death of a Pope (Innocent X?). Undated, unsigned. 6 columns on 3 pages, numbered ff. 605-606.

Gazzetta sopra il Drapello Volante. Satirical poem in quatrains referring to a group of cardinals in the conclave of 1655 called "Squadrone Volante." See Pastor XIV/1, p. 303. 2 columns on 1 page (f. 606v).
Nuova Satira sopra la morte e Governo d'Innocentio X. Satirical poem in quatrains on Innocent X. Undated, unsigned (c. 1655). 4 columns on 2 pages (f. 607).
Torna al canto, o Musa mia. Satirical poem in quatrains, apparently on the reign of Innocent X. 7-1/2 colunms on 4 pages, numbered ff. 608-609.

Discorso sopra 23 cardinali pretendenti al Pontificato. Discourse on the 23 cardinals which were candidates for the Papacy in the conclave of 1655, after the death of Innocent X. 4 pages, numbered ff. 610-611.

(Diary from Jan. 2, 1655 to May 15, 1655). A kind of diary written from January to May 1655, from the illness and death of Pope Innocent X to the conclave in which Alexander VII was elected Pope on April 7 and consecrated on April 28. Written (or copied?) in 2 different contemporary hands. Unsigned. The entry of April 10, 1655, on the election of Alexander VII, has a note saying that it is in the hand of Emilio Ricci. 41 pages, numbered ff. 612-637.
Ristretto o Relatione del Conclave d'Innocentio Decimo, nel quale fu creato...Alessandro Settimo. Report on the conclave of 1655, when Pope Alexander VII was elected. 9 pages, numbered ff. 638-643.
Scrutinii fatti nelle sede vacante 1655. The voting lists of the conclave of 1655, containing the lists from Jan. 20 to Feb. 19. 29 columns on 8 pages, numbered ff. 644-647.

Copia de Lettera scritta da N. ad un suo Amico che sta in Vicenza Sopra sei Cardinali Papabili. Copy of a letter on the six cardinals eligible to the Papacy, with detailed characteristics of them. Includes: Carpegna, Carafa, Bragadino, Sacchetti, Maculano, Ginetti. Only Carafa and Sacchetti came near to election in 1655, none of the others. Undated, unsigned. 14 pages, numbered ff. 648-654.

(Conclave of 1655). Several reports and letters concerning the conclave after Inncoent X's death and the election of Pope Alexander VII. Includes detailed accounts of daily proceedings (dated Jan. 5 to April 10, 1655), letters by outsiders, a historical survey on the duration of previous conclaves (from Sixtus IV to Paul V), a special report on a group of cardinals known as the "Squadrone Volante," etc. 193 pages, numbered ff. 656-758.

Conclave nel quale per morte di Papa Alessandro VIII fu creato sommo Pontefice il Card. Antonio Pignatelli Napolitani col nome di Innocenzo XII. Report on the conclave of 1691 after the death of Alexander VIII when Pope Innocent XII was elected. 19 pages, numbered ff. 777-787.
DOCUMENTS OF PORTUGUESE HISTORY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: pages, numbered ff. 1-322, also a 1 page index. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, middle of the 17th century.

did.unittitle: (Portugal). A report to Rome, possibly by the papal nuncio in Portugal, on the strained relations between Portugal and Rome. Written during the Papacy of Alexander VII (1655-1667), it recapitualtes events from earlier decades. Printed pamphlet, possibly proofs, since there are some corrections in ink. Undated, unsigned. 4 leaves (the last blank, some small holes), numbered ff. 1-4.

(Sousa, Francisco de, Marquis de Minas). Memoriale Presentato alla Santita di Nostro Signore Per il recivimento dello Ambasciatore di Portogallo in questa corte, con la transmissione del Nuntio Apostolico e provision de Vescovi. Copy of a memoir written to Pope Alexander VII by Francisco de Sousa in the name of John IV, King of Portugal, concerning the sending of an ambassador to Rome, the question of episcopal investiture, etc. In 1670, the Count de Sousa became the Portuguese ambassador in Rome. Undated (c. 1656). Title page and 122 pages, numbered ff. 5-66.

(Terranueva, Duke of). A Sua Santita Per l'Ambasciatore di sua Maesta Cattolica contro la pretensione del Re di Portogallo e suo ambasciatore et altro Con la Relatione del Seguito in questa Corte di Roma, 1656. Copy of an answer by the Spanish Ambassador in Rome, the Duke of Terranueva, to Pope Alexander VII, against the memoir of Francisco de Sousa (see above, no. 2). Title page and 70 pages, numbered ff. 167-102.

La Sferza di Portogallo ove si sentono le validissime Raggioni della Maesta Cattolica e Le Usurpationi fatte dal Duca di Braganza nel detto Regno. Copy of a letter to the Duke of Terranueva, then Philip IV's ambassador in Rome, on the usurpation of the Portuguese throne by the Duke of Braganza who became King John IV (1640-1655). Undated, unsigned (c. 1655). 71 pages, numbered ff. 103-139.

Prudentio Lectori candido S.P. A Latin discourse, in the form of a letter, on the state of the Roman Church in Portugal, possibly during the reign of Alfonso VI (1656-1667), with historic references. Undated, unsigned. 363 pages, numbered ff. 141-322.
AMBASSADORIAL REPORTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven manuscript documents, comprising 434 pages, numbered ff. 1-217, also a 1 page index. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: (Apesero, Giovanni d'). Relatione della Corte di Roma... Copy of a report from Rome by Giovanni d'Apesero (?), who was Venetian ambassador at the court of Pope Alexander VII (1644-1676). 64 pages, numbered ff. 1-32.

Delfino, Giovanni, Relatione di Roma...Fatta alla Republica di Venetia Doppo il Suo carico d'Ambasciatore presso N.S. Papa Clemente Ottavo l'anno 1598. Copy of a report to the Venetian senate on Rome by Giovanni Delfino, Venetian Ambassador in Rome at the court of Clement VIII in 1598. Delfino later became the Bishop of Vicenza. Apparently unpublished. 66 pages, numbered ff. 33-65.

Landi, Aluigi. Relation in forma de discorso delle cose del regno di Napoli fatto l'anno 1579. Copy of a report on Naples by the Venetian A. Landi, apparently never published. Dated Naples, April 15, 1579. 48 pages, numbered ff. 67-90.

Relatione delli Stati et Governi di Fiandra del tempo del Rè Filippo. 1578. Copy of a report on Flanders from the time of King Philip II of Spain. At the end, lists of costs of Charles V's entrance into Flanders and the Netherlands. See also Vol. 92, no. 3, for another copy of the same report. 20 pages, numbered ff. 91-99.

Suriano, Michele. Relatione delli Stati del Serenissimo Rè Filippo. Copy of a report on King Philip II of Spain and his possessions in Europe and overseas, by the Venetian ambassador Michele Suriano. Dated 1559. Suriano was also Ambassador to France and to England. While his report from France was published, the relation on Philip II was not. 80 pages, numbered ff. 100-139.

Lippomano, Girolamo. Relatione del Clarissimo signor Girolamo Lippomani ritornato da Napoli Ambasciatore al serenissimo Don Giovanni d'Austria nell'anno 1575, Copy of a report by the Venetian Ambassador from Naples and its Spanish government. Apparently never published. 96 pages, numbered ff. 140-187.

Quirino, Vincenzo. Relatione del Clarissimo Sig. Vincenzo Quirino ritornato Ambasciatore da Filippo d'Austria Rè di Castiglia dell'anno 1504. Copy of a detailed report from the Venetian Ambassador upon his return from Spain and the court of Philip I of Castile, also with a report from the voyages of the Portughese to East India. Apparently never published. 60 pages, numbered ff. 188-217.
AMBASSADORIAL REPORTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four manuscript documents, comprising 338 pages, numbered ff. 1-169. Wormholed at each end, waterstained. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Lippomano, Girolamo. Relationi...nel ritorno di Polonia all'...Senato Venetiano l'anno 1575. Copy of a report by the Venetian ambassador upon his return from Poland. Apparently never published. Index and title page (both badly damaged) and 238 pages of text, numbered ff. 1-118.

Pernisten, Philippus. Relatione delle...Don Filippo Pernisten Imperiale Ambasciatore della Maestà Cesara al Gran Prencipe di Moscovia l'anno MDLXXIX. Report from Russia under Ivan IV by Pernisten, Ambassador of Rudolf II. Dated "Di Lovetio di Polonia, May 27, 1579." This report was published in 1589 in "Thesoro Politico;" it also appeared in Latin and French. 48 pages, numbered ff. 119-142.

Relatione overo Compendio de gli Stati et Governi di Fiandra del Tempo del Re Philippo, 1578. A report on Flanders from the time of Philip II. At the end, lists of costs of Charles II's entrance into Flanders and the Netherlands. 40 pages, numbered ff. 143-162.

Interrogationi fatte à Matteo Ambasciadore del Preste Gian a Papa Paolo Terzo delle Cose pertinente alla Stato Ecclesiastico e cose pie. A curious treatise, allegedly by Matthias, Ambassador of Prester John, on questions of the Church and religion. Interesting in the context of attempts at reform of the Catholic Church by Pope Paul III (1534-1549). Title page and 11 pages, numbered ff. 163-169.
MARCALDI, FRANCESCO. NARRATIONE...DELLA...GENOVA
Marcaldi, Francesco, Narratione dello stato della Republica di Genova. Manuscript of 24 leaves. 4to. Original limp vellum. Naples, 1595.

A fine, calligraphically written manuscript on the Republic of Genoa by Francesco Marcaldi, a 16th century historian from Milan. The manuscript is dedicated to Mutio Carafa and the dedication signed by Marcaldi and dated "In Napoli dell'Anno MDXCIIIII."

Argelati ( Bib. Scriptorum Mediolanensum II , 886 and 2004) lists three historical manuscripts by the author, none about Genoa and none published. However, a relation on Genoa by Marcaldi was published from a 16th century manuscript for the first time in 1881 by I.G. Isola.
The present manuscript is certainly contemporary and might very well be the original. The watermark of the paper ("M" with a star) occurs in Rome, c. 1580 (Heywood 3024 and 3026).
HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 59 manuscript documents on 772 pages, numbered ff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 1-425. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th- 18th century.

did.unittitle: Rohan, Henri Duc de. Dell'Interesse de Principi, e stati delle Christianita. With dedication to Cardinal Richelieu. Italian version of one of the political works by the Duke of Rohan (1579-1638), De l'interest des Prince et Estats de la Christianté , first published in 1638. The Italian version seems not to have been published. Title page and 51 pages, numbered ff. 1-26.

Ancorche si concosa per vera la Instanza del Magistro delle Politiche Nam suadere Principi, quod oporteat multi laboris. Suggestions for necessary economic reforms. Unsigned and undated. 4 pages, numbered ff. 27-28. In Italian.

Report on the attack of the Corsican soldiers , having been provoked, on Villa Farnese, the residence of the French ambassador in Rome, the Duke of Créqui. The attack took place on Aug. 20, 1662, and the report goes on about its diplomatic consequences and Créqui's departure from Rome. (See Pastor XIV/1, p. 369, no. 4). 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 30-34.
Reports and letters concerning the incident of the Corsican soldiers , dated Sept. 23 and 30, and Aug. 19, 1662. 7 pages, numbered ff. 35-38.

Al Cavaliere Pier Antonio Ricci, Fiorenza. Two original letters, addressed to Ricci, concerning negotiations with the French Ambassador in Rome, the Duke of Créqui; one is dated Oct. 14, 1662. 3-1/2 pages and address pages, numbered ff. 29-41.

(Louis XIV, King of France). Reports and letters, dated Sept. 9 and Sept. 16, 1662, concerning the tension between Louis XIV and Pope Alexander VII. Incorporating copies of two letters by Louis XIV: to the Sacro Collegio and to Pope Alexander VII, both dated Aug. 30, 1662. (one of these letters is copied twice). 7 pages, numbered ff. 42-46.
Alexander VII, Pope. Al Carissimo...Lodevico di Francia... Two copies of letters from the Pope to Louis XIV in an effort of reconciliation, dated Aug. 28 and Sept. 10, 1662. 2 pages, numbered ff. 47.
Louis XIV, King of France. Amici Cugini Li Cardinali della S. Romana Chiesa. Copy of a letter of Louis XIV to the Cardinals, dated March 1663. 3 pages, numbered ff. 48-49.

(Louis XIV, King of France). Copy of a letter of apology by the Cardinals to Louis XIV, concerning the incident with the Corsican soldiers of Aug. 20, 1662. Dated Sept. 15, 1662. 2 pages (f. 50). Large folio, folded.

La verita...ne correndti disturbu del Sig. Duca di Criquy Ambasciadore di Francia. A report on the incident with the Corsican soldiers at the residence of the Duke of Créqui, French Ambassador in Rome, and the ensuing diplomatic relations. (See Pastor XIV/1, pp. 368-376). Undated, unsigned. (1662). 16 pages, numbered ff. 52-59.

La contese politiche di D. Mario Chigi e Mons. Creci, Ambasciadore Christianissimo. A dialogue between Mario Chigi (a relative of Pope Alexander VII) and the French Ambassador Créqui, being a political negotiation. Rome was very anxious to pacify Créqui. This dialogue must have taken place in August 1662, as Créqui left Rome in protest in September. Undated and unsigned. 32 pages, numbered ff. 61-76.

Ristretto delle lose occorse nell'Affare della Regalia. An account of the controversy between Pope Innocent XI and Louis XIV concerning the question of the right of Regalia. A protest raised by the Bishops of Pamiers and Aleth following the seizure of their revenues provoked the intervention of the Pope in 1678. Undated and unsigned. 6 pages, numbered ff. 79-81. See Pastor XIV/2, pp. 854-855.

Nanno risugliata la curiosita della Corte di Roma alcuni Brevi scritti da Innocentio XI à Ludovico XIV... A short history, with bibliographical notes, on the custom of the regales (right of the crown to the revenues of vacant bishoprics and abbeys), occasioned by the hostility of Pope Innocent XI and Louis XIV over this question. Undated, unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 83-86.

Innocent XI, Pope. Diliectis filiis Joanni Cerli... Latin breve by the Pope to John Cerlé who had just been elected Vicar of the Bishopric of Pamiers, promising him protection. Dated Jan. 1, 1681. 2 pages (f. 87).
Innocent XI, Pope. Bul. Breve Ludovico. Breve in Latin by the Pope to King Louis XIV concerning the controversy over the regales. Copy, unsigned, undated. (1680). 5 pages, numbered ff. 89-91.
Louis XIV, King of France. Copy of Louis' answer to Pope Innocent XI's Breve of Dec. 27, 1679, which he sent with Cardinal D'Estrées to Rome. Dated July 21, 1680. 1 page (f. 93).

Arresto del Parlamento di Parigi al Breve del... Papa... Copy of the reation of the Parisian Parliament to Pope Innocent XI's Breve of Oct. 15, 1680 concerning the Nuns of Charonne. Dated Dec. 14, 1680 and signed by Dongois. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 94-95.

Estratto da i Registri del Parlamento. Extracts from the minutes of the Parisian Parliament, concerning the controversy over Regales. Dated April 1680 and signed Dongien. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 96-97.

Arresto della Corte del Parlamento... Extract from the acts of the Parisian Parliament in its reaction to the Papal Bull of Oct. 15, 1680, further elaborating on the Bull and prohibiting the possession, reading, selling, or copying of the said bull. Dated Jan. 24, 1681, signed Dongoys. 1 page (f. 98).

Si sono uniti li...Vescovi in Casa di Monsig. Arcivesco di Parigi... Report of the Assembly of the Clergy in Paris, under the Archbishop François Harley, dated March 27, 1681. This assembly sided with Louis XIV and declared that the regale extended over the whole kingdom. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 100-101.
Estrées, Cardinal César de. Latin answer by the Cardinal d'Estrées concerning the question of regales , dated May 31, 1680. 4 pages, numbered ff. 102-103.

Caulet, François Estienne, Bishop of Pamiers. Copy of letter by Caulet to King Louis XIV. Undated, unsigned. Bishop Caulet was opposed to the King in the question of the regale and sided with Rome. 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 104-107.

Lettera scritta da un Curiale di Roma ad un suo Amico in Parigi sotto li 11 Novembre 1680. Copy of a letter concerning the Rome-Paris controversy over the nuns of Charonne and referring to the Arresto del Parlamento di Parigi in the same matter (see above, no. 17). There might be a copyist's error in the date, since the arresto is dated 14 Dec. 1680. The letter is not signed or dated at the end. 23-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 108-119.

(Medici, Giangastone de, Grand Duke of Tuscany). Ragguaglio Del Viaggio dal...Gio. Gastone di Toscana Per la Francia... Relation of a voyage through France, the Netherlands, and Germany by the last Medici, Giangastone (1671-1737), made in 1698 shortly after his marriage. Written by Anton Filippo de Giudici Scalco. Title page and 32 pages, numbered ff. 121-137.

Punti principali da considerarsi nell'Ambasciata dell...Clemente Vitelli... Report on the embassy of Clemente Vitelli, sent by Cosimo III, Grand Duke of Tuscany, to Pope Innocent XII. Dated Aug. 1, 1699. 6 pages, numbered ff. 139-141.

Barberini, Taddeo, Prefect of Rome. Raggione dedotte alla Santita...sopra la Precedenza... An historical account of the office of the prefect of Rome and the hierarchy of ambassadors and princes in ceremonies, given by Taddeo Barberini to Pope Innocent X. Undated. (After 1644). 11 pages, numbered ff. 142-147.
Borja, Cardinale Gaspare. Scrittura presentata in consistoro dal Card. Borgia... Copy of a protest by the Spanish Cardinal Borja against the consistory of 8 March 1632. 5 pages, numbered ff. 148-150.

Este, Cardinal Renaldo d'. Manifesto...sopra li mali portamenti delli Ministri Spagnuoli... Cardinal D'Este's complaint about the bad behavior of the Spanish ambassadors in Rome. Dated Rome, 1645. Title page and 14 pages, numbered ff. 148-159.

Risposta Demonstrativa al discorso in discolpa del Sig. Cardinale Rinaldo D'Este per che fusseandato nel Consistoro nel quale si proposero le Chiese del Regno di Portogallo. Copy of an answer to Cardinal Rinaldo D'Este's complaint of the Spanish ambassadors, going in detail of the the family d'Este and its support of the French. Undated and unsigned. 43 pages, numbered ff. 160-181.

(Francesco I, Duke of Modena). Pretensioni de Duchi di Modena con la Chiesa. A manifest by the Duke of Modena (a brother of Cardinal Rinaldo d'Este), undated and unsigned copy. (c. 1643?). It was printed, with an answer in favor of the Church, in Vittorio Siri's Mercurio , vol. 3, p. 105. 15 pages, numbered ff. 183-190.

(Odoardo Farnese, Duke of Parma). Copy of a letter written by the Duke of Parma to his representatives in Rome, dated Piacenza, Sept. 1, 1635. 6 pages, numbered ff. 192-194. Another copy is in Vol. 95, no. 35.

Carandini. Risposta intercetta del Cav. Carandino Residente al Manifesto del Sig. Duca di Parma. Copy of Carandini's answer to Odoardo Farnese, Duke of Parma. Undated, unsigned. 7 pages, numbered ff. 196-199.

Discorso. Se l'Almirante nella visita del Sacro Collegio doura visitare il Cardinal d'Este, e li Cardinali Grimaldi, è Valenze, e fermar la Carozza incontradoli. Copy of a discourse concerning the ceremonies of the meeting between the Spanish Ambassador Cabrera, Admiral of Castile, and the Cardinals of the French faction. A fight between Cabrera and the Cardinal d'Este in 1646 grew into a famous diplomatic incident. (See Pastor XIV/1, p. 47). Not dated or signed. 9 pages, numbered ff. 201-205.

Risposta al Discorso dell'Almirante. Copy of an answer to the Discourse on Cabrera, Admiral of Castile, who was Spanish Ambassador in Rome at the time of Innocent X. Undated, unsigned, (c. 1646, see above). 13 pages, numbered ff. 207-213.

(Borri, Francesco Giuseppe). Compendium del Processo del Borri. The alchemist and physician Borri was persecuted for his heretical beliefs. Clement VII arrested him in 1670 and the process against him was completed in 1672. Borri recanted and was sentenced to life in prison. Unsigned, undated. 16 pages, numbered ff. 215-222.

Manifesto, che se dice habbia fatto il Governatore di Roma nella causa del Marchese Angelelli... The account of a scandal between the Marquis Angelelli and a Giovanni Valdabrini, in which the Barberini family seems to have been involved. Undated, unsigned. 6 pages, numbered ff. 223-225.

(Odoardo Farnese, Duke of Parma and Pope Urban VIII). A letter concerning hostilities between the Duke of Parma and Pope Urban VIII in the matter of Castro, with references to the Duke's published Relazione on the subject. Undated and unsigned (c. 1642). This letter was published in the first volume (p. 791) of Vittorio Siri's Mercurio . 27 pages, numbered ff. 228-241.
Trovandosi il Principe Matthias (de'Medici) nello Stato di Siena... A report concerning the Duke of Parma's fight for Castro. Undated, unsigned. (c. 1642). 26 pages, numbered ff. 243-255.

(Spada, Giovanni Battista, Governor of Rome). Al Marchese de los Veles. Copy of a letter by Spada to the Spanish Ambassador concerning the Duke of Parma and Castro. Undated, unsigned. 3 pages, numbered ff. 256-257.

Relatione della Valorosa difesa della Pietose Citta di Pistoia dalla furiosa soppresa dell'Armi Barbarine. An account of the defense of Pistoia, another chapter in the War of the Barberini. Undated, unsigned (c. 1640). 8 pages, numbered ff. 258-261.

Raccolta di tutte le concessioni, donationi, et investiture fatte del Ducato d'Urbino in cominciando da Pipino Re di Francia sino al tempi di Pio IV. An account of the donations, concessions, and investitures by the Dukedom of Urbino from the 8th to the 16th centuries. The Brit. Mus. Catalogue lists Memorie istoriche concernenti la devoluzione dello stato di Urbino alla sede Apostolica , Amsterdam, 1723, which might be the published version of this manuscript. 14 pages, numbered ff. 263-269.
Louis XIV, King of France. Copy of a letter by Louis XIV to Cardinal Francesco Barberino, signed and dated Paris, Dec. 22, 1645. 2 pages (f. 271).
Barberini, Cardinal Francesco. Replica. Copy of Barberino's answer to Louis XIV, dated Rome, Jan. 10, 1646. 4-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 272-274.

Barberini, Cardinal Francesco. Lettera lasciata al Sacro Collegio... Copy of Barberini's letter to the Sacred College, left there before fleeing from Rome to France on Jan. 16, 1646, and the Cardinals' answer, dated Jan. 25, 1646. 15 pages, numbered ff. 274-281.

Ragguaglio Di quanto e seguito intorno alla Comprotettione di Francia data al Sig. Card. Antonio Barberino in Sin alli 29 d'Aprile 1634. A report of the protection France gave to the Cardinal Barberini, one of the diplomatic steps in France's increasing hostility towards Rome. Copy, unsigned, dated April 29, 1634. 29 pages, numbered ff. 282-295.

Relatione della fuga SS.ri. Duca e Duchessa di Lorena dal Castello di Nansi ove erano Custoditi dalle Forze Francesci. An account of the flight from Nancy of Charles IV, Duke of Lorraine, in 1634. Undated, unsigned. 24 pages, numbered ff. 296-307.

Relatione dello stato e forze di tutti i Principi d'Italia. A detailed report on the Italian states, their princes, assets, etc. Undated, unsigned. Probably at the beginning of the 17th century. 30 pages, numbered ff. 308-322.

(Ferdinand II, Emperor). Sponte restituta stratagemate captum... Latin panegyric for Ferdinand II after his victories in the 30 Years' War. 8 pages, numbered ff. 324-327. Undated and unsigned, c. 1635.

(Ferdinand II, Emperor). Sommario delli Articoli della Pace tra l'Imperatore et l'Elettore di Sassonia trattata a Pirna e publicata à Praga l'anno 1635. Summary of the negotiations for a separate peace between Emperor Ferdinand II and the Elector John George of Saxony, 1635. 17 pages, numbered ff. 328-336.

(Estampes-Valencay, Henri d'). Relatione della Corte di Roma del Bali di Valencia al novo Ambascitor di Francia. A report by Valençay, French Ambassador in Rome, to his successor. Undated, unsigned (c. 1653). 36 pages, numbered ff. 337-354.

Ragionamento fatto nel Senato Veneto dall'Ambasciadore di Spagna residente in Venetia sopra li correnti affari di guerra. Tensions between the Spanish Ambassador and the Senate of Venice. Undated and unsigned. 9 pages, numbered ff. 355-359.
Pesaro, Giovanni. Dalla relatione...fatta in Venetia tornato dall'Ambasciatura... Report by Pesaro on his embassy in Rome, 1656. 2 pages (f. 361).

Alexander VII, Pope. Dilectiis Filiis Nob. Viris, Bertuccio Valerio Duci et Reipub. Venetiae. Copies of 2 letters of the Pope to Venice concerning the reinstatement of the Jesuits in Venice. Dated 23 Feb., 1656 and 27 Jan., 1657. 4 pages, numbered ff. 362-363.
Copia della resposta della Republica di Venetia alla Santita Alessandro VII. Copy of the answer to the Pope's letter (see preceding number). Undated, unsigned. (1656 or 1657). 1 page (f. 364).

Copie di Lettere scritte dale P. Generale alla Republica...di Venetia. Copies of 2 letters written by the Jesuit General to Venice regarding the reinstatement of the Jesuits there. Unsigned, undated (c. 1657). 2 pages (f. 365).

(Republic of Venice). Copies of three letters: to the French Ambassador Du Plessis, to Louis XIV, and to Cardinal Mazarin, regarding the reinstatement of the Jesuits. All dated Jan. 19, 1657. 2 pages (f. 367).
Relatione della corte di Roma fatta del 1647 in Venetia. Copy of the report from Rome by Alvise Contarini, Venetian Ambassador in Rome under Innocent X. 41 pages, numbered ff. 368-388.

Erizzo. Relatione della Corte di Roma fatta al...Doge et all' Senato Veneto. A detailed report on Rome to the Doge and the Senate of Venice by Erizzo, returning from his embassy in Rome. Dated Oct. 29, 1702. 77 pages, numbered ff. 389-419.

(Ferdinando Carlo, Duke of Mantua). Copy of a letter written in the name of the Duke of Mantua to Leopold I, recommending the Duke to the Emperor, explaining that he is not hostile at all but most loyal. Unsigned and undated (c. 1704). 11 pages, numbered ff. 420-425.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven printed and 29 manuscript pieces, in Italian, Latin, and Spanish, comprising 677 pages, numbered ff. 1-379. 4to (unless otherwise stated). Contemporary vellum (parts of spine missing). Italy, second half of the 17th century.

did.unittitle: Narratione della Segnalata Vittoria ottenuta dall'Armata Olandese sopra l'Inglese, A vista del Porto di Livorno, à 13 di Marzo, 1653. The account of a victory by the Dutch at Livorno during the naval war between Holland and England. 4 leaves. Printed pamphlet. Small 4to. Numbered ff. 1-4. Livorno, 1653.

Ponce de Leon, Rodrigo, Count of Arcos. With woodcuts of the Madonna and Child, the Spanish Royal Arms, and an unidentified coat of arms. Printed leaflet. 2 leaves, folio (holes in upper margin, effecting some letters). Napoli, Camillo Cavallo, 1647. A proclamation by the Count of Arcos, then Viceroy of Naples, during the Masaniello rebellion in Naples. Apparently extremely rare, not in Palau nor the Hisp. Society of America.

Juan d'Austria. Printed broadside (some stains). Folio, folded, numbered ff. 7-8. Dated Jan. 27, 1648. Naples, G.B. Orlandi, 1648. Proclamation by John of Austria, natural son of Philip IV of Spain, during the Masaniello Rebellion. Extremely rare, not in Palau or in the Hisp. Society of America.

Pacelli, Paolo d'Aversa. Oratione... Printed pamphlet. 11 leaves, numbered ff. 9-19. With woodcut of Manzoli's arms on title and fine historiated woodcut initials. Holes in last leaf, with the loss of a word. Small 4to. Naples, G.B. Cappelli, 1583. A eulogistic speech on the occasion of Manzoli having been created Bishop of Aversa in 1581. Not in the catalogues of the BM or BN.

Prevelli, Fra. Costanzo, O.M. Risposta alla Molto Rev. Madre Suor Clara... Printed pamphlet. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 20-23. N.p., n.d. (closely cut at bottom). Dated at the end of the letter Pianasca, Dec. 1, 1647. Not in the catalogues of the BN or BM.
Per gli emergenti di Modono Discorso. Printed anonymous pamphlet on the opposition of Modena to Rome, advising Rome on the best position to take. Undated, around 1653. 10 leaves, numbered ff. 24-33.

Cesi, Cardinal Pietro Donato. Copia di lettera scritta...al Sig. Luigi d'Aro in risposta alla scrittura...publicata dal Sig. Balii di Valenze... dell'anno 1654. Copy of a letter in response to Estampes de Valençay, the French Ambassador in Rome, who had written instructions to Ambassadors. A French translation of Cardinal Cesi's letter was published in Recueil de divers relations , in 1681. For Valency's instructions, see Pastor XIV/1, p. 29, n. 2. Ms. 18 pages, numbered ff. 34-42.

Retz, Cardinal, Archbishop of Paris. Lettera...alli...Arcivescovi, e vescovi delle Chiese di Francia. Copy of a letter written by Cardinal Retz in Rome, where he had just arrived (Nov. 30, 1654) on his flight from France, where Mazarin had him imprisoned. He is protesting here about the violation of his rights. Dated Dec. 14, 1654. A French version of this letter was published in Paris in 1654. Ms. Title and 73 pages, numbered ff. 46-83.

Risposta ad' Alcuni Manifesti é Cartelli pubblicati à nome de Francesci e loro seditioni parteggiani parla sollevatione di Napoli. An answer from Rome to broadsides and pamphlets published by the French siding with the rebellion in Naples. Unsigned and undated, c. 1650. On the last page, a Latin pasquinade on the King of France. 48 pages, numbered ff. 88-112.

Pesaro, Giovanni, Doge of Venice. Extract from Pesaro's relation of an embassy to Pope Alexander VII. The complete relation was published in a collection of Relazioni degli Stati Europaei , Ser. III, vol. 2, in 1856. 3 pages, numbered ff. 114-115. 8vo.

Alexander VII, Pope. Dilectis filiis, nobilibus viris Bertuccio Valerio Duci, et remp. Venetiarum. Copy of a Latin letter of thenks by Pope Alexander VII to the Doge and the Republic of Venice, dated Rome, Jan. 27, 1657. Pastor XIV/1, p. 363, mentions the letter, the original of which is in the Papal Secret Archives. 2 pages (f. 116). 8vo.

Venetias...D. de Plessis Besançon Legato...apud Remp. Venetianum. Copies of three letters in Latin to the French Legate Du Plessis-Besançon in Venice, to Cardinal Mazarin, and to Louis XIV, all possibly written by a Jesuit in Rome, thanking them for the council in the Venetian senate of Jan. 19, 1657, which permitted the return of the Jesuits. All are dated Rome, Jan. 29, 1657. 2 pages (f. 117) 8vo.

Caracciolus, Antonius, Clericus Regularis. A Latin treatise on the history and rules of the Order of the Clerks Regulars, in answer to questions. Undated. Caracciolus published Constitutiones Clericorum Regularium in 1610. Ms. 21 pages, numbered ff. 118-128. Partly damp-stained.

Risposta al Manifesto dell Arciduca Leopoldo...pretende di Justicare la priggionia del Duca di Lorena. A protest against he arrest in 1654 of Charles IV, Duke of Lorraine, by Archduke Leopold William, Governor of the Netherlands. Undated and unsigned manuscript. 6 pages, numbered ff. 130-132.

Trattato sopra La Mossa dell'Arme Fra Urbano VIII, e li Prencipi d'Italia per Le pretentioni d'Ambe Le parti sopra Castro... A comprehensive and richly documented treatise on the War for Castro between Rome under Urban VIII and the Italian states, apparently written before peace was made in 1644. This treatise seems not to be known to Pastor (XIII/2, pp. 863-875) and was apparently never published. Title, table of contents, and 119 pages, numbered ff. 134-195.

Marchesi, Francesco Elio. Additiones ad Libellum F.E. Marchesii Andreas Bolutius utriusque Juris Doctor. Additions to a genealogical work by Marchesi, a Neapolitan, of which no printed edition exists. The additions by Andreas Bolutius are present in a quick draft and in a clean copy. Altogether 10 pages, numbered ff. 196-202.

Piscicello, Alfonso. Lettera all...Marchese d'Oriolo del conso supremo di sua Maesta Cattolica. A letter on the history of the nobility on Naples and of one of Philip IV's councillors there. 4 pages, numbered ff. 203-204. Undated and unsigned.

Philip IV, King of Spain. Lettera scritta... responsiva al Breve di...Alessandro settimo... transferita da Spagnolo in Italiano. Copy of a letter of Philip IV, written in response to a Breve of Pope Alexander VII. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 207-208.

Philip IV, King of Spain. Magnificis...viris fidelibus...nostre fidelissime Civitatis Neapolis. Copy of a letter in Spanish by Philip IV to his Neapolitan subjects. Dated Madrid, March 11, 1655. 2 pages (f. 209).
Il 16 di Giugno 1656. Fatto consiglio il Sig. Duca di Modena... Apparently a military pact between Milan, Modena, etc., dated 1656. 3 pages, numbered ff. 211-212.

Testamento fatto dalle fortezza di Valenza per la Sua Caduta in mano del Serenissimo di Modena. Testament made by the Fortress of Valenza when it fell into the hands of the Duke of Modena. Dated Nov. 5, 1656. 9 pages, numbered ff. 213-217.

Richelieu, Jean Armand Du Plessis de, Cardinal. Vite sinopsis inscribendo Tumolo. A Latin synopsis of Cardinal Richelieu's life, to be written on his tomb. It appeared in print, without place and date, shortly after Richelieu's death in 1642. (See Cat. of the BM). 6 pages, numbered ff. 219-221.
(Rodolfo, Cardinal Ottavio). Fr. Nicholas Rodolfo Florentino Ottavii... Latin panegyric on the death of Cardinal Rodolfo in 1650. 2 pages (f. 222).
Adorni. A genealogy of the noble Genoese family Adorno. With a genealogical table, dated Bologna, 1597. 6 pages, numbered ff. 223-229.
Bolognino. Trattato della Famiglia Bologninos. A genealogy of this noble Italian family, with a genealogical table, dated Bologna, 1597. 6 pages, numbered ff. 231-235.

(Florence. Criminal Law). Copia della risposta... estrattione de pretensi sicarii di Fiorenza. Copy of a treatise on Criminal Law, dealing with the problem of ecclesiastical or worldly authorities; written in answer (?) to an edict by Ferdinand II de'Medici, Grand Duke of Tuscany. Unsigned, undated. Damp stained on top, effecting the heading of the first leaf. 40 pages, numbered ff. 239-256.

Louis XIII, King of France. Forma della Gratia Concessa del Rè a'suoi Sudditi della Rocella. Sopra il Perdono da essi domandato à S.M. intorno alla loro Ribellione. Printed pamphlet, dated Oct. 28, 1628. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 259-262. Small 8vo. Louis XIII's pardon of the rebellion of the Huguenots in La Rochelle. Very rare. Not in the catalogues of the BN or BM.

(Florence. Criminal Law). Copia d'una Lettera intorno all'estrattione de i Sicarii di Fiorenza. Copy of a letter on criminals in Florence. Undated and unsigned. Answer to this letter, see no. 26 above. 18 pages, numbered ff. 263-271.

(Florence. Criminal law). Copia della risposta data ad una fra'intorno all'estrattione de pretensi Sicarii di Fiorenza. Copy of the answer to the previous item (no. 29); identical with no. 26, a cleaner and more legible copy. 42 pages, numbered ff. 276-296.
(Florence. Criminal law). Copia d'una lettera intorno all'estrattione de i Sicarii di Fiorenza. Another copy of no. 28. 15 pages, numbered ff. 297- 304.
Alfonso II d'Este, Duke of Ferrara. Copy of a pact between the Dukes of Mantua, Parma, and Ferrara, dated, June 27, 1593. 3 pages, numbered ff. 307-308.

Informatione del Regno di Polonia. A report on Poland, unsigned and undated. Possibly written by the Nuncio Caligari or by his successor Bolognetti, between 1580 and 1590. 15 pages, numbered ff. 309- 316.

Ruggieri, Giulio. Della relatione di Mons. Ruggieri stato Nuntio al Re di Polonia l'anno 1568. Ruggieri, Nuncio in Poland, sent this detailed report on Poland to Pope Pius V, giving an interesting account of the political, economic, and religious status of the country. See Pastor VIII, p. 502, n. 4 listing other ms. copies of this report. 48 pages, numbered ff. 317-341.

Viaggio di Venetia à Cracouia per Terra. An interesting list of distances between Cracow and Venice, possibly compiled by or for Ruggieri (see above item) or any other nuncio in Poland. The distances from stop to stop are given, along with alternate routes. Travel by waterways is not recommended as being too cold. 5 pages, narrow 4to, between f. 342 and 343.

(Odoardo Farnese, Duke of Parma). Copia della Lettera scritta dal serenissimo de Parma al Sig. Cavaliere Carandini suo Residente in Roma. Copy of a letter of instruction by the Duke of Parma to his representative in Rome, signed and dated Piacenza, Sept. 1635. 6 pages, numbered ff. 343-345.

Grandes de España. Detailed statistics of the government of Spain under the reign of Philip IV (1621-1665), including the royal households, government agencies, the nobility and clergy, the knights of the Order of the Golden Fleece, the army and navy, the Viceroys in Spain and Portugal, Italy, and the colonial possessions in the East and West Indies. In Spanish. 64 pages, numbered ff. 347-379.
HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 12 manuscript documents in a calligraphic hand,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: comprising 610 pages, numbered ff. 1-307. 4to. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Commendone, Giovanni Francesco, Bishop of Zante. Discorso sopra la Corte di Roma...poi Car.li. da Papa Pio Quarto. A 17th century ms. copy of a discourse on the state of the Papal court, written c. 1564, when Commendone returned from the Council of Trent. Pastor (VII, pp. 327-332) devotes a long appreciation to this discourse and lists all known ms. copies (pp. 661-663). The present ms. seems to be the only one to mention Pope Pius IV (1559-1565), thereby confirming Pastor's tentative date of 1564. 223 pages, numbered ff. 1-112.

Pace facta fra il Re Filippo et il Re Henrico del anno 1559. Account of the peace between Philip II of Spain and Henri II of France, with a copy of the Peace Treaty of Chateau-Cambrésis. 82 pages, numbered ff. 113-153.

Foscari, Marco. Relatione...nell'Illustrissimo et Ecclesiastissimo Consiglio dipregadi di Venetia della legatione di Firenze. A detailed account of Florence by Foscari, the Venetian legate under Pope Clement VII (1523-1534). 84 pages, numbered ff. 154-195. Wormholes in blank margin of last leaves.

(Bongiovanni, Bernardo, Bishop of Camerino, Nuncio in Poland). Relatione del Re di Polonia, et suoi stati. Report on Sigismund II King of Poland and the state of Poland, probably written by Bongiovanni, Papal nuncio in Poland 1560-1563. Includes copy of a Latin document. 34 pages, numbered ff. 196-212.
Quale Pontifex Maximus in ure Regis Eligendi deliberatione... Document in Latin, apparently concerning the election of Henri de Valois as King of Poland in 1572. 36 pages, numbered ff. 213-230.

Sigismund II August, King of Poland. Copies of 3 letters in Latin, written by the King of Poland to the Papal Nuncio in Poland, Bernardo Bongiovanni, dated Vilnia, March 6, 1562, Oct. 27, 1561, and Aug. 2, 1562. 9 pages, numbered ff. 231-235.
Catharina, Queen of Poland. Wife of Sigismund August. Copy of a letter to Bernardo Bongiovanni, Nuncio in Poland, dated Grodno, Feb. 22, 1563. In Latin. 2 pages, numbered ff. 235-236.

(Henri of Valois, King of Poland). Forma coronationis Serenissimi Regis Poloniae in sede Sancti Stanislai Cracoviae fatte XXI Februarii 1574. Copy of the coronation rites, in Latin, at the coronation of Henri de Valois as the King of Poland. 7 pages, numbered ff. 237-240.

Malatesta, Giacomo. Perche mentre Io Giacomo Malatesta ero prigione de Turchi... A report on the Turks, from a prisoner, who used the occasion of his imprisonment for observation. 32 pages, numbered ff. 241-256.
Esito della depositoria... A list of moneys paid to Cardinal Borromeo, Cardinal Montepulciano, and to the College of the Archives, etc., 1 page (f. 257).
Successo del Principe di Salerno. On the controversies concerning the new prince of Salerno, c. 1552, referring to the role of Ascanio Colonna, etc. 52 pages, numbered ff. 258-283.

Oratio de bello contra Venetos indicendo coram Serenissimo Maximiliano Ces. in conventu Auguste Vindeliciorum Anno Dni. MDX. Speech on the war against Venice at the Augsburg Diet of 1510, in Latin. 48 pages, numbered ff. 284-307. Apparently the last page is missing.
POLITICAL DOCUMENTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five manuscript documents (and table of contents), comprising 649 pages, numbered ff. 1-331. Some browning throughout. Large 4to. Contemporary vellum. Italy, c. 1625.

did.unittitle: Cueva, Alfonso de la, Marques de Bedmar. Relatione del Governo della Serenissima Republica di Venetia, fatta dal Marchese di Bedmar, hoggi Cardinale de la Cueva. This political report on Venice was written by Alfonso de la Cueva after 1619 when he became Cardinal and before 1629, when he was named Archbishop of Oviedo. This contemporary ms. copy has the title set with a fine armorial pen drawing. Title and 341 pages, numbered ff. 1-172. Holes in blank upper margin of first 11 leaves.

Cueva, Alfonso de la, Marques de Bedmar. Instruttione...à D. Luigi Bravo suo successore, circa il modo còl quale si dourà governare nella sua Ambasciaria appresso le Republica di Venetia. Copy of the instructions of Cueva, Spanish Ambassador in Venice, to his successor Don Luigi Bravo. With calligraphically written title, with flourishes and floral ornaments. Undated. Title and 57 pages, numbered ff. 172-202.
In L. Banck's Bizzarrie politiche , 1658, an Instruzzione secreta data...à Luis Brava is published, which might be the same or similar to the present text. See Brit. Mus. Cat., under "Cueva."

Cueva, Alfonso de la, Marquis de Bedmar. Relatione di Venetia fatta da D. Alfonso de la Cueva...già Ambasciadore per la Maestà Catholica presso detta Republica hoggi Cardinale di Santa Chiesa. Calligraphically written contemporary copy of a report on Venice by Cueva, who had been sent to Venice as an Ambassador of King Philip III of Spain.

The report was probably done between 1619 (when Cueva became cardinal) and 1621 (when Philip III died). It contains a detailed account of the geography of Venice and its environs, its government, people, customs, and diplomatic relations. 75 pages, numbered ff. 203-240.

Discorso sopra le ragioni della Resolutione fatta in Valtellina contro la tiranide de Grisoni et heretici Al Rè di Spagna D. Filippo Terzo si mostra l'ingiusta usurpatione di essa Valle le giuste ragioni della presente guerra di principi collegati et molte altre cose... A famous discourse, in the form of a letter addressed to Philip III of Spain (d. 1621) on the question of the Veltlin valley in Switzerland, with the text of the "ragioni," which was printed in Venice (in 1624? see the Brit. Mus. Cat. under Valtellino).
The present manuscript includes the printer's preface to the reader, and might be a contemporary copy from the printed edition. Title and 120 pages, numbered ff. 243-303.

Cause Perle' quali la Santita di Papa Gregorio XV. levasse la Nuntiatura di Spagna à Monsig. di Sangro.. et abusi in tempo di Mons. di Massimi. Manuscript on the reasons why Pope Gregory XV recalled Alessandro di Sangro from Spain and named Innocenzo di Massimi as new nuncio to Spain on June 24, 1622. Title and 52 pages, numbered ff. 305-331.
DIPLOMATIC REPORTS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Six manuscript documents and index, comprising 516 pages, numbered ff. 1-235. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, first half of the 17th century.

did.unittitle: Moro, Leonardo. Relatione dell Governo è cose di Spagna. Fatta dal...Leonatrdo Moro nel ritorno della sua Amb.ria. in Venezia. A detailed intelligence report on Spain under Philip IV, written in or about 1628. Containes sections on incomes, costs, military power, government, the King, and diplomatic relations with European nations and princes. Includes chapters on imports from the East Indies and the Americas (ff. 32 seq.). 204 pages, numbered ff. 2-103.

Instruttione à Monsig. Accorambono Vesc. di Fossombrone destinato Collet. nel Regno di Portogallo dalla santita di N.S. Papa Paolo V. Pope Paul V's instructions to Ottavio Accoramboni, sent to Portugal as Nuncio in June 1614. Dated Rome, June 1, 1614. See Pastor XII, p. 233. 31 pages, numbered ff. 104- 119.

Instruttione à Mons. Corsini Arciv. di Tarsi... destinato da N.S. Nuntio ordinario nel Reame di Francio dell anno della Creatione di Papa Gregorio XV. Copy of the instructions given in 1621 to Ottavio Corsini, Nuncio in France; treating among others the problem of the Veltlin. See Pastor XIII/1, p. 155. 47 pages, numbered ff. 122-145.

Instruttione à V.S. Monsig. Caraffa Vescovo d'Aversa destinato Nuntio ordinario di Nostro Signore in Germania appresso la Maesta di Ferdinando Secondo Imperatore. Copy of the instructions to Carlo Carafa, when he was sent as Papal Nuncio to Germany, dated Rome, April 12, 1621. See Pastor XIII/1, p. 175-177. 70 pages, numbered ff. 146-181.

Instruttione a Monsig. Sacchetti Vescovo d'Gravina Nuntio appo la Maesta Cattolica. Copy of the instructions to Giulio Sacchetti, who was sent as Nuncio to Spain, January, 1624. See Pastor XIII/1, p. 273. 117 pages, numbered ff. 163-211.

Instruttione a V.S. Monsig. di Bagni Arciv. di Patras Nuntio ordinario di Nostro Sig. in Fiandra. Copy of the instructions given to Giovan Francesco Guido del Bagno, when he was sent as Nuncio to Flanders, dated Rome, May 1, 1621. See Pastor XIII/1, p. 174. 46 pages, numbered ff. 213-235.
AGUCCHI, GIOVANNI BATTISTA PRIMO LIBRO...

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Agucchi, Giovanni Battista, Primo Libro dell'Instruttioni. 14 manuscript documents in Italian. Calligraphic script with some ornate titles (iron gal decay on a few of the larger initials). 245 numbered leaves, plus a loose 1 leaf index. Large 4to. Rome, c. 1621.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Giovanni Battista Agucchi was Secretary to Cardinal Ludovico Ludovisi from 1620-1622. In 1622, he was named Archbishop of Amalfi and Nuncio to Venice by Pope Urban VIII.

did.unittitle: Instruttione à Mons. de Massini Vescovo di Bertinoro Nuntio di Toscana. Instructions to the Nuncio to Tuscany. Dated 25 March, 1621. 11 pages, numbered ff. 1-6.
Instruttione à Mons. Panfilio Auditore di Rota Nintio à Napoli. Instructions to the Nuncio to Naples. Dated 26 March, 1621. 16 pages, numbered ff. 7-14.
Instruttione à Mons. di Sangro Patriarca d'Alessandria Nuntio in Spagna. Instructions to the Papal Nuncio in Spain. Dated Rome, 5 April, 1621. 39 pages, numbered ff. 15-34.
Instruttione a Monsig. Carafa Vescovo d'Auersa Nuntio all'Imperatore. Instructions for the Papal Nuncio in the Empire. Dated Rome, 12 April, 1621. 43 pages, numbered ff. 35-66.
Instruttione a Mons. Donozzetti Arcivescovo di Seleucia li Legato di Avignone. Dated Rome, 13 April, 1621. 13 pages, numbered ff. 67-73.
Instruttione à Mons. Corsini Arcivescovo di Tarsi Nuntio in Francia. Instructions to the Papal Nuncio in France. Dated Rome, 14 April, 1621. 56 pages, numbered ff. 75-103.
Instruttione a Mons. di Bagno Arcivescovo di Patras Nuntio in Fiandra. Instructions to the Papal Nuncio in Flanders. Dated Rome, 1 May, 1621. 36 pages, numbered ff. 105-123.
Instruttione a Mons. Scappi Vescovo di Campagna Nuntio Ordinario alli Suizzeri. Instructions to the Papal Nuncio in Switzerland. Dated Rome, 12 May, 1621. 37 pages, numbered ff. 125-144.
Instruttione a Mons. de Torres Arcivescovo di Andrinopoli Nuntio in Polonia. Instructions for the Papal Nuncio in Poland. Dated Rome, 30 May, 1621. 48 pages, numbered ff. 145-169.
Instruttione a Mons. Zacchia Vescovo di Montefiascone Nuntio di Venetia. Instructions to the Papal Nuncio in Venice. Dated Rome, 1 July 1621. 41 pages, numbered ff. 171-192.
Instruttione Al Sig. Don Pietro Aldobrandini Luogotenenti Generale in Germania. Dated Rome, 1 May 1621. 8 pages, numbered ff. 193-196.
Instruttione al Sig. Matteo Pini Pagatore e Collaterale in Germania. Dated Rome, 1 June, 1621. 6 pages, numbered ff. 197-199.

Instruttione al Pre. Don Tobia Corona per andare al Re di Francia et al Sig. Duca di Savoia per l'impresa di Gineura. Copy of a letter in reply to demands of the King of France and the Duke of Savoy. Dated Rome, 16 July, 1621. 46 pages, numbered ff. 201-223.
Instruttione a Mons. Montorio Vescovo di Nicastro Nuntio in Colonia. Instructions for the Papal Nuncio in Cologne. Dated Rome, 31 July, 1621. 42 pages, numbered ff. 224-245.dir
MEMORIE ISTORICHE

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memorie Istoriche, cioe de Fatti piu notabili succeduti dall Anno 1708 sino al 1709 (1709-1711) tra la corte di Roma, Vienna, e Barcellona. Manuscript in 2 volumes. 10 leaves index, 299 ff. plus 20 printed documents; 357 ff., 2 leaves index. 2 vols. Folio. Contemporary (18th century) vellum. Rome, first half of the 18th century. Includes Volume 100.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A detailed and authentic history of the Roman Church under Pope Clement XI at the time of the War of the Spanish Succession, comprising the years 1707-1711. The Historical Memoirs were evidently written soon after the events by someone who was close to the policy makers and had access to all the documents. The Memoirs are interwoven with copies from manuscript documents, decrees, and letters by the leading personalities of worldly and ecclesiastical powers. The volumes start with the bitter feud between Pope Clement XI and Joseph I in 1707-1708 and end with Joseph I's death and the election of Charles VI.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: There is a great emphasis placed on the role of Anniballi Albani, nephew of Pope Clement XI. The first volume ends with his departure from Rome for Vienna, the second volume with his being created Cardinal on Dec. 23, 1711. The author of these memoirs might be a secretary of Albani or someone near to him.

did.unittitle: Memorie Istoriche , volume one

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A list of printed documents bound with volume one of the Memorie Istoriche follows. No. 1 is bound between leaves 8 and 9, and the others are bound at the end. All are in mint condition (except where noted), and all are printed in Rome at the Camera Apostolica.

list.item: (Clement XI, Pope). Declaratio Nullitatis cuiusdam Concordiae...quas Milites Germani in Ducatis Parmae et Placentiae locarunt... 12 pages. With woodcuts of the papal arms and the figures of Sts. Peter and Paul. Signed by Fabio Olivieri and dated July 27, 1707. See Pastor XV, p. 35. Small 4to. Rome, 1707.
Spinola, Cardinal Giovanni Battista, Camerlengo. Editto per. l'Assegna de l'Entrate. Broadside. With woodcuts of Papal and cardinals' arms at top. Dated July 10, 1708. Folio, folded. Rome, 1708.

Spinola, Cardinal Giovanni Battista, Camerlengo. Innovazione, e Dichiarazione dell'Editto per Assegna dell'Entrate. Broadside, with three woodcuts of Papal and cardinals' arms at top. Dated Rome, Aug. 8, 1708. Folio, folded.

(Bentivoglio, Cornelio, Commisario Gen.). Capitoli, e Leggi Da Osservarsi per ordine espresso della Santità di nostro signore dagl'Uffiziali, e Soldati...e di Fanteria dell'Armamento fatto nelle presenti emergenze. 4 leaves, with woodcut of Papal arms on title. Dated Rome, Aug. 24, 1708. Small 4to.

(Clement XI, Pope). Istruzione per Li Signori Cardinali Legati e Prelati Governatori...A stabilire, e ripartire la contribuzione imposta per le corrneti emergenze. 8 leaves (the last blank). With woodcut of the Papal arms on title. Dated Rome, Aug. 26, 1708. Folio.

Spinola, Cardinal Giovanni Battista, Camerlengo. Dichiaratione, e Proroga Degli Editti sopra l'Assegne dell'Entrate. Broadside, with three woodcuts of the Papal and cardinals' arms at top. Dated Rome, Aug. 29, 1708. Folio, folded.

Aste, Giuseppe, Decano della Camera e Presidente della Zeccha. Essendo pur troppo necessario delle presenti note contingenze, di far battere molta quantità di moneta... Dated Rome, July 9, 1708. Oblong folio, folded. Slightly browned.

(Aste, Giuseppe). Notificazione. Essendosi riconosciuto, she il portar l'Argenti in Zecca à tenore d'altra Notificazione publicato sotto li 9... Broadside. Dated Rome, July 15, 1708. Oblong folio, folded. Slightly browned.
(Aste, Giuseppe?). Notificazione. Vuole Sua Beatitudine accertare ogni uno, que acquisterà i luoghi del nuovo Monte vacabile Difesa... Broadside. Dated Rome, Aug. 29, 1708. Oblong folio, folded.
(Aste, Giuseppe?). Notofocazione. Essendosi dalla Santita di Nostro Signore con suo chirografo diretto a Monsig. Tesoriere... Broadside. Dated Rome, Aug. 24, 1708. Oblong folio, folded.
Patrizi, Giovanni, Archbishop of Seleucia, Tesoriere Generale. Editto sopra le Monete di Argento. With woodcut arms on top. Broadside, dated Rome, Sept. 2, 1708. Folio, folded.
Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare. Notificazione d'Indulgenza Plenaria. Broadside, with woodcuts of the Papal arms and the figures of Sts. Peter and Paul on top. Dated Rome, April 20, 1708. Folio, folded.
Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare. Notificazione d'Indulgenze. Broadside, with woodcuts of the Papal arms and the figures of Sts. Pater and Paul on top. Dated Rome, Aug. 15, 1708. Folio, folded.

(Clement XI, Pope). Notificazione. Si notifica à tutti gli Offiziali, e Soldati delle Milizie Pontificie...Distribuzione delle Chiese, e Compagnie, ò Quartieri. Broadside, with woodcut of the Papal arms on top. Folio, folded. Small tear mended, without loss of text; slightly browned. Rome, 1708.

Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare, Vicario Generale. Notificazione du una solenne Processione...per implorare il Divino aiuto nelle presenti necessità... Broadside, with woodcuts of the Papal arms and the figures of Sts. Peter and Paul on top. Dated Rome, Dec. 30, 1708. Folio, folded. With a few light stains at bottom.

Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare, Vicario Generale. Editto. Dovendosi fare Mercordi prossimo due dell'entrante Mese una solenne Processione... Broadside, with woodcut of Papal arms on top. Dated Rome, Dec. 30, 1708. Folio, folded. Slight break in fold.
