(Clement XI, Pope). De Mandato Sanctissimi Domini Nostri Papae. Feria 4 die 2 currentis Mensis Ianuarii...erit solemnis Supplicatio universi Cleri.. Signed by Candidus Cassina Magister Ceremonarium. Broadside. Small folio. N.p., n.d. (Rome, 1709).

Litaniae et preces Recitandae Ad Divinuam opem in praesentibus necessitatibus implorandam. 4 leaves. With woodcuts of Papal arms and the figures of Sts. Peter and Paul on title. Small 4to. Rome, 1708.

Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare, Vicario Generale. Proroga dell'Indulgenza in forma di Giubileo... Broadside. With woodcuts of the Papal arms and the figures of Sts. Peter and Paul on top. Dated Jan. 7, 1709. Folio, folded.

Patrizi, Giovanni, Arcivescovo di Seleucia e Tresoriere Generale. Notificazione Sopra il Monte Difesa Vacabile. Broadside, with woodcut of Cardinal's arms on top. Dated Rome, Dec. 23, 1709. Folio, folded.

did.unittitle: Memorie Istoriche , volume two
LETTERS

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three collections of letters of the 16th and 17th centuries, copied in the 17th century. 789 unnumbered pages. Folio. Contemporary limp vellum. (Italy, 17th century).

did.unittitle: (Commendone, Cardinal Giovanni Francesco). Registro di suo Nuntio di Polonia dell'anno 1563 (-1565). Al Cardinale Borromeo. The record of Giovanni Francesco Commendone's (1524-1584) work as Nuncio in Poland from 1563-1565. Commendone is credited with having laid the foundation for a Catholic reformation in Poland. This record, addressed to Cardinal Carlo Borromeo, is probably a copy from the original manuscript by Antonio Maria Graziani, Commendone's secretary in Poland and, later, his biographer. See Pastor VII, p. 390. 149 unnumbered pages.

(Caetani, Camillo, Patriarch of Alexandria). Lettere scritte da Roma a Monsig. Patriarca Caetano Nuntio in Germania (and Spagna) sotto il Pontificato... Copies of c. 140 letters to Nuncio Caetani, covering his nunciature in Germany (till the end of 1592) and in Spain (1593-1600). The letters, dated from August 1591 to January 1597, are letters of news in Rome and from the nunciatures in other countries, and of instruction. Included are a few letters to others: Pietro Aldobrandi, Conzio Aldobrandi, Mons. Azelio. 629 unnumbered pages.

(Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico). Residuo di Lettere di Mons. Agucchia. Contains copies of three letters, being the balance of the collection of letters by Cardinal Ludovisi and his secretary Giovanni Battista Agucchi (see Volume 102): Letter by Ludovisi to Cardinal Deferigo Borromeo, covering the Bull of Pope Gregory XV on the reform of Papal elections, dated Rome, Oct. 1621. Also an undated letter by Ludovisi to Cardinal Decio Carafa and the latter's response. 11 unnumbered pages.
LETTERS AND DIPLOMATIC DOCUMENTS
did.physdesc: 17 manuscript items and collections of letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: comprising c. 570 unnumbered pages. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy (mostly Rome and Venice), c. 1621-1639.

did.unittitle: Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico and Ottavio Corsini. Copia delle Lettere scritte dal Sig. Cardinale Ludovisio à Mons. l'Arcivescovo di Tarsi Nuntio...in Francia. Copy of the correspondence between Cardinal Ludovisi and Ottavio Corsini, the Nuncio in France, dated Oct. 20, 1621 to Sept. 5, 1622. (A French edition of the letter by Ludovisi to Corsini was published in 1623.) 48 unnumbered pages.
Gregory XV, Pope. Al Re Cattolico. Copy of a letter by Pope Gregory XV to Philip III, King of Spain, dated Rome, March 5, 1621. 8 unnumbered pages.

(Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico?). Al Re Cattolico. -Alla Regina di Spagna. -Al Sig. Card. Infante. -Al Sig. Conte di Benevento. -A D. Baldassare di Zuniga. Copies of letters to Philip IV of Spain, his family, and his statemen, all dated May 10, 1621. This was apparently the first communication by Cardinal Ludovisi to the Spanish Court since Philip IV's succession to the Spanish throne on March 31, 1621. 6 unnumbered pages.

Attinenti alla Guerra di Germania , et alla translatione della voce elettorale del Palatinato nel Duca di Baviera. Copies of letters in reference to the Thirty Years' War, written by Ludovisi and Gregory XV, over a period from May 17, 1621-Oct. 3, 1622. 80 unnumbered pages. 20 letters.

Attinenti Alla guerra della Valtellina, & alla controversia tra Spagnuoli, e Venetiani, sopra il passo della Strada. Copies of 24 letters from Rome, probably written by Cardinal Ludovisi or his secretary G.B. Agucchi concerning the controversy over the Veltlin valley (Valtelline) in Switzerland. Dated Rome, March 6, 1621-Sept. 3, 1622. 80-1/2 unnumbered pages.

Attinenti alla giurisditione Ecclesiastica Detentione del Cardinale di Lerma e Giurisditione Ambrosiana. Copies of 9 letters written from Rome, probably by Cardinal Ludovoso concerning the fall of the Duke of Lerma. Dated Sept. 9, 1621-March 22, 1622. 34 unnumbered pages.

Attinenti alle...cose di Fiandra. Raccomandationi & altra diversi Affari & Uffitii. Copies of 34 letters, written from Rome, probably by Cardinal Ludovisi, concerning Flanders and various other matters. Dated from June 19, 1621-April 5, 1623. 61 unnumbered pages.
Gregory XV, Pope. To Philip IV, King of Spain. Letter, dated Rome, April 6, 1623. 1 unnumbered page.
(Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico). Letter to Cardinal Frederigo Borromeo, undated. 9 unnumbered pages.
(Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico). Letter to Cardinal François de Sourdis, dated April 29, 1622. 2 unnumbered pages.

(Ludovisi, Cardinal Ludovico). Al Duca d'Urbino. Letter written in the name of the Sacro Collegio de Cardinale, on occasion of the death of the Duke of Urbino's son. Dated Rome, July 12, 1623. 2-1/2 unnumbered pages.

Agucchi, Giovanni Battista. Nuncio in Venice. Attinenti alla Creatione d'Urbano VIII & altri affari concernenti alla Nuntiatura di Venetia. Letters written by Agucchi on the election of Urban VIII and other matters. 17 letters, dated Aug. 12, 1623-Jan. 8, 1628. 52 unnumbered pages.

(Agucchi, Giovanni Battista). Attinenti alla guerra di Mantua. Letters written by G.B. Agucchi, Nuncio in Venice, about the Mantua War. 8 letters, dated from Oct. 10 to Nov. 17, 1629, with detailed account of the War of Succession in Mantua. 59 unnumbered pages.

(Agucchi, Giovanni Battista). Lettere di congratulaione à nome proprio nella Promotione fatta da Papa Urbino Ottavo. Seven letters of congratulations, mostly to cardinals newly nominated by Urban VIII on Jan. 19, 1626, written by Agucchi and dated Jan. 22, resp. Jan. 24, 1626. The addressees are: Cardinal Barberini, Taddeo Barberini, Berlinghiero Gessi, Laudivio Zacchia, Luigi Caetani, Giulio Sacchetti, and Bernardino Spada. 9 unnumbered pages.

(Agucchi, Giovanni Battista). Lettere di Buone Feste scritte a nome proprio. 8 copies of letters of Christmas greetings written by Agucchi, as Nuncio of Venice, to the following: Cardinal di Savoia, Cardinal Francesco Barberini (2), Taddeo Barberini, Cardinal Antonio Barberini di Sant Onofrio, Cardinal Lorenzo Magalotti (2), Mons. Giovanni Ciampoli; the letters are dated Dec. 1623-Dec. 1626. 7 unnumbered pages.

Salvetti, Domenico. Breve Relatione delle difficolta fra potesti nel raddunare il Congresso in Colonia Avanti...Cardinale Ginetti... 1637-1639. Contemporary document on the difficulties of the Peace Congress in Cologne to which Pope Urban VIII had sent Cardinal Marzio Ginetti as his delegate in a vain effort to achieve peace. Includes two letters in Latin by Emperor Ferdinand III. Title page and 94 unnumbered pages. For other ms. copies of the same account, see Pastor XIII/1, p. 489.

(Agucchi, Giovanni Battista). Copia d'una Lettera del Nuncio di Venetia al Sig. Card. Ludovisi. Copies of 8 letters by the Nuncio in Venice, Agucchi, written between 1622-1632, and including a copy of an answering letter by Cardinal Ludovisi. The addressees are: Cardinal Ludovisi, Cardinal Sacchetti, Cardinal Barberini (4), Alessandro de Sangro, Nuncio in Spain, and Cardinal Lorenzo Magalotti. 26 unnumbered pages.
DOCUMENTS PERTAINING TO THE PAPACY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: manuscript pieces and 2 printed broadsides. Light damp stains in one piece. Folio. Contemporary vellum. Italy, 17th century.

did.unittitle: Index. 1 page.

Modus eligendi Pontifices ab electione Beati Petri usque ad haec tempora. Excerpts from a Latin treatise on ways to elect the Pope, giving an historical essay from earliest Christian times to the 17th century. 121 pages, numbered ff. 1-61.

Rapiccioli, Cardinal Francesco. Conclave delle Sede Vacante d'Urbane VIII nel quale e stato elettion Sommo Pontifice il Cardinale G.B. Panfilio detto Innocentio Decimo creato li 15 Settembre 1644. A detailed account in Italian of the Conclave of 1644 when Panfilio was elected Pope Innocent X, written by Cardinal Rapaccioli, one of the voting cardinals.

Pastor devotes pp. 15-22 (Vol. XIV/1) to this important conclave but does not mention Rapccioli's account, which was apparently never published. 2 parts. 155 pages, numbered ff. 1-78 (and with the folios of the volume ff. 69-192, frequently misnumbered).

(Alexander VII, Pope). Insignia, Nomina, Cognomina...Cardinalium in Consistorio Secreto...9 Aprilis 1657 creatorum & publicatorum. Broadside, printed on occasion of the secret consistorium of April 9, 1657, when Pope Alexander VII named 9 new cardinals, of whom six were made public. The names of the six: his nephew Flavio Chigi, Camillo Melzi, Giulio Rospigliosi, Niccolo Guido Bagno, Girolamo Buonvisi, and Francesco Paolucci, are published with their arms in this broadside.

It contains on top the arms of Pope Alexander VII and Sts. Peter and Paul in woodcut, colored by hand; the text contains the six arms of the cardinals, colored by hand, with the cardinals' hats printed in red. Large folio, folded. See Pastor XIV/1, p. 394.

Conclave fatto per la Sede Vacante d'Innocentio X ristretto nelle cose piu particolari nel quale fu creato...Fabio Ghisi...detto Alessandro Settimo. Detailed account of the Papal Conclave in which Fabio Chigi was elected Pope Alexander VII on April 7, 1655. With a list of the attending cardinals at the end. Title and 44 pages, numbered ff. 196-217.

(Innocent X, Pope). Insignia, Nomina, Cognomina... Cardinalium...in Consistorio Secreto die 2 Marti 1654 pronounciatorum... Printed broadside on the 9 cardinals named by Pope Innocent X on March 2, 1654. Contains the amorial woodcuts of the Pope and the cardinals; those of the cardinals have the cardinals' hats printed in red. Large folio, folded. 1 page (f. 219). See Pastor XIV/1, pp. 142-143.
(Multi versi fatti nella sede vacante di Urbano Ottavo). A collection of several satirical songs, with refrains, on Urban VIII and his cardinals, in Italian. 46 pages, numbered ff. 220-242.

Passio Domini Cardinalis Sacchetti secundum Mattheum. A satirical essay in Latin concerning the intrigues against Cardinal Giulio Sacchetti who was excluded from the conclave of 1644. At the end, satirical epigrams in Latin against Pope Innocent X, with their explanation in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 244-246. 8vo.
Conclave di Papa Gregorio XV. Detailed account in Italian of the Conclave of 1621, when Alessandro Ludovisi was elected Pope Gregory XV on Feb. 9, 1621. 6 pages, numbered ff. 249-251.

Conclave nel quale fu creato Papa Clemente Ottavo. Detailed account in Italian of the Conclave of 1592, when Cardinal Ippolito Aldobrandini was elected Pope Clement VIII; with a list of cardinals casting their votes and the list of cardinals nominated by Clement VIII in October 1593 and July 1596. 47 pages, numbered ff. 253-276.
Conclave di Paolo Quinto. Detailed account of the conclave of 1605 when Camillo Borghese was elected Pope Paul V. In Italian. 64 pages, numbered ff. 277-305.
Conclave di Paolo Terzo. Account in Italian of the Conclave of 1534 when Alessandro Farnese was elected Pope Paul III. 12 pages, numbered ff. 306-311.
Urbanus VI. Account in Latin of the Conclave of 1378 when Bartolomeo Prignani was elected Pope Urban VI. Title page and 36 pages, numbered ff. 312-330.
Conclave di Clemente V. Account in Latin of the Conclave of 1305, when Bertr. de Got was elected Pope Clement V. Title and 13 pages, numbered ff. 332-339.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: documents, all but 6 in manuscript. Small folio (unless otherwise indicated). Contemporary vellum (back torn). Italy, late 18th century.

did.unittitle: Olivatius, Bartholomaeus, Archbishop of Amasia. Epistola...ad Clarum, et Populum Civitatis, et Diocesis Papiensis. Rome, Salvioni, 1770. Original edition. Ff. VII. Author's engraved arms on title; figural headpiece, engraved by Maximilian Limpach.

Stay, Benedictus. Oratio in Funere Clementis XIII... Ad Sacrum...Cardinalium Collegium. Rome, Salomini, 1769. Original edition. Ff. XIX. (One blank corner damp-marked). Engraved arms on title, vignette at end.

Benedict XIV, Pope. Trattato di Accomodamento tra la S. Sede e la Corte di Napoli Conchiuso in Roma... 1741. Concordance between Pope Benedict XIV and King Carlos IV of Bourbon aiming at an appeasement of clerical and Spanish conflicts in the Kingdom of Naples. Signed by Cardinals Valenti, Acquaviva, and the Archbishop of Tessaloniki, Celestino. 23 leaves, numbered ff. 15-37. Published 1741 (BM).

(Gregory XIV, Pope). Misc. notes concerning church matters, politics, and financial matters, with dates in the 17th and 18th centuries, written in a hand difficult to read. 5 leaves, numbered ff. 39-43, in various sizes. Latin and Italian.
Damascus. Letter, unsigned and addressed to an unknown person, dated Feb. 18, 1760, describing the earthquake of that month in the province of Damascus and on the Syrian coast. 2 pages (f. 44).

(Innocent IX, Pope). Letter dated Nov. 23, 1591, addressed to a priest named Hogarus Albertus (?), and signed Antonius Moccapadulicus (?). With notes listing persons on verso. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 46- 47.

(Bastia, Corsica). Copy of a letter, dated Nov. 20, 1765, at Bastia. Mentions accumulation of troops on the island, probably in connection with the attacks by the English, 1745 and later. 4 pages, numbered 50-51. Small 8vo.

Venice, Senate of. Discorso fatto dal Sig. Ambasciadore di Venezia al Sagro Collegio in Conclave. Copy of a statement, addressed to the Sacred College in Conclave by the Ambassador of the Republic of Venice, assuring the Cardinals of assistance in the election of a new Pope. Clement XIII had died on Feb. 2, 1769. Also, the reply of the College, thanking the Senate of Venice.
Corsica. Copia di lettera del Prd. Gnle. da Cappucini scritta al Capo ribella in Corsica. Dated Siena, July 24, 1759. 1 leaf (f. 54).

Naples, Kingdom of. Articoli segreti tra la Corte di Roma e quella del Re di Napoli. Signed: Card. Valenti (President of the Apostolic Chamber under Benedict XIV); Card. de Acquaviva; and Celestino (Archbishop of Thessalonika). Copy, undated. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 56-59.
Cornaro, of Venice. Relazione. Statement on some claim made by Cornaro. Dated Aug. 6, 1757, on the outside. 4 leaves, the last blank, numbered 60-63.

(Ferdinand IV, King of Naples and Sicily). Copy of a letter complaining about disciplinary irregularities of certain convents in Sicily. Unsigned, undated. Also a reply to the above, signed by Carlo de Marco, al Viceré; dated Naples, Dec. 17, 1768.
Parma, Duchy of. Ristretto della Risposta fatta al Manifesto di Parma sopra la Declaratoria del Breve delle Censure. After 1768. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 68-71.
(Venice, Republic of). Copy of a clerical letter dated 1764. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 72-73. Addressed to a dignified member of the Servi di Maria.
Pope, Position of the. Comments on Church literature and Church histories concerning the rights of the Pope and clergy. 8 leaves, numbered ff. 74-81.
Innocent VIII. Loanni Sacco de Ancona cubiculario et Notario nostro. Copy of a letter dated Rome, May 4, 1486. 1 leaf (f. 82).
Francesco Raimondo, of the Servites (Servi di Maria). Lettera del pre Generale de' Servi al suo Provinciale di Venezia. Copy of a letter dated Rome, Oct. 29, 1768. 1 leaf (f. 84).
Tanucci, Bernardo. Copy of a letter dated Sept. 13, 1768. 1 page (f. 86).

Maria Theresa, Empress. Imperatrice Vedova Regina d'Ungheria e Boemia... Copy of accompanying letter, dated Vienna, June 23, 1768, signed "per comando di S.M. L'Imperatrice...de Sperges." -Istruzioni Segrete per la Giunta Economale. Dated March 31, 1768, signed Gaetano Balbi. Together 7 leaves, numbered ff. 89-95.
Vienna, Court of. Compendio di Proposizioni estratte dalla notoria Istruzione dell'Imperial Regia. Corte di Vienna intorno agl'affari Ecclesiastici. Undated (1768). 3 pages, numbered ff. 96-97.
Porta Ottomana, Bailiff of. Copy of a letter dated Nov. 19, 1768, to the Bailiff of the Porta Ottomana. 1 page (f. 98).
Jesuit Order. Clerical statement. 2 pages (f. 100). Undated (c. 1768).
Jesuit Otrder. Copia della Memoria presentada a S. Sta. da Mons. Aspur Mro. di Spagna. 2 pages (f. 101). Undated.
Jesuit Order. Copia della Memoria presentata a S. Sta. dal Sig. Ambasciatore di Francia. 1-1/2 pages (f. 102). Undated.

Mantua, Congragation of the Parishes. Copia della Risposta data dalla Congregatione de Parochi di Mantova alla lettera scritta loro dal sige. Co. Giuseppe d'Avesperg. Copy of a reply, dated Mantua Nov. 26, 1768, to a letter written by Joseph Franz von Auersperg (later Bishop of Gurk and of Passau). 2 leaves, numbered ff. 104-105.
(Clement XIII, Pope). Copy of a letter to Pope Clement XIII, dated Dec. 29, 1768. 2 pages (f. 105).
Clement XIII, Pope. Copy of a letter dated Rome apud Sanctam Mariam Maiorem, Dec. 17, 1768, to the Republic of Venice, by the Pope. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 108-110.

Mirogli, Filippo. All'Illustrissimo...Monsig. Governatore di Roma in Criminalibus. Romana Plurium per il Fisco. Contro Niccolo Pagliarini Carcerato. 18 leaves, numbered ff. 112-129. Rome, per il Bernabo, 1761. Against the printer Pagliarini who had published correspondence against the Jesuits and the Papal court; he was burned in effigy but later pardoned by Pope Clement XIV. Sommario. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 130-131.

Barberi, Filippo. All'Illustrissimo...Governatore di Roma in Criminalibus. Per Niccolo Pagliarini Carcerato contro il Fisco. Replica Legae di Fatto, e di Ragione. 16 pages, numbered by hand, ff. 132-139. Rome, Bernabo, 1761.
Centomani, Gaetano. Allegazione seconda a favore di Niccolo Pagliarini in Risposta al Fisco. LII pages, numbered by hand ff. 140-165. Rome, Bernabo, 1761.
Barberi, Filippo. All'Illustrissimo...Governatore di Roma in Criminalibus... 23 pages, numbered by hand ff. 167-179. Rome, Bernabo, 1761.
Centomani, Gaetano. Allegazione giuridica a favore di Niccolo Pagliarini... 50 pages, numbered by hand ff. 181-206. Rome, Bernabo, 1761.
Marseilles. Brevissimo ragvaglio del viaggio fatto dalle Galere Pontificie nella città di Marsiglia, e loro ritorno. Papal voyage of Sept. (without year). 4 leaves, numbered ff. 208-211.
Clement XIV, Pope. Printed account of the Sacred College in Conclave Feb. 5-15, 1769, for the election of Pope Clement XIV. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 214-215. (Rome), typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1769.
Clement XIII. Sequitur allocutio SSmi. habita in Consistorio dei 2 Octobris 1758. Post-electoral speech. 3 pages, numbered ff. 216-217. In Latin.
Benedict XIV, Pope. Paragraph del Sinodo di Papa Benedetto XIV circa li fatti che si fanno in Conclave per eleggere il Papa. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 218-219.
Clement XIII, Pope. Clementi XIII, P.M. Votis Quinquennalibus. (1758). 2 leaves, numbered ff. 220-221. In Latin.
Benedict XIV, Pope. Copy of a letter to Scipione Maffei, of Verona, dated Rome, apud S. Mariam Maiorem Oct. 6, 1753. 2 pages (f. 222).

(Carlo Emmanuele IV of Savoy, King of Piedmont and Sardinia). Copy of a letter complaining about the exclusion of Cardinal Luigi Merlini from promotion to Nuncio on Nov. 26, 1753, and stating the decision to close the office of the Nuncio. 3 pages, numbered ff. 224-225. In French.
Sixtus V, Pope. Bolle delli Millioni di Sixto V. Undated. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 226-227.
Ritual. Summary of Papal discipline and ritual. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 228-231.

Sinigaglia, City of. Relazione dei gravi danni cagionati dalle dirotte pioggie...succeduti in quest'anno MDCCLXV. Sinigaglia, Appresso Giuseppe Benedetto Calvani Stampatore dell'Illustrissima Communità, (1765). 2 leaves, numbered by hand ff. 232-233. Account of the rainstorm in Sinigaglia (Ancona), July 23-Aug. 16, 1765.
Legal Cases. Sempronius censum contraxit passivum cum seio... Hypothetical law cases. 6 leaves, numbered ff. 234-239. In Latin. Undated.
Prisons. Regolamente di...nella visita delle Carceri. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 240-241. Undated.
Legal. De...in punendo sanguine... 2 leaves, numbered ff. 242-243.
Lucca, Republic of. Pro Memoria. Copy of a letter to Pope Clement XIII requesting the appointment of a new archbishop. 8 leaves, numbered ff. 244-251.
(Calcagnini, Cardinal Guido. Essendo pervenuta a nostra notizia. Statement by Cardinal Calcagnini regarding the will of Michele de Carolis. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 252-253. 4to.
Jesuit Order. Copy of a statement concerning the Jesuits in Portugal. Undated. 1 page (f. 254).
Lambertini, Cardinal, Archbishop of Bologna. Copy of a letter dated May 22, 1735. Cardinal Prospero Lambertini became Pope Benedict XIV in 1740. 1 page (f. 255).
Valenti Gonzage, Cardinal Silvio; Secretary of State. Copy of a letter by Valenti regarding irregularities during the Austrian Succession. Dated May 27, 1742. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 259-260.
Bancchieri, Cardinal Gian Francesco. Antonius S. Nicolai in Carcere Tulliano Diaconus Cardinalis Bancherius. Copy of a letter dated Palatio Apostolico Quirinali, Dec. 20, 1730. 2 pages (f. 261).

(Aldrovandi, Cardinal Pompeio). Apologia dell' Sanctissimo Aldrovandi circa il di lui biglietto scritto al Pre. Ravalli. Copy of a statement excusing Cardinal Aldrovandi for a servile letter he had written to the Camerlengo at the suggestion of the Conventual Franciscan Ravelli while in Conclave (Election of Benedict XIV), supposedly to solicit votes for himself. 2 pages, numbered f. 262. Undated (1740).
Olivieri, Orazio. Copy of a letter dated Nov. 22, 1700. 2 pages (f. 263).
Gavotti, Baroness. Pace data della Baronessa Gavotti alla Casa Santa Croce. Statement, dated Vignanello, Nov. 27, 1713, signed by the Baroness. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 265-266.
(Ricci, Michelangelo, Cardinal). With dates: May 1, 1681 and May 12, 1682. In Latin. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 267-268.
Notes on Roman history. 1 page (f. 269). Undated.
(Pius V, Pope). Cardinalis de Freca (?) par L.vo. Supplemento... Comments on the Bull "De Infenando" of Pius V. 1 page (f. 271). In Latin and Italian.
Monuments. In discursis de monumentis...ad perpetua memoria... 1 page (f. 272). Undated.
Clement XIII, Pope. Discorso...fatto nel consistorio segreto delli...1758. Addressed to Mons. Giacomeli. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 273-274.
(Bona, Cardinal Giovanni). Traduzione del Francese di lettera di M. Arnaldo (Arnault?) scrittà al Card. Bona... Copy of Italian translation, with date 1765. 3 pages, numbered ff. 275-276.
Portocarrero, Joaquin Fernando, Viceroy of Naples. Testamento. Copy of will; died in Rome June 22, 1760. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 277-279.

(Gaillard, General Procurer of the Carthusian Order). Copy of a letter written on behalf of the French Ambassador regretting the demission of Father Gaillard from his post by Pope Clement XIII. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 281-282. In French.

Pignatelli, Fabricio, Bishop of Lecce. Foglio concertato tra il Sig. Ambasciadore Cesarea Cattolica e Mons. de Ricci Segretario della Sagra Congregatione ne dell'Immunità sopra la pendenza di Mons. Vescovo di Lecce. -Lettera scritta da Mons. Vescovo di Lecce all'Imperatore Sacra Real Maestà Cesarea Cattolica. The latter dated Rome, June 4, 1718. Copies of statement about and a letter by the Bishop of Lecce concerning disobedience in his diocese. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 283-284.

Passionei, Cardinal Domenico. Copia del Biglietto del Card. Passionei a Pasqualino Betti. Copy of a letter from Passionei to the musician Betti, dated March 27. Plus an explanation of the above letter on behalf of the Cardinal Passionei, regarding a musical performance. Dated Nov. 14, 1752.
Fiscal. Voto di...Fiscale sopra la confiscazione della Legitima. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 287-288.
Fiscal. Voto di...Fiscale risoluto secondo il suo sentimento di 18 Jennaro 1749. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 289-291.

Carpegna, County of. Progetto della Corte di Francia, come mediatrice sopra l'interessi della Carpegna trà la Santa Sede, e la Corta di Vienna. Copy of the statement regarding the execution of a treaty of 1731, as a result of which Imperial troops are required to leave the County of Carpegna and Donna Laura Gabrielli will take possession. 8 leaves, numbered ff. 293-300.

Clement XI, Pope. Chirografo di Clemente XI contro il Governo. Concerning the trial of several officals of the Papal court, of which the auditor, Prospero Marefoschi, has been informed. Dated from the Palazzo Apostolico di Montecavallo, July 1718. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 301-302.

Pilate, Pontius. Copia della Sentenza data... contro Giesu figlio di Dio. Copy of a speculative sentence brought by Pilate against Jesus, in Italian, made public under Pope Innocent XII, dated Jan. 15, 1692. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 303-304.
(Aldovrandi, Cardinal Pompeio). Breve racconto della Vita del Cardinale Aldovrandi. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 305-308.
Neri, Pompeio. Copi di lettera di Pompeio Neri, uno della regenza di Firenze sopra l'affare del Consolato. Dated Florence, May 6, 1760. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 311-313.
(Benedict XIV, Pope). Account of the illness and death of Pope Benedict XIV. He died May 2, 1758. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 315-316.
Diary notes and extracts from letters. 1760-1765. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 3170318.
Naples. Lista per il nuovo Nunzio...un biglietto del Card. Valenti dell'1743. Notes for a new Nuncio. With appended notes dated 1764. 4 leaves, numbered ff. 321-324.

Jesuits. Notes regarding the verdict by the Consular Court of Marseilles against the Jesuit Order, and in particular against Antoine Lavalette, Procurer of the Jesuit Mission of St. Martinique. (1760). 5 leaves, numbered ff. 325-329.

Cenni, Lucanton. Poem on the occasion of the birthday of Pope Clement XIV (born Oct. 31, 1705), by Cenni, under the auspices of the State of Urbino and the Province of Romagna. Undated. 1 page (f. 331).
Regulations. Notes regarding the internal policies of Church administration. Undated (1760-1764). 10 leaves, numbered ff. 332-340.
Fiscal. Notes concerning the annual congresses at Rome and the dealing with financial matters of the city. (1746-1765). 9 leaves of different sizes, numbered ff. 350-358.
Taxes. Listing of dues from the various states and nations, dated Feb. 1766-May 1769. 15 leaves, numbered ff. 361-375.
Benedict XIV, Pope. Copia della Bolla di Benedicto XIV...sopra la reforma de Tribunali Promulgata l'anno 1744. 6 leaves, numbered ff. 380-385.
Taxes. Notes. 1 page (f. 392).
Averani, Giuseppe. Interpretationem iuris libri quinque. Rome, Puccinelli, 1767. Title page only, with Ottavio Puccinelli's preface "Ai cultori della Romana Giurisprudenza" on verso. 1 leaf (f. 393).
Buoi, Vitale Giuseppe, Bishop of Faenza. Epistola pastoralis ad clerum, et Populum suum. IX pages in Latin. With engraved arms on title and woodcut initial. Printed pamphlet. Rome, Palearini, 1767.
Durini, Angelo Maria, Nuncio in Warsaw. Copia della lettera del Emo. Durini. Dated, on back, 1768. 1 leaf (f. 400).

Piccolomini, Francesco Maria, Bishop of Pienza. 15 letters and documents, some of them original, dated 1757-1764, regarding the disposition of Bishop F.M. Piccolomini because of misbehavior. The letters are signed by Pope Clement XIII, the Augustinian Lorenzo Berti, by Piccolomini himself, and others. 35 leaves, numbered ff. 402-437.
Cuomo, Ignazio. Parere...Toccante il Progetto della bonificazione delle Paludi Pontine. 6 leaves, numbered by hand ff. 439-444. Printed document, not in Riccardi.
Relazione della Ribellione sequita nella darsena delle tre Galere Pontificien nella sera de 24 Agosto 1770. 5 leaves, numbered ff. 445-449.
(Buoncompagni, Antonio?). Inauguramento de Mons. Giraud fatto a Mons. Buoncompagni nel prendere la Laurea dottorale. 1 leaf (f. 450).
Index. 4 leaves.
ACTA SACRI CONCISTORII

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Acta Sancta Concistorii. 12 unnumbered and 171 numbered leaves, including index and Cardinal Santori's account of the consistories convoked by Pope Pius V and Gregory XIII from May 7, 1570 through Feb. 2, 1575. Manuscript. Small folio. Contemporary vellum.

did.unittitle: Index. 12 unnumbered leaves.

Santoro di Caserta, Giulio Antonio, Cardinal of Santa Severina. Acta Sacri Concistorii sub Pio V et Gregorio XIII Pont. Max. a die septima Maii 1570 per totum annum 1574. 171 folios, numbered. Italy, 16th century.

The acts of the consistories convoked by Popes Pius V and Gregory XIII during the period from May 7, 1570 through Feb. 2, 1575. The author of the minutes, Cardinal Santori, was one of the most eminent minds of the clergy in the 16th century and a close advisor to Pope Pius V. He was always a participant and frequently an initiator of the meetings which took place as often as once a week under Gregory.

Santori's record was published under the title Diario concistoriale , edited by Tacchi Venturi, within his series Studi e documenti di storia e diritto , Rome, 1902-1904. In the present ms. copy, there are some records of consistories left out, at the end of the reign of Pope Pius V. See Pastor, Gesch. der Päpste , vols. VIII and IX.
MISCELLANY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: documents, all but six in manuscript. Folio (unless otherwise stated). Contemporary vellum. Italy, c. 1688-1712.

did.unittitle: Eminentissimi Signori. An unsigned and undated report on church matters, heresy, etc., mentioning two letters submitted to Pope Innocent XII in 1697 and 1698. 3 unnumbered pages. Large folio, folded.
Macchiavelli, Marchese Filippo. Letter to a Cardinal. Unsigned, undated. 3 pages and address, numbered ff. 22-23.
Geografia Vescovale Moderna... List of bishoprics all over the world, including Asia and America. In 2 columns. 7 leaves, marked ff. 24-30.
Indice Cronologico et Alfabetico de Padri Piu Celebri. List of the most famous Church Fathers, with their dates. 3 columns on 2 pages (f. 31).

Universalia Serie di Tutti li Concilii... Chronological list of Church Councils from the year 34 to 1653. On the last page is a list of authors who have written about councils. 22 leaves, numbered ff. 32-53.
Notizie di Diversi Riti della Chiesa. List of Church rites and the dates and places of their introduction. 3 pages, numbered ff. 54-55.

La Piazza della Vittoria in Parigi in cui il Duca della Fogliada ha fatto erigere la seguente Machina ad onore di il Suo Re Luigi XIV. On construcions and decorations erected in Paris for King Louis XIV by the Duca della Fogliada (the French 17th century architect Delafeuille de Merville?) in 1688 (1685?). 4 leaves, numbered ff. 56-59.

Cavicleo (?) della Corte di Vienna, li X Luglio 1710. A roster of the household of the Court of Vienna in 1710, containing the names and duties of the high officials and of the various councils. 3 leaves, numbered ff. 60-63. 4to.

Martedi 2:7bre 1710-Giovedi 4:7bre 1710. An account of the three-day visit in 1710 to the Principe di Avallino by members of the Royal Secretariat. 2 pages and one blank leaf, numbered ff. 64 and 67. 4to.
Civita Vecchia, 22 Marzo 1712. Report of a bombardment during the War of the Spanish Succession. 3 pages, numbered ff. 65-66. 4to.

(Clement XI. Sept. 24, 1708). Copy of a Latin document, containing Pope Clement XI's statement, endorsed by the Cardinals, that the Church, which had suffered much during the War of the Spanish Succession, would take money from the treasury of Pope Sixtus V deposited in the Castle of S. Angelo. See Pastor XV, p. 42. The original of this document is in the Vatican Library. 11 pages, numbered ff. 68-73.

Roma, 9 Ottobre 1708. Description of the ceremonious unlocking of the doors of the Castle of S. Angelo by the Cardinals in order to take the money from the treasury of Sixtus V (see above, no. 11). 3 pages, numbered ff. 75-76. 8vo.

Capitoli Concordati...Senato di Bologna li 14 Novembre 1708. Agreements between the city of Bologna and the Count of Tarn (?) concerning foreign and papal troops passing through the city and concerning hostages, dated Nov. 14, 1708, during the War of the Spanish Succession. 1 page (f. 77).
Copia de Capitoli del Agiustamento tra la Corte di Roma e di Vienna. Copy of an agreement, consisting of 14 points, between the courts of Rome and Vienna, dated Jan. 1709. 2 pages (f. 78).

Ristretto delle Capitolazioni concordate...delli 15 Gennario 1709, tra...Card. Paulucci...e...Marchese di Prié. Excerpts of the agreement in 22 points between Cardinal Paolucci for the Roman Church and the Marquis of Prié for the Emperor, dated Jan. 15, 1709. 4 pages, numbered ff. 79-80.

Points de Traité que le Roy de Suede a fait conclure entre le Roy Stanislas de Pologne et le Roy Electeur de Saxe publié le 14 Novembre 1706. 22 points of the Peace Treaty between Saxony and Poland. In French. 4 pages, numbered ff. 83-84. 8vo.

Oudenarden li 13 Luglio 1708. Draft of an account in Italian of the French defeat in Belgium by Prince Eugene of Savoy and Marlborough. Not signed, obviously by an eyewitness, enumerating casualties, prisoners taken, etc. 2 pages (f. 89). 8vo.
Li progretti di pace fatti proponere nuovamente. 14 Febraio 1710. Preliminary peace proposals to bring the War of the Spanish Succession to an end. 1-1/2 pages (f. 86).

Proposizioni ereticali abiurate del Sacerdote D. Giuseppe Beccarelli...nella Piazza del Duomo di Brescia. Giuseppe Beccarelli (1666-1716), priest in Urago d'Oglio, near Brescia, was accused of heretical views and condemned by Giovanni Badoer, Cardinal of Brescia, on 13 Sept., 1710, to prison for life. With a copy of a letter by the Venetian Senate to Cardinal Badoer. 2 leaves, numbered ff. 87 and 89. Large folio, folded.
Copia Pacis Inter Czarum et Sultanum. Copy of the Peace terms in Latin between Peter I and the Turks, dated July 12, 1711. 4 pages, numbered ff. 91-92. 8vo.

(Conclave of 1689). The original ballot, printed in red and black, of the Conclave of 1689 which elected Pietro Vito Ottoboni as Pope Alexander VIII on October 6. The names of the voting clerics are printed in black on red lines with some names (of other candidates?) added in ink. 1 page (f. 92). Double folio, folded.

Notizie del Conclave per la Morte di Papa Innocenzo XI...per l'eletione di Papa Alessandre VIII creato le 6 Ottobre 1689. Daily record of the conclave of 1689 that sat from Aug. 24 to Oct. 6, before the final vote was cast. With a list of the voting Cardinals, giving the dates of their birth and of their appointment. 4 pages, numbered ff. 93-94.

Notizie del Conclave per la morte di Papa Alessandro VIII...per l'elettione di Papa Innocenzio XII. Daily record of the Conclave of 1691 that sat from Feb. 21 to July 12, before the final vote was cast. 4 pages, numbered ff. 96-97.

Notizie del Conclave per la morta di Papa Innocenzo XII...per l'elettione di Papa Clemente XI... Daily record of the Conclave of 1700 that sat from Oct. 31 to Nov. 23, when the final vote was cast for Clement XI. With a list of the voting Cardinals, giving their dates of birth and of their appointment. 4 pages, numbered ff. 98-99.
(Comparative table of monetary values). Comparing the scudo with money of the Papal States, the giulio and the baiacco . 3 pages, numbered ff. 100-101.

Conto di Spese fatte nella Villeggiatura di Vicovaro... A detailed account of the moneys spent during a vacation in Vicovaro (near Tivoli) from October 7 to December 27, 1708; the accounts are specified as to food, beverages, carriages and horses, tips, etc. In 2 columns. 4 pages, numbered ff. 102-103.

Crispino, Giuseppe. Memoriale contra la monache d'Amelia. A memoir by Giuseppe Crispino (c. 1635- 1721), Bishop of Amelia, on the state of the monasteries of the diocese of Amelia. 4 pages, numbered ff. 104-105. In 1702, Crispino published Relatio Status Ecclesiae Amerinae ad Clementum XI.

Historici Successi di Monsignore Crispino Vescovo de Amelia. Biographical notices on outstanding bishops, probably in reference to Crispino's Il Boun Vescovo , 1685 and mentioning his Relatio Status Ecclesiae Amerinae (see above, no. 27). 8 pages, numbered ff. 106-109. 8vo.
Proviste Uscita Primo Gennaro 1708. Lists of clerical appointments on the first of January, 1708. 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 110-113.
Nota di Proviste fatta da N.S... List of clerical appointments, dated Aug. 21, 1708. 2 pages (f. 114).
Nota di Proviste fatta da N.S... List of clerical appointments of Aug. 16, 1709. 3 pages, numbered ff. 115-116.
Mutationi e Proviste fatta da N.S... List of clerical appointments, dated Dec. 8, 1709. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 116-117.
Governatori. List of governors in the various provinces of Italy, undated. 2 pages (f. 118).
3 Ottobre, 1708. Statutes concerning a monastery. 1 page (f. 119).
Nuovo...per la Dame nell'Anno 1708. Directions for ladies going to church, in 8 points. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 120 and 122.
Carlo e Mauritio D'Aste, Monserrato. Short letter addressed to them, dated July 19, 1709. 1 page and address (f. 121). Oblong 8vo.
(A list of druggists, butchers, fruit vendors, etc.). with their addresses in Rome, dated 1708. 1 page (f. 123). 8vo.
La Reverenda Camera Apostolica alla Santita di...Papa Clemente XI. A long letter in Italian, undated and unsigned, to Pope Clement XI (1700-1721). 33 pages numbered ff. 124-140.
Protesta del Tribunale della Camera, alla...Papa Clemente XI, 1708. 9 pages, numbered ff. 142-146.

Oratio habita a...Clem. XI in Consistorio...16 Martii 1712 in Morte Delphini... Latin speech by Pope Clement XI on occasion of the death of Charles VI's nephew, who died Feb. 18, 1712. 2 pages (f. 148).
(Louis XIV). Discorso del Re Christianissimo al Re Giacomo III della Gran Bretagna...Scotia, Marzo 1708. Louis XIV's discourse to James III, in Italian. 3 pages, numbered ff. 149-150.
Orsini, Cardinal. Lettera al Papa (Clement XI). Copy in Italian, dated Jan. 17, 1708. 7 pages, numbered ff. 156-159.
Paolucci, Cardinal. Copia di lettera...al Card. Pignatelli...16 di Giugno 1708. Letters concerning the edicts of Naples and Milan. 4 pages, numbered ff. 160-161.
Dispaccio in Data de 18 Feb. 1708 da Barcellona... 3 Dispatches from Barcelona of Feb. and March 1708 concerning the edicts of Milan and Naples. 4 pages, numbered ff. 163-164.
Dispaccio...da Barcellona... 2 dispatches, dated Barcelona and Naples, March 1708, concerning the edicts of Milan and Naples. 1-1/2 pages (f. 165).
Joseph I. Lettera a Papa Clemente XI... Copy of a letter in Italian, written by the Emperor to Clement XI on July 9, 1708, concerning Naples and Milan. 3 pages, numbered ff. 166-167.

Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo. Lettera a vescovi di Regno...28 Luglio 1708...contre le Persone destinate ad esigere Le Rendite de Beneficii ecclesiastici. Copy of a letter by Cardinal Grimani, then Viceroy of Naples. 2 pages (f. 168).
(Bartholomaeus Gambadoro, Bishop of Ruvo). Letter in Italian to Cardinal Grimani, Viceroy of Naples, dated Aug. 11, 1708. 1 page (f. 169).
Archinto, Cardinal Giuseppe. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Paolucci, dated July 4, 1708. - Charles III. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Giuseppe Archinto, dated July 20, 1708. 2 pages (f. 171).

Lettera Circolante scritta del Segretaria di Stato à Tutti i Vescovi del Regno di Napoli, e Stato di Milano...concernente gli Sequestri de Beneficii eccli. Copy of a circulatory letter by Cardinal Paolucci to the Bishops of Milan and Naples, July 6, 1708. 2 pages (f. 172).
Clement XI, Pope. Copy of a letter in Latin to Cardinal Vincenzo Grimani, dated Sept. 1, 1708, when he was Viceroy of Naples. 5 pages, numbered ff. 174-176.
Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo, Viceroy of Naples. Copy of a letter in Italian, dated Naples, Sept. 22, 1708, and referring to the circulatory letter (see above, no. 50). 2 pages (f. 178).
Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo, Viceroy of Naples. of a letter in Italian, dated Naples, Sept. 20, 1708, Marquis of Prié (?). 6 pages, numbered ff. 179-181.

Carpegna, Gaspare, Cardinal. Copy of a letter in Italian to Cardinal Vincenzo Grimani, Viceroy of Naples, dated Rome, Oct. 13, 1708. With Grimani's answer to him, dated Naples, Oct. 20, 1708. 4 pages, numbered ff. 183-184.
Riflessi sopra Liti mori per l'edito di Carlo in Napoli e Milano 1708. Document in Italian. Unsigned. 8 pages, numbered ff. 187-190.

Copia di Biglietto da un Cavaliere d'onore della Regina Vedova di Bolonia al Cardinal Gualtieri. La Sera Praecedente al...de Consistorio Publico... Copy of a letter to Cardinal Gualtieri, dated March 22, 1708. 1 page (f. 191).
Moles, Duca. Copy of a letter in Italian to Cardinal Orsini in Barcelona, of April 28, 1708. 4 pages, numbered ff. 192-193.
Prié, Marquis de, and Pope Clement XI. Correspondence in Italian, concerning a proposal made by Prié, in copies. One letter dated Sept. 20, 1708. 23 pages, numbered ff. 197-208.
Tessé, J.B.R. de Froulay. Copy of a letter in Italian to Pope Clement XI, Dated Dec. 16, 1708. Tessé was at the time the Plenipotentiary of Louis XIV in Rome. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 209-210.
Tessé, J.B.R. de Froulay. Copies of 2 more letters in Italian to Pope Clement XI, dated Jan. 2, 1709 and Feb. 13, 1709. 3 pages, numbered ff. 211-212.
Monte Albano, Duke Osseda, Count di. Copy of a letter by the ambassador of Philip V of Spain to the Pope, probably Clement XI. Undated. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 214-215.

Bonneval, Alexander von. Copy of an edict published by the general of the Imperial troops in Comacchio, July 8, 1708. The Imperial troops under Bonneval had taken Comacchio on May 24, 1708. 2 pages (f. 216).
Grimani, Cardinal Vincenzo. Copy of a letter to Paolucci, dated June 29, 1708. 4 pages, numbered ff. 217-218.
(Paolucci, Cardinal Fabrizio). Copy of Paolucci's answer to Grimani's letter of June 29, concerning Comacchio. Dated July 6, 1708. 6-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 220-223.
Joseph I. Copy of a letter, written by the Emperor to all Cardinals, concerning the status of Parma and Piacenza, dated June 27, 1708. 2 pages (f. 224).

(Clement XI, Pope). Declaratio Nullitatis...super hybernis stationibus quas Milites Germani in Ducatu Parmae, & Placentiae locarunt. Printed Papal breve against the German positions in Parma and Piacenza of July 27, 1707. 12 pages, withthe Papal arms on the title. Romae, ex typog. Rev. Cam. Apost., 1707. 4to, uncut. 12 pages, numbered in ink ff. 227-229.

Clement XI. Copy of a breve, dated June 2, 1708, addressed to Victor Amadeus II, Duke of Savoy, concerning the German invasion of Comacchio. With a copy of the answer by the Duke, dated June 27, 1708. 2 pages (f. 230).

Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Grimani, Viceroy of Naples, dated July 21, 1708, concerning Joseph I's letter to the Cardinals of June 27 (see above, no. 65). With Grimani's answer to Carpegna, dated Aug. 4, 1708. 7 pages, numbered ff. 231-234.
S. Collegio dei Cardinali. Copy of a letter in Latin to the Cardinal of Saxony, dated Aug. 12, 1708. 2 pages (f. 235).
(S. Collegio dei Cardinali?). Copy of a letter in Latin to Emperor Joseph I. Dated Rome, Aug. 12, 1708. 7 pages, numbered ff. 236-239. 8vo.
Lettera di N.S. all'Imperatore. Copy of a letter in Latin by Pope Clement XI to Emperor Joseph I, 1708. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 241-242.

(Philip V of Spain). Copy of a letter in Italian, written by Giovanni Milan di Aragon, dated Madrid, June 19, 1709, addressed to Rome, announcing the closing of the nunciature in Madrid and of any commerce with Rome. 3-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 243- 244.
Medici, Giovanni Gastone d', Grand Duke of Tuscany. Copy of a letter to Cardinal Lod. M. Pandolfini of Bologna, dated Florence, June 19, 1709. 1 page (f. 245).
Medici, Giovanni Gastone d', Grand Duke of Tuscany. Copy of a letter to Card. Lod. M. Pandolfini, July 23, 1709. 1 page (f. 246).
Saverio Azzoni, F. Francesco. Copy of a letter to Ulisse Vincenti in Rome, dated Malta, Oct. 25, 1709. 2-1/2 pages, numbered ff. 247-248. 8vo.
Perellos. Copy of a letter to Sacchetti in Rome, dated Malta, Oct. 25, 1709. 2 pages (f. 249). 8vo.
Bouglione, Cardinal. Copy of a letter in Italian to King Louis XIV of France, dated May 22, 1710. 3 pages, numbered ff. 248-249.
Louis XIV, King of France. Copy of a letter, in Italian, by the King of France to his ambassador in Rome, Cardinal Trémoille, dated Paris, July 10, 1710. 3 pages, numbered ff. 250-251.
Assumar, Cardinal, Ambassador of Portugal in Barcelona. Copy of a letter in Italian to Signor Inviato of Portugal in Rome, dated Saragozza, Aug. 22, 1710. 3 pages, numbered ff. 252-253.
Gigli, Marcus. Copy of a letter in Latin to Gregorio d'Aste, dated Rome, Oct. 1710. 3 pages, numbered ff. 254-255.
(Rome, April 21, 1712). Account in Italian of a church procession in Rome celebrating the canonization of Pius V (May 5, 1712) by Pope Clement XI. 3 pages, numbered ff. 256-257.

Aelius, Sex. Acropolitanus. Ad Eumenem Parthenium Epistolae. Printed letter in Latin. 8 pages, numbered in ink ff. 258-261. N.p., 1700. Apparently a very rare theological letter, not in the BM or BN catalogues.

Cloche, Antonin. Salutem...& Mortis Recordationem. Printed oration in Latin on the death of Horatio Albani, brother of Pope Clement XI, by A. Cloche, General of the Dominicans. Dated Rome, Jan. 29, 1712. 2 pages (numbered in ink f. 262). Apparently very rare, not in the catalogues of the BM or BN.

Titoli et honori che concede S.M. Cesarea. List of the titles and honors granted by the Emperor, probably Joseph I, and the amount of money that went into the titles. Undated. 4 pages, numbered ff. 263-264. Folio, folded.
(Latin Sermon on Martyrs). Undated and unsigned. 3 pages, numbered ff. 265-266.
L'Officio del Segretario di Camera in Ferrara. A brief of complaint, undated and unsigned, concerning certain posts being taken over by secular officials. 3 pages, numbered ff. 267-268.

(Collegio Germanico--Ungarico, Roma). Examen pro admittendis inter alumnos Colegii Germanici, & Ungarici Urbis. A printed Latin questionnaire for admittance into the Jesuit Collegium Germanicum- Ungaricum, which was founded in Rome in 1552. The questionnaire, consisting of 29 questions altogether, contains the questions in the left column; the right column, headed Responsiones , is left free for the answers to be filled in. 4 pages, numbered in ink ff. 273-274.

(Innocent XI, Pope). Resolution to reduce the cost of canonizations. Report, in Italian, by several Cardinals, with specified lists of the costs. It seems that Innocent XI (1676-1689) had appointed a fact-finding committee to study the problem. The present report is approved on the last page, with the date July 20, 1690. 8 pages, numbered ff. 275-278.

Feria S. Die 8 Augusti 1709. Document in Latin, concerning the long feud between Rome and the Jesuit missionaries in China, who practiced unorthodox rites, referring to earlier decrees of 1704 and 1707, to Thournon, etc. 2 pages (f. 279).

(Maxamilien Emanuel, Elector of Bavaria). Protestatio Serenissimi Electoris Bavariae. Printed text, with Latin and Italian in facing columns. Dated Namur, July 7, 1711. 4 leaves (the last is blank), paginated a-f (numbered in ink ff. 280-283). N.p., n.d.

Mattei, Monsignor. Orazione fatta nel sua publico Ingresso della Nunziatura in Venezia li 5 Ottobre 1711. Copy of the speech, together with the copy of the answer. 4 pages, numbered ff. 285-286. Large folio, folded.
Carpegna, Cardinal Gaspare. A short note in Latin, dated Sept. 22, 1711, with a postscript of Sept. 23, concerning José Molines, General Inquisitor of Spain. 1 page (f. 287). Oblong 8vo.

Pasquino Viandanto, ò Papagiero. A long Italian satirical poem in tercets, on events in the Roman Church, missions, etc., dated 1708. The names of some of the persons alluded to in the poem are given in marginal notes. 27 pages, numbered ff. 288-301.
A Monsig. Monti. -Al Sig. Pier Luigi Loccarini (Lucarini). Two Italian satirical poems in tercets, concerning missionaries. 5 pages, numbered ff. 302-304.
Al Sig. Pomeo Bevardi. Italian poem in two parts: a satire in tercets with many of the persons alluded to named in marginal notes. Unsigned and undated. 10 pages, numbered ff. 306-311.
Al Sig. Monaldi. Italian poem in praise of Carlo Monaldi (c. 1690-1760), Roman sculptor. Undated, unsigned. 4 pages, numbered ff. 312-313. Large folio, folded.

Sermo Primus. Latin sermon in hexameters, with notes at the end, giving explanations in Italian and the names of the persons alluded to, among them the painter and cariacturist Pietro Ghezzi, a.o. Undated and unsigned. 6 pages, numbered ff. 314-316.
Sonnet. Draft of an Italian sonnet on love. 1 page (f. 318).
Fatt'hormai falegname, o Dio d'Amore. A sonnet, signed H.H. 1 page (f. 319).
Ceciliae Turchiae Romanae. A Latin poem, unsigned and undated. 1 page (f. 320).
Per la Morte dell'Imperatore. Italian sonnet on the death of the Emperor (Joseph I (?), d. 1711). 1 page (f. 321).
Particulas Vini, puras quas reddidit ignis. A short Latin poem, ending "ad Aram Pectinis Etruscum carmen in obsequium." 1 page (f. 322). 4to.
Sonnet. An Italian sonetto. 1 page (f. 323). 4to.
Porporato Signore a te'm'invia. Italian poem. 2 pages (f. 324). 4to.
Per Illustrissima Signora Maria d'Aste. Italian sonnet. 1 page (f. 325). 4to.
Nelle partenza da Roma da 3 (Juli 1708) del Marchese Morbelli. Italian sonnet. 1 page (f. 326). 4to.
L'Imperatrice Madre a Giuseppe Primo. -Risposta delle Imperatore all'Imperadrice Madre. Two sonnets: to Joseph from his mother and his answer to her. 2 pages, numbered ff. 327-328. 4to.
Di casto Amor la nobil face accessa. Italian sonnet. 1 page (f. 329). 4to.
Bellezze della Diva d'Apollo. Italian sonnet. 1 page (f. 330). 4to.
Firsi Sol del mio Cor. Italian sonnet. 1 page (f. 331). 4to.
...Fido Amante. Italian love poem. 1 page (f. 332. 4to.
Sonetto. Italian sonnet, with corrections and a small sketch of a church. 1 page (f. 333). 4to.
Amore regniato con infida amante. Italian sonnet. 1 page, numbered ff. 334. 4to.
(Italian sonnet). 1 page (f. 335). 4to.
Squarcio all'Iberia col. rapace artiglio. -D'Anglia, d'Austria, d'Olanda il furor misto. 2 sonnets concerning the War of the Spanish Succession. 2 pages (f. 341). 8vo.
Risolvo e dio adesso in tutta fretta. Italian poem. 1 page (f. 342). 8vo.
Nel vedersi il Ritratto della Signora Propesta Ruffo di Bueno... -Propesta del C.N.N. -Risposta. Three sonnets. 3 pages, numbered ff. 343-344. 4to.
